story:
Keep The Blues Alive

My name is Kris, Owner and Operator of the most unusual Blues place named Cafe Charlie - Where Cool Rules. 

Originally from Europe, I was trying to keep two Continents together by having an Italian Coffee Shop by day and a Blues Lounge at night. 

Blues, which is my passion for four decades now.

The whole idea of this campaign is to help improve and maintain the venue in supporting live music and local, national and international artists.

Cafe Charlie has been in business for a year, voted "Clearwater's Home of Blues" with a great number of Blues artists playing four times a week. It was also voted as the fastest growing Blues Jam in Pinellas County.

At Cafe Charlie we serve beer and wine only and offer a selection of sandwiches and some ethnic food and pastries. 

Most of the money will go in remodeling the kitchen to satisfy Florida Laws for Restaurants which  directly will increase the number of customers on music nights, and support Cafe Charlie's solo, duo or band acts and artists.

Throughout the summer businesses in Florida suffer. Contributions will keep this venue open and operating so that customers can continue to enjoy good food, good coffee, and the Blues. The kitchen will be improved and the business will keep having gigs and musicians will get paid !

story:
About The Union Gospel

The Union Gospel is an American Alternative Rock, conceived in February 2012 when Mike Squires and Dejha Colantuono began writing songs remotely between Seattle and NYC. The songwriting partnership inspired the formation of Rock 'n' Roll outfit, The Union Gospel. We are making our debut record and we need a little help from our friends, family and anyone who loves good music!!! 

The Union Gospel is currently recording their first full-length album at Jupiter Studios with Producer Martin Feveyear, which is scheduled for release in early 2016.

Purveyors of The Gospel

Dejha Colantuono: Singer, songwriter, and composer.  Known for: The Pin-Ups, Rotten Apples, Ragazza,  and Blackie (a tribute to Blondie.)

Mike Squires: Guitar player, musician, composer. Known for: Loaded (fronted by Guns N' Roses bassist Duff McKagan,) Eat the Feeling, Nevada Bachelors, Harvey Danger, Alien Crime Syndicate, and The Long Winters. 

Jonny Cragg: Drummer, musician. Known for: Space Hog, The Pierces, and Supergrass.

Eric Corson:  Bass player, multi-instrumentalist, engineer, and producer. Known for: The Long Winters, and The Posies.

Spreading the Gospel

No matter how big or small, your contribution means the world to us! We've created  some perks that we hope will make you feel as appreciated as you are!!! Every donation gets a digital shout out on our site, we want to thank you in front of the whole world! A donation at or above the first tier (24 bucks) will earn you a download of the complete album before it is officially released to the public. Chew on that, cool kids! Here are some things you will receive:

  • Music!
  • T-Shirts!
  • A cover song, chosen by you, recorded for you, and delivered exclusively to you!
  • Big old shout outs on the interwebz!
  • House party performances!

Here is how we are going use your kind contributions

  • Production - Martin Feveyear has worked with everyone from Mudhoney to The Kings of Leon and Brandi Carlile. We are truly blessed to have the privilege of his experience and skill.

  • Pressing the actual records - 500 limited release pieces of vinyl. Yes - vinyl.
  • Marketing - Even with social media in the mix, marketing is not free! We have costs to cover for everything from our website to t-shirts, logo design, and publicity for our shows.

  • Shows and Touring - If we’re gonna sell this album, we have to get it ourselves in front of people!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute monetarily - that's cool, we know the rent is TOO DAMN HIGH. You can still do great things by SPREADING THE GOSPEL

  • Tell all your friends!
  • Share this out on your social media poison of choice!!
  • Email the link to anyone you know who likes good music!

THANK YOU, NO MATTER WHAT YOU CAN DO - WE LOVE YOU!

story:
Help bring live music to Homecoming 2015

2 local bands are fired up to bring great music to the celebration....  we just need to raise a little more money to pay for sound equipment rental, setup and musician stipends.

  • The Whitecaps-  featuring Nate Swiston, Drums - Bob Jaskowiak, Keyboard - Karl Kastrosky, Lead Guitar/Vocals - Tom Marincel, Bass Guitar/Vocals
  • Room 2 Groove- featuring Washburn Mayor, Scott Griffiths- Vocals, Percussion ; Andy Noyes- Guitar, Vocals;  David Blong- Guitar, Vocals;  Brian Heeringa- Drum Set;  Rose S. Sandberg- Keys,Vocals; Michael McKenna- Percussion; Jordan Pelsue- Bass
What We Need & What You Get

Several local businesses have contributed to make this happen, now we just need a few more small donations from the folks that want to enjoy the party!

The Impact

It's like paying your cover charge ahead of time... It's a free event, but we all know there's really no such thing as a free lunch... or free live music for that matter.

story:
While the Indiegogo campaign is closed, people have asked whether they can still give to support the album - the answer is yes, and, please do! right here: lizhuff.net



How we got here:

Hey, y’all! I’m making a Christmas album! Which, for me, begs the question, how did I get here?! Short answer: Singing at the wedding of one of my best friends and a plane ride. The longer answer is a little more complicated and I hope to answer that with the video and what you’re reading right now. And the complete answer? Well, that starts when I was maybe two. Will have to check with my parents on that one, to see when I started singing and making music, but I know it was early on. 

Here's me making some music today:


Setting the Scene:

I’ve just sung Gershwin’s Love is Here To Stay in a fairy tale setting in Silver Lake, up in the hills of Los Angeles. Spanish house, tiled courtyard with twinkly lights, handsome couple, lovely guests, a magical evening in early October. I’m sitting on a couch, when another guest joins me, and seemingly out of the blue, he asks, “Do you have a Christmas album?” Me: “uh, no?” (buh?) He went on to say, “You should! I’d buy it!” Hmm. Tucked that thought away for later, sang some more and enjoyed the rest of the evening.

Thinking about it:

Fast forward to about 36 hours later, our flight home. In-flight movie, Begin Again, starring Mark Ruffalo as down-on-his luck record producer and Keira Knightly as fledgling singer/songwriter who just needs a break. They meet, and as luck or serendipity would have it, record an album on the run, guerilla-style, in locations all over NYC. I’m watching this movie/scenario unfold and then pause to look at the sky, “Okay, universe, I get it! Gotta think about this Christmas album thing.”

Realizing the dream:

Back home in Cleveland I start thinking about the idea, wondering if I’m crazy, but – I used to work at a record company, so I know how that part of the business works. I *am* a trained musician and pretty decent, if I say so myself. I am blessed with lots of friends who also happen to be musicians, and with whom I’d dearly love to collaborate on a project like this, not to mention I really like the idea of creating paying gigs for fellow musicians and other artists who’d be involved in the project.

Why Christmas music, why now?

Having gotten to the notion that I really liked the idea of making an album, thought harder about the idea of it being specifically of Christmas music, and came up with a resounding "Yes!"  Why? Well! Let me tell you:  I love Christmas - I love the decorations, the music, the parties, and yes, the sentiment of wishing for peace on the earth, good will to men. (For men, women, Whovians, all of us, yes, I like that idea! Oops, let my nerdy side show, there.)

The Music:

So - imagine you've supported this project and then one day a cd magically arrives in the mail and you open it, and - what do you find?

Not one, but TWO kinds of Christmas music!  I am enamored of both jazz-flavored Christmas standards and Celtic-flavored, sparser styles, and thought, "Let's do both!" but not all mushed together, as that'd be a little weird. We're doing a Side A/Side B thing; one half more jazzy, the other a little more Irish.

Here's one on the jazzy side: 'Zat You, Santa Claus?

Where You Come In:

Most amazing and wondrous to me: every time I’ve said these words out loud , “Hey, I’m thinking about making a Christmas album,” the person I’m talking to says, “Great/that’s cool/that’s awesome AND, I’d buy that!” Which is fantastic, cuz it’d make me super sad to put this cool thing together only to have it languish on one of my dusty bookshelves….

That’s where you, lovely people, come in! I’ve mentioned collaboration – absolutely necessary to make music and a joyful thing, and necessary to make this dream come true! I can’t make the music alone, and I can’t make the project happen alone either. I’m asking you to take a chance on this dream with me by supporting the project here on Kickstarter. Take a chance on our dream, and I’ll make sure you get something wonderful and sparkly marvelous back! 

So, how about it? You in?

 The Details:

Cool people involved include the following:

• Jordan Cooper on piano, also music director for this shindig. Jordan’s amazing – he was pianist and music director for The Light in the Piazza at Lakeland Civic Theatre in 2014. Piazza is one of my favorite shows I’ve ever done, largely due to the cast, director, and people like Jordan!

• Linda White, flute – an amazing player and really cool person, check her out here: Linda White.

• Bob Gruca, guitar – also an amazing player (really, all of these people are) and he cracks me up. Bonus! Robert Gruca.

• Ariel Clayton Karas, violin - more awesome sauce. Check out Ariel here: Ariel!

• Mister Joe Barone, pianist and my official Overseer-of-Things. Joe keeps an eye on things and makes sure it all runs smoothly, with the occasional wise-crack or five.

• Lindsay Krause Wissman, video – Linds made the fantastic video you’ve been viewing. She also makes cool knit stuff, what! Check her out at Etsy: Running with Sharpies.

• Marshall Griffith, piano - one of my theory teachers whilst at CIM, now a colleague and friend: Marshall!  

• Justin Hart, drummer - worked with Justin on The Light in the Piazza  at Lakeland, very happy to have him on board!

• Tim Keo, upright bassist extraordinaire  - woot! 

• Brian Mueller, ukelele (also plays bass guitar, mandolin and many other things)

Budget, or, Where’s This Money Going?

• The recording studio! I want to make this album sound the best it can, the best WE can, hence working with Audio Recording Studio (they work with the Cleveland Orchestra and smaller groups, how lucky am I?) This starts with two days in July, then more in August.

• The musicians! See above 

• Making the CDs! 

• Making the little sleeve/box things the CDs come in! And cover art, let’s not forget that!

• Mechanical licensing and rights to songs 

• Photography - also creates work for local people, yay! Beth Segal does gorgeous work!

• Christmas ornaments for the Super Deluxe version of the album

Over and beyond the goal:

Monies above and beyond our goal would help us improve some of the things listed above, such as more money for cover art, photography, etc, and allow us to do things like have a CD release party and do more to promote the album once it’s done. Every little bit helps!

story:
Nate Jordan. 

 A rapper describes me, but an artist better defines who I am. I have been creatively and actively pursuing the arts for 12 years now. Every leg of the journey has brought me into contact with amazing people, at this pivotal point in the journey I am in contact with you.



 A Fundraising Campaign for:

  Red Emotion, my new Album 

    Specifically:
  • Music Videos (for the first two singles. The need is for the rental of camera equipment and helping hands.)
  • Web/Blog Promotions (for sites and blogs such as Rapzilla, Noisetrade, and newH2O.)
  • Merchandise (such as new T-Shirts and physical copies of Red Emotion.)
    To clear any confusion, the album is already recorded and mixed. This fundraiser is to launch the album and make a big impact with how it is released and what it is released with.


 Perks

  Depending on how much you donate you are able to receive various items as a reward. This is the first time I have ever reached out and asked people to partner with me concerning a work of art. I do not take this partnership lightly, nor should you. I seek to honor both you, in how this goes forth, and God, in the integrity of the work.



 Is this a worthy cause? 

  Yes

   How so? The music on this project is powerful. Music has the ability to bring healing and hope. Nate Jordan's music is a powerful tool for those are struggling with various addictions or hopelessness. 

 The aim of Red Emotion is relate to others on an emotional level, a level that bypasses reason and gets straight to the heart. Music, more than almost any other medium, has the ability to speak to the heart and subsequently heal the heart. Lastly, the light of the good news is shone in the art form. Ultimately this project is a cultural artifact constructed in the hopes of bringing God glory.

 Other Ways You Can Help

  •  Noise. Make some noise and let others know about this campaign.
  • Prayer. Pray for the prosperity of this project.
  • Support. Support me in your interaction with the media and the campaign.



The End of an Era

  The video below is a compilation of videos and songs from Dream Catcher. These were done with a very small team and with little to no money. Imagine what we could do if we rally together.

story:
Hello, I’m Steve Weinberg

And I’d like to introduce you to a historic photography project I’ve been working on for several years. The 25th year anniversary for German Reunification approaches this October 3rd as a declaration upon the merits of extending an established consumer culture across the borders of the once Soviet satellite country of East Germany.

Whether or not this grand social experiment has worked one-quarter century later becomes testament to the virtues of the procession of inevitable change, as nation state borders fluctuate significantly across the passage of time.

My photographic work since the late 1980s to current times has focused upon these grand historic impulses which has affected millions while I traveled and visited several post-Soviet countries; experiencing their unique yet parallel economic shock periods leading from the former Socialist to newly introduced Western consumer markets.

Twenty-five years later depending on which country is visited, the results from advancing changes still seem incomplete. Such is the case with Germany where the former East retains glaring differences in certain parts between East and West regions of the same country. 

History is impeding in a few short weeks and it becomes necessary that I return to Berlin to continue documenting the second part of what occurred in November 2014 as part of the 25th anniversary of the opening of the Berlin Wall.

Since that time my work has received recognition from the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars located in Washington D. C. by confirming to showcase a comprehensive photo exhibit depicting Germany from the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989 leading to the present day. I have dramatic images from this entire period and now comes the historic requirement that I return to Germany once again to capture a one time occurrence for this exhibit as the 25th year anniversary of German reunification observations begin from this coming October 3, 2015. Ultimately this will be part of a book I am compiling which depicts the more comprehensive scope of change having occurred and now challenging Western values as Russia involves its interests across other nation state borders, not seen since the opening of the Berlin Wall and subsequent ending of the Cold War in the early 1990s.

For being part of this historic quest and allowing me to properly complete this work on time, there are a series of personalized incentives described in the written outline below. Starting as a $100 donor you will be cordially invited to attend the opening reception at the Wilson Center in Washington D.C. on the still to be determined date beginning from spring of 2016.

Total costs for this segment of my work includes extensive travel and ground expenses; air, car rental, assistant/translator, additional fees, etc., both inside and outside Berlin to shoot reunification events, then several outlying industrial and rural locations.  Special 35mm film stock plus processing/scanning and securing Socialist era artifacts to be used as elements for photomontage in particular photo compilations as part of the exhibit. Exchange rate from Dollars to Euros is also a consideration due to lesser value of Dollar abroad. 

The Impact:

Your contribution allows me to continue to document a vital part of world history, particularly during these precarious times when Russian resurgence in an already unstable Eastern Europe challenges an international order enabled since the end of the original Cold War. I have been on the ground shooting images in unstable regions throughout this period and this newest chapter becomes a requirement for the fulfillment of engaging the story. My previous experience most recently includes photographing with European Union border monitors between Georgia and Russian annexed territories in addition to a National Geographic travel assignment in Romania.

It becomes the urgency of the moment that certifies the reason to extend myself and capture unfolding circumstances as they occur. Afterwards, this reason becomes even more justified, as these now recent historic events will be viewed in the near future as important components for collective memory.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please tell those you know about this important historic photo documentation in process in addition to implementing social media tools for virtual impact.

Thank you very much for your attention and your appreciation to this subject.
story_txt:
Hello, I’m Steve Weinberg
And I’d like to introduce you to a historic photography
project I’ve been working on for several years. The 25th year
anniversary for German Reunification approaches this October 3rd as
a declaration upon the merits of extending an established consumer culture
across the borders of the once Soviet satellite country of East Germany.Whether or not this grand social experiment has worked one-quarter
century later becomes testament to the virtues of the procession of inevitable
change, as nation state borders fluctuate significantly across the passage of
time.
My photographic work since the late 1980s to current times
has focused upon these grand historic impulses which has affected millions
while I traveled and visited several post-Soviet countries; experiencing their
unique yet parallel economic shock periods leading from the former Socialist to
newly introduced Western consumer markets.
Twenty-five years later depending on which country is
visited, the results from advancing changes still seem incomplete. Such is the
case with Germany where the former East retains glaring differences in certain
parts between East and West regions of the same country. History is impeding in a few short weeks and it becomes
necessary that I return to Berlin to continue documenting the second part of
what occurred in November 2014 as part of the 25th anniversary of
the opening of the Berlin Wall.
Since that time my work has received recognition from the
Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars located in Washington D. C. by
confirming to showcase a comprehensive photo exhibit depicting Germany from the
fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989 leading to the present day. I have dramatic
images from this entire period and now comes the historic requirement that I
return to Germany once again to capture a one time occurrence for this exhibit as
the 25th year anniversary of German reunification observations begin
from this coming October 3, 2015. Ultimately this will be part of a book I am
compiling which depicts the more comprehensive scope of change having occurred
and now challenging Western values as Russia involves its interests across
other nation state borders, not seen since the opening of the Berlin Wall and
subsequent ending of the Cold War in the early 1990s.For being part of this historic quest and allowing me to
properly complete this work on time, there are a series of personalized
incentives described in the written outline below. Starting as a $100 donor you
will be cordially invited to attend the opening reception at the Wilson Center
in Washington D.C. on the still to be determined date beginning from spring of
2016.
Total costs for this segment of my work includes extensive travel and
ground expenses; air, car rental, assistant/translator, additional fees, etc., both inside and outside Berlin to shoot reunification events, then
several outlying industrial and rural locations.  Special 35mm film stock plus processing/scanning and securing Socialist era artifacts to be used as elements for photomontage
in particular photo compilations as part of the exhibit. Exchange rate from Dollars to Euros is also a
consideration due to lesser value of Dollar abroad. The Impact:
Your contribution allows me to continue to document a vital
part of world history, particularly during these precarious times when Russian
resurgence in an already unstable Eastern Europe challenges an international
order enabled since the end of the original Cold War. I have been on the ground
shooting images in unstable regions throughout this period and this newest
chapter becomes a requirement for the fulfillment of engaging the story. My
previous experience most recently includes photographing with European Union
border monitors between Georgia and Russian annexed territories in addition to
a National Geographic travel assignment in Romania. 
It becomes the urgency of the moment that certifies the
reason to extend myself and capture unfolding circumstances as they occur. Afterwards,
this reason becomes even more justified, as these now recent historic events
will be viewed in the near future as important components for collective
memory. 
Other Ways You Can Help:
Please tell those you know about this important historic
photo documentation in process in addition to implementing social media tools
for virtual impact.
Thank you very much for your attention and your appreciation
to this subject.

story:
Susan is a beautiful Julliard classically trained violin virtuoso who has performed for three presidents in the White House.  Then, she traded all that in for a purple flying V electric violin and Rock n’ Roll, performing with Metalica, Billy Joel, Paul McCartney, the Zombies, SOiL, and others! She was a featured instrumentalist on TV's hit show "America's Got Talent". The funds will be used for Susan’s “Miss Conduct” national tour, supporting the release of her newest CC, "Miss Conduct".

      Here is what your contribution make possible for Susan's tour and public relations campaign:

Tour transportation, lodgings  $  20,000

Band per Diems  $ 10,000

Television appearances  $ 5,000

Radio promotion/airplay  $ 3,000

Social Media  $ 5,000

Advertising  $4,000

Insurance  $ 3,000

Total funds needed: $50,000

Susan's Bio

    Susan Aquila is shaking up the world of Rock.  She has performed and recorded with the greatest icons of Rock and Pop including: Paul McCartney, Elton John, Billy Joel, Deep Purple, Beyoncé, Brittney Spears, Kanye West, Alicia Keys, John Mayer, Josh Groban, Roger Daltry, Steven Tyler, Busta Rhymes, Erykah Badu, Janelle Monae, JZ, Frank Sinatra, Jr., Johnny Mathis, Barry Manilow and a host of others.  Now, she is stepping into the spotlight out on her own.

      Susan is a double Grammy Nominee for Best New Artist and Best Rock Album of the year for her last CD ‘Broken Angel’, which propelled her into the top 5 of ReverbNation’s Artists Trending in the New York City Area, a position she held for six months this past year.  Now, after recording of her new CD ‘Miss Conduct’ with music and lyrics by Rob Tomaro, she has returned to the top ten at ReverbNation.  ‘Miss Conduct’ is developing strong advance sales from her 50,000 fans and followers on social media.

     Susan is currently working with superstar Rock Record Producer Tony Battaglia, who has produced multi-million selling hit records with artists such as Shinedown, Puddle of Mudd, NSYNC and The Backstreet Boys.

      Her killer performances on her 2015 tours knocked out audiences from Maine to Florida and paired her with artists such as Lita Ford, Tantric and Soil. This year also saw her Broadway debut and cast album for the original musical Amazing Grace.

Andrew Frances, Susan’s Manager: a few career highlights:

     Andrew Frances discovered Garth Brooks and guided his career.  He has sold in excess of 100 million albums, second only to the Beatles in all time U. S. sales.

    Consulted and worked with David Bowie, Loggins and Messina, Wang Chung, The Oak Ridge Boys. 

   Here is a sampling of some of the Gold albums Andy has worked on:

Garth Brooks – In Pieces, Chase, Beyond the Season, Ropin’ the Wind

Wang Chung- Wang Chung

David Bowie – Young Americans, Low, Lodger, Heroes, Diamond Dogs, Ziggy Stardust, Let’s Dance

Loggins and Messina – Live- Santa Barbara Bowl

The Alarm – Blaze of Glory, Guns

Eric Clapton- Slowhand

Cream –Wheels of Fire, Live Cream

Hall and Oates -  Private Eyes

John Denver – I want to Live

Saturday Night Fever – Soundtrack

Pretty Woman – Soundtrack

The Impact

      Susan is keeping rock alive and vibrant by bringing the best new music out on the road directly to the people. There’s no substitute for live rock ‘n roll pulsating off the stage, inspiring the audience to shout and cheer! Working together, we can break out the next big time rock n’ roll Superstar. 


Risks & Challenges

     Susan is not a start up company.  Susan is a double Grammy nominee. Her first single from her new album “Miss Conduct” charted at number seven on Reverbnation and made the top 100 on the Media Base Active Rock chart. She has been featured on national TV.  She has six figures worth of friends and followers on social media.  She is also working with the producer of the platinum act Shinedown.

      She is on the award winning label: Warrior Records. Warrior distributes its artists via Universal, (the largest music company in the United States) as well as eONE (the largest independent distributor in  the U.S) She has been on tour with Lita Ford, SOIL, Tantric , The Zombies, and The Left Banke. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join Susan’s social media team of friends and fans.

story:
¿De qué se trata y por qué este proyecto?/ What is this project about?

in English at the end of each section

El 10 de setiembre de este año  en el Teatro Eugene O'Neill en San José, Costa Rica, tendremos el Estreno Mundial de la ópera La Ruta de su Evasión, basada en la novela de Yolanda Oreamuno, en el centenario de su nacimiento. La temporada constará de seis funciones, y está planificada una gira a nivel nacional y también internacional en un futuro cercano.

Al inicio de este proyecto, en el año 2014, el Estado costarricense estuvo de acuerdo en cubrir los costos de la producción de esta ópera, considerada por todas las personas que la evaluaron como de gran relevancia y valor. Sin embargo, al año siguiente, hubo recortes y redistribuciones de presupuesto al interior del Ministerio de Cultura. Resultado de ello es que, en estos momentos, con más de un año invertido en intenso trabajo, la producción no está financiada. Pero la firme decisión de superar todos los  retos que se nos pudieran presentar para hacer realidad esta idea estaba tomada desde el principio.

Este año, también el Teatro Abya Yala tiene aniversario, cumple 25 años de existencia durante los cuales ha creado obras originales de alta calidad. Somos un grupo con decenas de premios y reconocimientos por  diversos trabajos, y sus miembros hemos participado en encuentros, talleres, simposios, festivales  e impartido clases en muchos países del mundo. Una de nuestras líneas ha sido la creación y producción de óperas, las cuales han surgido de diversas fuentes de inspiración: la calle, el periódico, una obra de Vargas Llosa. Sin embargo, nunca se ha hecho en nuestro país una ópera a partir de una novela costarricense, y nos parece un gran acierto que esta primera vez se realice una basada en el trabajo de su mejor novelista, Yolanda Oreamuno.

Como agrupación estamos más que preparados para enfrentarnos al reto, sobre todo porque ya tenemos avanzado el 80% de la producción: diseños escenográficos, de iluminación, de vestuario, diseño gráfico, el libreto, la música (2 horas y 30 minutos), el casting, los derechos de autor del heredero de la obra de Y. Oreamuno y el teatro en donde será estrenada. Y ya se han adelantado aplausos de personas entendidas en arte.

Su compositor, Carlos José Castro Mora, tiene 30 años de carrera con obras para orquesta sinfónica, cuartetos de cuerda, grupos de cámara, música para video, cine, danza, teatro y, por supuesto, ópera; ha sido galardonado múltiples veces en el país, y su música ha sido interpretada desde Singapur hasta Brasil y desde Europa hasta Cuba. Es, además, el único compositor costarricense que ha recibido un Grammy Latino en Composición, y su trabajo refleja sus influencias: ritmos latinos, minimalismo y música contemporánea, con las cuales produce un lenguaje muy personal que ya ha visto la luz en múltiples obras. Esta será su ópera más compleja, dada la densidad de la novela misma y la madurez de su carrera.

Roxana Ávila, la directora escénica, tiene 30 años de carrera como directora teatral y docente universitaria. Graduada con honores gracias a una beca Fulbright Hayes, de la Universidad Carnegie Mellon, en dirección escénica, es co-fundadora del Teatro Abya Yala. Ha dirigido y creado múltiples obras con las cuales ha ido destilando una manera de hacer teatro muy específica. Su obra Vacío ha viajado a diferentes lugares representando al país, y ganó el premio de la crítica Cubana al mejor espectáculo extranjero en el año 2014. Ha impartido clases en muchos países del continente americano: Estados Unidos, Cuba, Belice, Guatemala, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Honduras, Panamá y Brasil.

Con esta ópera, La ruta de su evasión, se marca el inicio del sueño que tenemos desde 1994, de tomar novelas nacionales y convertirlas en óperas. Es hermoso ver montajes de las óperas de Verdi, Puccini y Mozart, y lo seguiremos haciendo. Sin embargo, es tiempo de hablar de eso que vemos como nuestro, de cantar la historia de nuestra literatura, de ver nuestros reflejos en los escenarios, nuestro universo simbólico. El país está maduro y este es el momento, ya que tenemos alta calidad de intérpretes vocales y actorales, de músicos y diseñadores, capacidad de composición y dirección y, sobre todo, un público preparado para enfrentar una obra que se hace cargo de nuestros ritmos, músicas e instrumentos para convertirlos en ópera. Le hablaremos a las personas amantes de la ópera y compartiremos con ellas esta nueva versión de este gran género y, a la vez, le hablaremos a la gente que no sabe de ópera pero ama y disfruta la música y el drama. Saldremos en busca de un público nuevo sin dejar atrás a nadie.

We will have a World Premiere of the opera, The path of avoidance, based on the novel by Yolanda Oreamuno, Costa Rica's foremost writer, on her 100th anniversary, in September of this year.

At the beginning of this process, in the year 2014, Costa Rica's government agreed to cover all the costs of this production, considered by all the people who learned of  it as an opera of great value and relevance. Nevertheless, the next year, there were significant budget cuts as well as redistribution of monies inside the Ministry of Culture. As a result of that, at this moment, with more than a year invested in intense work, the production does not have financing. But the firm decision to overcome all challenges was taken from the day we started such a visionary project.

This year 2016,  is also the 25th anniversary of Abya Yala theater company, during which we have created original plays of great quality. We are a group of artists with dozens of awards and the members have participated in countless workshops, seminars, conferences around the world. One of our lines of work has been the creation and production of original operas emerging from different inspirations and interests: San José's streets, newspapers, a novel by Vargas Llosa. Nevertheless no one has created opera adapting Costarican novels, and we think it is a luminous idea to depart from Costa Rica's best novelist, Yolanda Oreamuno.

The composer, Carlos José Castro Mora, has 30 years of work as a composer with pieces for symphonic orquestra, string quartets, camera ensambles, music for video, movies, dance, theater and, of course, operas; he has been distinguished multiple times in Costa Rica for his work and his music has been performed in dozens of countries from Singapour to Brazil and from Europe to Cuba. He is Costa Rica's only composer to have received a Latin Grammy in composition, and his work reflects his influences: latin rhythms, minimalism and contemporary music, under which he has produced a personal voice that has seen the light in multiple pieces. This will be his most complex opera, due to the density of the novel itself and the maturity of his career.

Roxana Avila, the scenic director, has 30 years as a professional  director and is tenured professor at the University of Costa Rica. Graduated with honors, under a Fulbright-Hayes Scholarship, from Carnegie-Mellon University, in theater directing, she is the co-founder of Teatro Abya Yala. She has directed and created a large number of productions creating a distinct way of making theater. Her play VACIO (emptiness) has travelled to different countries representing Costa Rica and won the award given by the critics to best foreign performance in Cuba in 2014. She has taught in many countries of the American Contient: Brazil, Panama, Honduras, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Guatemala, Belice, Cuba and the United States.

This opera, La Ruta de su Evasión, is the beginning of a dream we have since 1994, of taking national novels and converting them into operas. It is beautiful to see operas by Verdi, Puccini and Mozart, and we will continue doing so. Nevertheless it is time to talk about what we call ours, to sing the story of our literature, to see our reflections on the stage, our symbolic universe. The country is mature and this is the moment, we have the high level of mastery from the singers, actors, musicians, designers, the ability of composing, directing and, above all, an audience prepared to face a play that takes our rhythms, musics and instruments and transforms them into opera. We will speak to opera lovers and share with them this new version of this great genre and, at the same time, we will speak to people who don't know about opera but loves music and drama. We will go out looking for a new audience without leaving anyone behind.

¿Por qué es importante su ayuda?/

Why is your help important?

Vemos el proceso descrito como parte de un momento histórico, tomando en cuenta, por una parte, la merecida celebración del centenario del nacimiento de Yolanda Oreamuno y, por otra, la confluencia de talentos que nos anima al lanzamiento de esta campaña. Nunca antes se había solicitado dinero a la gente para hacer ópera en Costa Rica, un país en donde este género es producido por el Estado, por ser tan costoso. Pero llegó el momento de contar con la generosidad del público. Nos encontramos trabajando: aprendiendo las canciones, ensayando, presupuestando los diseños, hablando con los constructores y vestuaristas, porque tenemos la fe ciega de que ustedes nos van a ayudar.  Con el mínimo de apoyo, 50,000 dólares (y el ingreso proyectado de la taquilla) pagaremos los materiales y a una parte de los artistas (músicos y cantantes). Pero si lográramos la totalidad del costo real de la ópera, 120,000 dólares, pagaremos la totalidad de los salarios (es decir de todos los que no son músicos y cantantes) y costos ya invertidos. Si logramos  130,000 dólares haríamos la grabación en digital en el estudio y con 140,000 haríamos el DVD.

Nuestro sueño es girar la pieza por todo el país y luego por Centroamérica y México, para luego ampliar a otras fronteras; sin embargo, nuestro primer paso es estrenarla en San José el 10 de setiembre. 

¡Es por ello que contamos con usted!

We see the above mentioned process as a historic moment, taking into consideration, on one side, the long due celebration of Yolanda Oreamunos's one hundredth anniversary, and, on the other, the yuxtaposition of so many talents that cheers us on to this campaign. Never has anyone in Costa Rica asked for money to produce opera because this genre, being so costly, is produced by the State.. But it is time to count on the everyday person's generosity. We are rehearsing, learning the songs, the music, speaking to constructors, budgeting the designs, the tailors and seamstresses, because we have a blind faith that you will help us. With the minimum asked here of $50,000 dollars plus the projected income from box office we can pay the materials and a part of the artists (musicians and singers). But if we are able to raise the real cost ($120,000 dollars) we could pay everyone else. If we are able to raise $130,000 dollars we will produce a digital recording and if we raise $140,000 dollars we will produce a DVD.

Our dream is to tour through Central America and Mexico first and later to go beyond; nevertheless, our first step is to produce it in San José, opening on September 10th.

This is why we count on your generosity!

¿Qué podemos ofrecerle a cambio de su apoyo?/ What can we offer you for your donation?

Será un placer ofrecerle algo por su donación, pues nos interesa que usted sienta satisfacción al apoyar este proyecto y que, a la vez, reciba un detalle de gratitud por su generosidad. La artista gráfica Lisa Sánchez ha diseñado un sello para la ópera (el ojo que se ve al inicio de esta página), y lo hemos colocado en diversos objetos: calcomanías, pines, bolsos y camisetas. Además, tenemos cenas VIP en el restaurante Sofía Mediterráneo, en Barrio Escalante, o presentaciones con los cantantes en vivo y la presencia de su marca en Vallas, Mupis y publicidad externa.

Pero lo más importante será el agradecimiento de corazón por parte nuestra, la magnanimidad de su parte en apoyar este proyecto, y su satisfacción al verlo en escena.

Si no lográramos reunir los 50,000 dólares, haríamos la obra en el 2017, pero al ser este el año del centenario de Yolanda, nos parece imprescindible hacerlo este setiembre.

It will be a pleasure to offer you something for your donation, because we want you to feel satisfaction by helping this project and at the same time receive a small token of our gratitude. The graphic artist, Lisa Sánchez, has designed a logo for our opera (the eye you see at the beginning of this campaign), and we have placed it on different objects: stickers, pins, t-shirts, handbags. We also have VIP dinners in Sofia Mediterráneo Restaurant, at Barrio Escalante, and live presentations with the singers as well as the logo of your business or institution on a massive scale throughout San José.

The most important thing will be a heartfelt thank you on our part to your magnanimity by supporting this project, and the satisfaction of seeing it, finally, on the stage.

If we are unable to raise the $50,000 thousand dollars, we will perform it next year, but this being Yolanda's centennial, it seems like a sheer necessity to open in September.

¿Qué impacto tiene este proyecto?

What impact does this project have?

Esta es la primera ópera hecha a partir de una novela costarricense.

Es el homenaje mayor que se le haya hecho a Yolanda Oreamuno.

Es un aporte histórico el cambiar en la ópera los ritmos europeos por los latinos.

Es una revelación: una ópera apta tanto para el público general como para el especializado.

Es un acontecimiento: una ópera financiada por la gente y no por el Estado.

Es la primera vez que se mantendrá en repertorio una ópera de una compañía teatral independiente.

Sin su ayuda no será posible, pero con su aporte vamos a darle un giro a la historia de la ópera y del teatro costarricense.

Abya Yala no ha fallado en 25 años. Hemos creado proyectos enormes, algunos en colaboración con artistas de tres países a la vez, hemos producido espectáculos masivos y pequeñas joyas íntimas, y hemos mantenido viva y activa la compañía por un cuarto de siglo, sin apoyo del Estado. Tenemos la habilidad, el talento y la tenacidad.

This is the first opera created adapted from a costarican novel.

This is the largest homage to be made to Yolanda Oreamuno.

This is an historical event changing the opera to have Latin rhythms instead of European.

It is a revelation: an opera for both the specialized opera goers and the general public.

It is a groundbreaking event: an opera financed by the people and not by the State.

It is the first time an independent theater company maintains an opera in its repertoire

Without your support it will not happen, but with your donation we will turn the wheel of Costa Rica's theater and opera history.

Abya Yala has not failed in 25 years. We have created enormous projects, in collaboration with artists of three countries, we have produced massive spectacles and tiny intimate jewels, and we have maintained alive and active the company for one quarter of a century, without the support of the State. We have the ability, the talent and the tenacity

¿ De cuáles otras maneras puede ayudarnos?/ In what other ways can you help us?

Si usted ama la obra de Yolanda Oreamuno, la música de Carlos Castro, el trabajo del Teatro Abya Yala y la ópera en general, pero no tuviera mucho dinero ¡no importa! Ayúdenos a difundir esta campaña. Hágale bulla entre sus personas conocidas. Dígale a las gentes que pueden donar, aunque sea un poquito, que lo hagan. Cada contribución suma y posibilita. Si hubiera grandes colaboradores sería genial, pero todo, absolutamente todo cuenta. Y por encima de ello cuenta que usted se haya tomado el tiempo de leer esto, de creer en nosotros y de apoyarnos.

¡Mil gracias!

If you love Yolanda Oreamuno's novel, Carlos Castro's music, the work of Abya Yala and the opera in general but you don't have spare money. It doesn't matter! Help us spread the word of this campaign. Tell your friends and relatives. Tell people they can donate anything they can. If there are people who donate large it is great, but, everything counts. And above all, what counts is you took time to read this, believe in us and support us.

One thousand thank yous to you!

inicio de este proyecto, en el año 2014, el Estado costarricense estuvo de
acuerdo en cubrir los costos de la producción de esta ópera, considerada por
todas las personas que la evaluaron como de gran relevancia y valor. Sin
embargo, al año siguiente, hubo recortes y redistribuciones de presupuesto al
interior del Ministerio de Cultura. Resultado de ello es que, en estos
momentos, con más de un año invertido en intenso trabajo, la producción no está
financiada. Pero la firme decisión de superar todos los  retos que se nos
pudieran presentar para hacer realidad esta idea estaba tomada desde el
principio.
Este
año, también el Teatro Abya Yala tiene aniversario, cumple 25 años de
existencia durante los cuales ha creado obras originales de alta calidad. Somos
un grupo con decenas de premios y reconocimientos por  diversos trabajos,
y sus miembros hemos participado en encuentros, talleres, simposios, festivales
 e impartido clases en muchos países del mundo. Una de nuestras líneas ha
sido la creación y producción de óperas, las cuales han surgido de diversas
fuentes de inspiración: la calle, el periódico, una obra de Vargas
Llosa. Sin embargo, nunca se ha hecho en nuestro país una ópera a partir
de una novela costarricense, y nos parece un gran acierto que esta primera vez
se realice una basada en el trabajo de su mejor novelista, Yolanda
Oreamuno.
Como
agrupación estamos más que preparados para enfrentarnos al reto, sobre todo
porque ya tenemos avanzado el 80% de la producción: diseños escenográficos, de
iluminación, de vestuario, diseño gráfico, el libreto, la música (2 horas y 30
minutos), el casting, los derechos de autor del heredero de la obra de Y.
Oreamuno y el teatro en donde será estrenada. Y ya se han adelantado aplausos
de personas entendidas en arte.

Su
compositor, Carlos José Castro Mora, tiene 30 años de carrera con obras para
orquesta sinfónica, cuartetos de cuerda, grupos de cámara, música para video,
cine, danza, teatro y, por supuesto, ópera; ha sido galardonado múltiples veces
en el país, y su música ha sido interpretada desde Singapur hasta Brasil y
desde Europa hasta Cuba. Es, además, el único compositor costarricense que ha
recibido un Grammy Latino en Composición, y su trabajo refleja sus influencias:
ritmos latinos, minimalismo y música contemporánea, con las cuales produce un
lenguaje muy personal que ya ha visto la luz en múltiples obras. Esta será su
ópera más compleja, dada la densidad de la novela misma y la madurez de su
carrera.
Roxana
Ávila, la directora escénica, tiene 30 años de carrera como directora teatral y
docente universitaria. Graduada con honores gracias a una beca Fulbright Hayes,
de la Universidad Carnegie Mellon, en dirección escénica, es co-fundadora del
Teatro Abya Yala. Ha dirigido y creado múltiples obras con las cuales ha ido
destilando una manera de hacer teatro muy específica. Su obra Vacío ha viajado
a diferentes lugares representando al país, y ganó el premio de la crítica
Cubana al mejor espectáculo extranjero en el año 2014. Ha impartido clases en
muchos países del continente americano: Estados Unidos, Cuba, Belice,
Guatemala, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Honduras, Panamá y Brasil.
Con
esta ópera, La ruta de su evasión, se marca el inicio del sueño que tenemos
desde 1994, de tomar novelas nacionales y convertirlas en óperas. Es hermoso
ver montajes de las óperas de Verdi, Puccini y Mozart, y lo seguiremos
haciendo. Sin embargo, es tiempo de hablar de eso que vemos como nuestro, de
cantar la historia de nuestra literatura, de ver nuestros reflejos en los
escenarios, nuestro universo simbólico. El país está maduro y este es el
momento, ya que tenemos alta calidad de intérpretes vocales y actorales, de
músicos y diseñadores, capacidad de composición y dirección y, sobre todo, un
público preparado para enfrentar una obra que se hace cargo de nuestros ritmos,
músicas e instrumentos para convertirlos en ópera. Le hablaremos a las
personas amantes de la ópera y compartiremos con ellas esta nueva versión de
este gran género y, a la vez, le hablaremos a la gente que no sabe de ópera
pero ama y disfruta la música y el drama. Saldremos en busca de un público
nuevo sin dejar atrás a nadie.
We will have a World
Premiere of the opera, The path of avoidance, based on the novel by Yolanda
Oreamuno, Costa Rica's foremost writer, on her 100th anniversary, in September
of this year.
At the beginning of
this process, in the year 2014, Costa Rica's government agreed to cover all the
costs of this production, considered by all the people who learned of  it as an opera of great value and relevance.
Nevertheless, the next year, there were significant budget cuts as well as
redistribution of monies inside the Ministry of Culture. As a result of that,
at this moment, with more than a year invested in intense work, the production
does not have financing. But the firm decision to overcome all challenges was
taken from the day we started such a visionary project.

This year 2016,  is also the 25th anniversary of Abya Yala theater
company, during which we have created original plays of great quality. We are a
group of artists with dozens of awards and the members have participated in
countless workshops, seminars, conferences around the world. One of our lines
of work has been the creation and production of original operas emerging from
different inspirations and interests: San José's streets, newspapers, a novel
by Vargas Llosa. Nevertheless no one has created opera adapting Costarican
novels, and we think it is a luminous idea to depart from Costa Rica's best
novelist, Yolanda Oreamuno.
The composer, Carlos
José Castro Mora, has 30 years of work as a composer with pieces for symphonic
orquestra, string quartets, camera ensambles, music for video, movies, dance,
theater and, of course, operas; he has been distinguished multiple times in
Costa Rica for his work and his music has been performed in dozens of countries
from Singapour to Brazil and from Europe to Cuba. He is Costa Rica's only
composer to have received a Latin Grammy in composition, and his work reflects
his influences: latin rhythms, minimalism and contemporary music, under which
he has produced a personal voice that has seen the light in multiple pieces.
This will be his most complex opera, due to the density of the novel itself and
the maturity of his career.
Roxana Avila, the
scenic director, has 30 years as a professional 
director and is tenured professor at the University of Costa Rica.
Graduated with honors, under a Fulbright-Hayes Scholarship, from
Carnegie-Mellon University, in theater directing, she is the co-founder of
Teatro Abya Yala. She has directed and created a large number of productions
creating a distinct way of making theater. Her play VACIO (emptiness) has
travelled to different countries representing Costa Rica and won the award
given by the critics to best foreign performance in Cuba in 2014. She has
taught in many countries of the American Contient: Brazil, Panama, Honduras, El
Salvador, Nicaragua, Guatemala, Belice, Cuba and the United States. 
This opera, La Ruta de
su Evasión, is the beginning of a dream we have since 1994, of taking national
novels and converting them into operas. It is beautiful to see operas by Verdi,
Puccini and Mozart, and we will continue doing so. Nevertheless it is time to
talk about what we call ours, to sing the story of our literature, to see our
reflections on the stage, our symbolic universe. The country is mature and this
is the moment, we have the high level of mastery from the singers, actors,
musicians, designers, the ability of composing, directing and, above all, an
audience prepared to face a play that takes our rhythms, musics and instruments
and transforms them into opera. We will speak to opera lovers and share with
them this new version of this great genre and, at the same time, we will speak
to people who don't know about opera but loves music and drama. We will go out
looking for a new audience without leaving anyone behind.

¿Por
qué es importante su ayuda?/
Why is your help important?
Vemos
el proceso descrito como parte de un momento histórico, tomando en cuenta, por
una parte, la merecida celebración del centenario del nacimiento de Yolanda
Oreamuno y, por otra, la confluencia de talentos que nos anima al lanzamiento
de esta campaña. Nunca antes se había solicitado dinero a la gente para hacer
ópera en Costa Rica, un país en donde este género es producido por el Estado, por
ser tan costoso. Pero llegó el momento de contar con la generosidad del
público. Nos encontramos trabajando: aprendiendo las canciones, ensayando,
presupuestando los diseños, hablando con los constructores y vestuaristas,
porque tenemos la fe ciega de que ustedes nos van a ayudar.  Con el mínimo
de apoyo, 50,000 dólares (y el ingreso proyectado de la taquilla) pagaremos los
materiales y a una parte de los artistas (músicos y cantantes). Pero si
lográramos la totalidad del costo real de la ópera, 120,000 dólares, pagaremos
la totalidad de los salarios (es decir de todos los que no son músicos y
cantantes) y costos ya invertidos. Si logramos  130,000 dólares haríamos
la grabación en digital en el estudio y con 140,000 haríamos el DVD.
Nuestro
sueño es girar la pieza por todo el país y luego por Centroamérica y México,
para luego ampliar a otras fronteras; sin embargo, nuestro primer paso es
estrenarla en San José el 10 de setiembre. 
¡Es
por ello que contamos con usted!
We see the above
mentioned process as a historic moment, taking into consideration, on one side,
the long due celebration of Yolanda Oreamunos's one hundredth anniversary, and,
on the other, the yuxtaposition of so many talents that cheers us on to this
campaign. Never has anyone in Costa Rica asked for money to produce opera
because this genre, being so costly, is produced by the State.. But it is time
to count on the everyday person's generosity. We are rehearsing, learning the
songs, the music, speaking to constructors, budgeting the designs, the tailors
and seamstresses, because we have a blind faith that you will help us. With the
minimum asked here of $50,000 dollars plus the projected income from box office
we can pay the materials and a part of the artists (musicians and singers). But
if we are able to raise the real cost ($120,000 dollars) we could pay everyone
else. If we are able to raise $130,000 dollars we will produce a digital
recording and if we raise $140,000 dollars we will produce a DVD.
Our dream is to tour
through Central America and Mexico first and later to go beyond; nevertheless,
our first step is to produce it in San José, opening on September 10th.

This is why we count
on your generosity!
¿Qué
podemos ofrecerle a cambio de su apoyo?/ What
can we offer you for your donation?

Será
un placer ofrecerle algo por su donación, pues nos interesa que usted sienta
satisfacción al apoyar este proyecto y que, a la vez, reciba un detalle de
gratitud por su generosidad. La artista gráfica Lisa Sánchez ha diseñado un
sello para la ópera (el ojo que se ve al inicio de esta página), y lo hemos
colocado en diversos objetos: calcomanías, pines, bolsos y
camisetas. Además, tenemos cenas VIP en el restaurante Sofía Mediterráneo,
en Barrio Escalante, o presentaciones con los cantantes en vivo y la presencia
de su marca en Vallas, Mupis y publicidad externa.
Pero
lo más importante será el agradecimiento de corazón por parte nuestra, la
magnanimidad de su parte en apoyar este proyecto, y su satisfacción al verlo en
escena.
Si
no lográramos reunir los 50,000 dólares, haríamos la obra en el 2017, pero al
ser este el año del centenario de Yolanda, nos parece imprescindible hacerlo
este setiembre.
It will be a pleasure
to offer you something for your donation, because we want you to feel
satisfaction by helping this project and at the same time receive a small token
of our gratitude. The graphic artist, Lisa Sánchez, has designed a logo for our
opera (the eye you see at the beginning of this campaign), and we have placed
it on different objects: stickers, pins, t-shirts, handbags. We also have VIP
dinners in Sofia Mediterráneo Restaurant, at Barrio Escalante, and live
presentations with the singers as well as the logo of your business or
institution on a massive scale throughout San José.
The most important
thing will be a heartfelt thank you on our part to your magnanimity by
supporting this project, and the satisfaction of seeing it, finally, on the
stage.

If we are unable to
raise the $50,000 thousand dollars, we will perform it next year, but this
being Yolanda's centennial, it seems like a sheer necessity to open in
September.

¿Qué
impacto tiene este proyecto?
What impact does this project have?

Esta
es la primera ópera hecha a partir de una novela costarricense.
Es
el homenaje mayor que se le haya hecho a Yolanda Oreamuno.
Es
un aporte histórico el cambiar en la ópera los ritmos europeos por los latinos.
Es
una revelación: una ópera apta tanto para el público general como para el
especializado.
Es
un acontecimiento: una ópera financiada por la gente y no por el Estado.
Es
la primera vez que se mantendrá en repertorio una ópera de una compañía teatral
independiente.
Sin
su ayuda no será posible, pero con su aporte vamos a darle un giro a la
historia de la ópera y del teatro costarricense.
Abya
Yala no ha fallado en 25 años. Hemos creado proyectos enormes, algunos en
colaboración con artistas de tres países a la vez, hemos producido espectáculos
masivos y pequeñas joyas íntimas, y hemos mantenido viva y activa la compañía
por un cuarto de siglo, sin apoyo del Estado. Tenemos la habilidad, el talento
y la tenacidad.
This is the first
opera created adapted from a costarican novel.
This is the largest
homage to be made to Yolanda Oreamuno.
This is an historical
event changing the opera to have Latin rhythms instead of European.
It is a revelation: an
opera for both the specialized opera goers and the general public.
It is a groundbreaking
event: an opera financed by the people and not by the State.
It is the first time
an independent theater company maintains an opera in its repertoire
Without your support
it will not happen, but with your donation we will turn the wheel of Costa
Rica's theater and opera history.
Abya Yala has not
failed in 25 years. We have created enormous projects, in collaboration with
artists of three countries, we have produced massive spectacles and tiny
intimate jewels, and we have maintained alive and active the company for one
quarter of a century, without the support of the State. We have the ability,
the talent and the tenacity

¿
De cuáles otras maneras puede ayudarnos?/ In what other ways can you help us?

Si
usted ama la obra de Yolanda Oreamuno, la música de Carlos Castro, el trabajo
del Teatro Abya Yala y la ópera en general, pero no tuviera mucho dinero ¡no
importa! Ayúdenos a difundir esta campaña. Hágale bulla entre sus personas
conocidas. Dígale a las gentes que pueden donar, aunque sea un poquito, que lo
hagan. Cada contribución suma y posibilita. Si hubiera grandes colaboradores
sería genial, pero todo, absolutamente todo cuenta. Y por encima de ello cuenta
que usted se haya tomado el tiempo de leer esto, de creer en nosotros y de
apoyarnos.
¡Mil
gracias!
If you love Yolanda
Oreamuno's novel, Carlos Castro's music, the work of Abya Yala and the opera in
general but you don't have spare money. It doesn't matter! Help us spread the
word of this campaign. Tell your friends and relatives. Tell people they can
donate anything they can. If there are people who donate large it is great,
but, everything counts. And above all, what counts is you took time to read
this, believe in us and support us.

One thousand thank
yous to you!

story:
Short Summary

We are the creators of "Giakoumis O Krikkos" (Γιακουμής Ο Κρίκκος), an audio-comedy series that was first introduced back in 2001.

The last Giakoumis episode (Γιακουμής 4 - Η εξιλέωση) was created a long 13 years ago. Due to popular demand, we have now decided to put the team back together and finally bring the long-overdue Giakoumis back with a bang.

We are excited to be preparing an ingenious 30 minute new episode featuring Giakoumis O Krikkos, Xambis, Eftimis, & Giannakis (& many others...) like you never heard them before.

Our creative team members are professionally involved in script writing, music production, acting and visual arts. With the new episode being the first in 13 years, we are determined to make it exceed all expectations.

         

How You Can Make This Happen

To produce Giakoumis 5 - The Return Of The Link, we are asking all the Giakoumofans to support us in this venture. The overall estimated expenses required for creating episode 5 sum up to €3200. This is a significantly reduced amount that was only made possible due to our supportive long-term collaborators.

Your help will go towards: 

Studio Time

Renting a professional recording space with the required equipment, so as to record all voices for the audio episode, live instruments, create music arrangements and sound effects.

Musicians (including a live 12 piece choir)

In contrast with all the previous episodes, for this one we plan to record real time musicians performing in order to give the project even more life.

Sound design

A foley artist will be hired in order to produce special sound effects, thus adding a more realistic vibe to the characters.

Sound Mixing

The sound mixing process is a vitally important part of the audio quality as it helps blend all the parts together smoothly, like Anglias Cognac.

Mastering

The very final process of the overall production. Mastering is used to refine the mixed audio to perfection.

In return for your contribution to the project we have prepared a number of unique perks, only available during the 30-day period of this campaign.
Some of these perks include customised & personalised ring tones, the opportunity to partner up and a special phone call from Giakoumis himself.

         

The Impact

To date, "Giakoumis O Krikkos" has released four complete episodes, That's a combined total of 47 minutes of screwball, dry humour. Even before YouTube existed, Giakoumis had become viral in Cyprus and abroad just from copying CDs and cassette tapes and sharing them. 
Given the laughs Giakoumis has provided so far, we are determined to give you more by producing Giakoumis 5 - The Return Of The Link. 

         

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support our efforts but can't really afford to (ppissi), don't worry. You can help bring back Giakoumis by letting others know about the campaign:

- Share our Indiegogo 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/bring-giakoumis-o-krikkos-back/x/14099729#/.

- Like our FB page and share our posts 

https://www.facebook.com/giakoumiskrikkos/


         

Final note: in case you are wondering why there are no actual names portrayed, the team decided to not officially reveal the names of the creators in order to keep the Giakou-mystery of the project alive.

Thank you for taking the time to read our story!
Kindly,
The GOK creators.

story:
We have big dreams and we're confident that we can reach them, but we absolutely need your contributions to make it happen! We will be hitting the road with Joy Postell, :3lON, Butch Dawson, Freaky, Dylijens & Urban Shaman. 

  • We Need $20,000 to make sure we can securely organize, embark on, and complete a 43-day tour.
  • Contributions go directly towards purchasing a van and making sure that it is running properly, as well as legally registered (tags, title, inspection). Expenses will additionally include (but are not limited to): insurance, gas, oil changes, food, lodging, emergency funds, repairs, tolls, parking.
  • Our perks include exclusive merchandise that will only be accessible to those who donate to our campaign. 
  • If we don't reach our goal, we still plan on going on tour. Your contributions will go directly towards travel expenses, which include, but are not limited to, vehicle repair/upkeep/rental and gas. 

The Impact

  • We all play very different music, but we share a similar goal: to spread positivity with our music and put Baltimore City on the map.  This is the first time a group of artists of color from Baltimore City have banded together to embark on a full U.S. tour of this magnitude. While many have played nationally and internationally, we are setting a goal to organize this in a professional manner. Think of a tour that a major label would put on, except we don't have any major backers/sponsors and we are all self-managed artists. We are trying to revolutionize the way independent artists tour. 
  • In our 3 years of existence, we've thrown 150+ events in Baltimore and abroad, given away over 500 free pizzas, and raised over $1000 for charitable causes. We've produced, written, and released countless hours of music. We've played more shows than we can count and met some of the most beautiful & talented people through our music.

Risks & Challenges

  • Llamadon has faced constant hurtles, whether it's dealing with institutionalized racism from music venues & promoters or dealing with personal hardships that keep us from investing financially into our careers. 
  • Our careers have always been a risk and we've always been willing to dive head first into new challenges. Each year, we see our trials & tribulations transform into personal growth as individual artists and the manifestation of greater accomplishments for Llamadon, as a whole. 
  • Our constant battle is travel expenses. We've toured in the most bare-bones conditions with very little resources. There isn't much of a music economy for us in Baltimore City, so we hustle every way we can to get on the road. If we do not reach our full goal, we plan to either rent a van from another band or take two separate cars. Both options are not ideal financially, but we plan on going on this tour no matter what. 
  • Touring is risky and while the road brings inherent danger, we always put safety first. The main goal of this campaign is to be able to complete a full U.S. tour as safely as possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't contribute? No problem! It's not all about money you know - Simply sharing this page with a friend or family member could be the extra push we need to reach our goal! Check out all of indiegogo's share tools and let people know how they can help us.

story:
Who are The Stapletons?

Once upon a time, a mariachi from LA married a Wisconsin farmgirl. He swept her away to Pittsburgh, PA, where they set about trying to reconcile their wildly different cultures and raise three children. Then one day, they sat down in the kitchen with a Celtic harp and a Mexican guitar and started making music together. The unique and compelling sound that resulted inspired The Stapletons to set up a makeshift studio in their attic and start writing original music arranged for harp, guitar, and voice.

We are Kate and Casey Stapleton, and this is the beginning of our story.  We believe that good stories make good music. This summer, we will record our first album, Ballads and Battles. The album features original compositions with a blend of historical and contemporary influences. Our sound ranges from Americana to Celtic, mixed up with a dash of funk, a nod to the Renaissance troubadours, and a dose of the blues. We're bringing the ballad back- and it's better than ever.

The Arsenal.

Ballads are songs that tell stories. Our music is inspired by the stories of the people and places around us. Just across the street from our home is Arsenal Park. This park is built upon the former site of the Allegheny Arsenal. Today, it’s a serene green hillside where our children play. One hundred and fifty four years ago, it was the site of the worst civilian disaster of the civil war. A mysterious explosion on September 17th, 1862, killed 78 people. Most of them were young women and girls, Many of them were recent Irish immigrants. Two of those girls were named Mary and Ellen Slattery. Those sisters shared Kate's maiden name.  We researched the Slattery family's journey from Ireland to Pittsburgh, and the known details of the Allegheny Arsenal explosion. The Ballad of the Arsenal Girls is just one of the stories we look forward to sharing with you.

Why Indiegogo?

Indiegogo makes it possible for you to become part of our story. When you pre-order the album today, or purchase one of the perks we are offering, we give you music. You give us the ability to complete the recording and production of our album for a worldwide release this fall. You help us work with a Grammy nominated producer. Your contributions will help us to bring these songs and stories to life.

How Does it Add Up?

What will we do with the funds we raise? Here's a complete breakdown.

RECORDING $2000-Studio fees and equipment, professional engineering with a Grammy nominated sound engineer, mixing and mastering of the album.

PRODUCTION $2100- Physical and digital album production, including full color print, lyric books, original artwork, and historical photos. Promotional materials including posters, mugs, photo books, and prints. Also includes documentary photos and video to be used in promotion and release

DISTRIBUTION $800 Covers the cost of physical and digital distribution, including fulfillment of all perks and album pre-orders, as well as a nationwide physical release of the album.

RELEASE $500 Website development to allow us to offer our music across online platforms. Outreach to local and national press. CD Release Concert.

INDIEGOGO/PROCESSING FEES $600 Indiegogo receives 5% of the total amount of money we raise, with additional credit card  and paypal fees of 3-5%.

Share this Story.

One of the most powerful ways you can contribute to our campaign is absolutely free. Can you help us spread the word? Simply use the sharing tools located on the top right-hand corner of this page, next to the Back It button. When you share our story with your friends and family, you'll help ensure that our campaign is a success.

Thank You.

Your support makes it possible to bring Ballads and Battles to life. We've worked hard to make sure that every funding level is worthwhile, because we want to give you a great deal in exchange for your faith in our project and your support. We're confident that this will be an amazing album. Thank you for sharing our story.

story:
Things are moving forward!

We want to thank all the people that are sharing our campaign and donating. In addition to the contributions already received we've got some that have pledged to help us and that puts us at about $2500.00.

The main question we seem to get is why? You had a video on national TV so why do you need to raise money through Indiegogo? The simple answer is that we didn't receive even one penny of royalties from the broadcast of our Threadbare video. It's very discouraging but we're not going to give up despite that as near as we can calculate ASCAP and BMI owe us in the neighborhood of 18 to 20 thousand dollars that they aren't paying us. Yes, it's a lot of money, A LOT of money considering where we live. BUT we're not going to let these folks screw us out of doing the thing we love, making music. SO, we're fighting back and producing more music and another video. Help us battle against the giants that choose to ignore Indie Artist! We've even been told by booking agents that in order to get noticed we have to move from our SE Oklahoma home. That's not happening either and with your help we can make things happen!

If you don't know who we are then the following is our story.

We're a group of musicians from a rural area in SE Oklahoma. Our first album was completely recorded and produced in our home with the bare basics and it drew some attention to us. We were fortunate enough to meet a banjo player named Jimmy Henley that toured with Roy Clark for over 25 years. (Jimmy actually won an award for being the best banjo player in the world once.) He contributed to a track on our first album called "Neurologically Poor". Meeting him led to us being introduced to a former videographer for Hanson that believed in us enough to produce a video of our song "Threadbare".  The song even ended up running on ZUUS TV nationwide.

When The Captain Ledge Band practices our home is filled with young children running through the house. They even run into the room to dance when we start playing one of their favorite songs. We hope through our music to provide a better life and better opportunities for our families. Meeting the goal in our campaign would be a life changer for all of us.  It would provide opportunities for us and our kids that we would never have if we stay in Southeast Oklahoma. 

We think we're on the right path......

We love living in Southeast Oklahoma. Being in the country is a great place to raise kids and to teach them about nature. We're very close to our environment and raise bees where we live. Our other passion is helping to teach people how important bees are to providing food to EVERYONE and we use our musical platform to talk to people about ways they can help save the bees.

Last August we were invited to attend and showcase at The Cutting Edge Music Conference in New Orleans. We took all the money we had and with a prayer in our hearts went. It was a wonderful experience and through it we met the Executive Producer from Sweetwater Studios. Sweetwater has Grammy winning Producers and Engineers on their staff and have helped produce albums for a long list of awesome and talented artist. After checking us out Sweetwater contacted us and expressed an interest in helping us complete our second album. They offered us a heck of a deal but it's money that we just don't have.

In the meantime we were contacted by the producer of the Threadbare video offering to make another video for us. This a lot of opportunity, but we need all of you to make the miracles happen.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $14,000 dollars to take advantage of all this opportunity and to get our music from the second album released. It breaks down like this and will be spent in this order.

Sweetwater Studios -                               $5000.00

Video Production                                       $3000.00

Art Work and CD's                                      $3000.00

Incentive fulfillment and Merchandise $3000.00

If we don't reach our goals we will bust our butts to make the rest of the money we need. We're determined to make this happen and and we appreciate your help in reaching our dreams.

We're offering autographed CD's, downloads of our first album and our second album when completed. Autographed T-shirts. Shows where we come to your house to play for you and your friends.  Trips to gigs with us and even help roadie for a day.  We're also offering 8 oz. bottles of Artisan honey from our bee hives. (These are in limited supply, contribute soon so you don't miss out.) Everyone that contributes will be placed in a drawing to win a house concert from The Captain Ledge Band. (There are some restrictions due to travel expenses and other engagements.)

 If you have a special request in exchange for your contribution please contact us and we'll make every effort to try and accommodate you.

With Your help we can make this happen!

We enjoyed some great response from the Threadbare video. It attracted attention from fans from all four points of the compass. On the Number One Music Website two of our songs have made it to the top of the charts on the world wide Folk Charts. Rumors of The Great White Skunk is even better and with the help of Sweetwater Studios we can produce an album that will bring even more attention to The Captain Ledge Band because of this Grammy winning association. With your help we can take the next step in getting our music released.

You'll also help us to spend even more  time talking with people about the importance of saving the honey bee. We can only do this with the help of people like you. Your contributions will be life changing.

We know it's a Challenge but we're ready!

We all work incredibly hard every day. Jeana is a school nurse and mother. She goes to work every day then comes home and takes care of our family. She spends the rest of her evenings practicing her mandolin. Lonnie, one of our guitar players, works as a landscaper when he doesn't have his guitar in his hand. Justin, the other guitar player, works as a janitor and maintenance man to help take care of his wife and 4 kids. Cliff works for a Rural Water district during the day and goes home to help his 8 year old daughter with homework before spending the rest of the evening practicing and making music with The Captain Ledge Band.

We're used to hard work. It's just what we do to make our dreams come true.

  If you can't contribute.....

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Share our music and use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign with your friends.

"Like" us on Facebook.

Stream our music on Spotify and Rhapsody.  (a few pennies in Royalties can help us reach our goals.)

Lastly we want to take a moment to offer our sincerest Thank You for taking the time to notice us.

AND While you're at it....

If we go over our goal we'll use the additional money to help perspective beekeepers get started. We'll supply them with hives AND help teach them what they need to know to save the honeybee.

story:
Hello,

I realize this album has been a long time coming.  However, it has always been a quality record I've wanted to make, and I feel I've done that.

I'm running a small campaign in order to raise funds to release the second Oceanship album Bella Blue - production of CDs, posters, shirts, etc.

Once the campaign is over, I'd like to arrange a time or two in which all of the campaign contributors who helped make this album possible, listen to the album together (before its official release).  Every perk includes a digital album, so I'll get all of you the album before its official release and perhaps we can all press play at the same time (perhaps set up a few sessions for those in different time zones).

I hope you're all doing well out there.  If not, I hope you return to well soon.


Brad/Oceanship
