story:
Summary

When you’ve experienced something great, something that sets the course of your life for the better – wouldn’t you feel compelled to share that story?

My name is Daniel Oyinloye, and my passion is storytelling. On March 4, 2016 I will launch my album release project with the intention of spreading a message of storytelling, spirituality and awakening. In the three years since my last album release, I made an effort to live life to the fullest. During this time, I wrote tunes, ideas and reflections. It was only a few months ago that I decided to release a compilation of those narratives in the form of a project called “Dawn of Redemption”.

"Dawn of Redemption is more than an album release. It’s a storytelling journey in the making; built on sharing my awakening and helping others discover their own. I've experienced something profound and want to share it."

I am currently looking for donations to fund performances and the album release in Duluth, the Twin Cities and San Francisco (some of the places that inspired this album). These donations will also support my objective goal which is to initiate a youth ministry called the “Do Right Ministry”. A ministry with the goal of encouraging youths and their families to do right in their communities. All support and donations are greatly appreciated on this journey. Please don’t hesitate to share this page with your family and friends. I hope to see you soon!

Why

I want people to wake up and be honest with themselves; the truth is that, here in the states, blacks are still getting arrested and killed because they demand civility, immigrants still don't have access to jobs or substantial relations without selling their home identity -- something is happening in our atmosphere.

Our educational system needs an extreme makeover, which might not be possible without breaking it down first. Imagine: a teen at 12 who already has a lengthy list of criminal offenses -- where is the student union? If the teachers are protected, who protects and looks out for the students? And think of a parent’s reality: a single mother goes to work all night, goes directly to the school of her son who just got suspended, faints in the principal's office, only to find herself in the school nurse's office sipping on sugars with other sick students. Get the gist?

Meanwhile, a white principal is fired for trying to change the racist status quo of a high school, while black faculty and staff are getting fired for actually making changes in higher education, unprotected by the unions when it comes to matters of race. The truth is -- everyone is hurting beyond race (the student, the teacher, the parents). The sad part is that everyone is eager to report the sins of the other because we are genuinely unsatisfied and upset, but we are also the ones who are unwilling to check ourselves and improve our own lives.

We treat ourselves with wickedness; the rich preach to the poor without helping them, and we human beings leave other living creatures to die without a ounce of care.

Have I said enough?

Honestly, there is so much things to say right now: "when the rain falls, it don't fall on one man's rooftop" - Bob Marley. Let's start making the necessary decisions that bring about a greater awakening; but this, too, is impossible without making the most important and more urgent decision, which is the one we make inside for the course of our hearts and our life. This project, Dawn Of Redemption urges that we stop ignoring these realities -- they’re happening now, let’s face them! And in all that is happening now, I hope my story will inspire truth and Love. Dawn of Redemption is about shining a little light on the darkness all around us today.


What We Need & What You Get

The funds we raise will go directly to funding performance dates in 3 of the cities that inspired this album and project: Duluth, MN, Minneapolis/Saint Paul, MN & San Francisco, CA. The goal is to offer shows that are open to ages 13-120 that uses my story to inspire others to share theirs. 

A total of $6000 is needed to fund this project and the shows in the various cities. Any profits made from the shows or any additional money raised here will go directly to funding the start of the Do Right Ministry. If we do not reach our goal of $6000 we will post an emoji with a sad face then look for alternate forms of funding :) All donations are welcomed with joy and celebration.

story:
Hi!

We are Penny For The Workhouse, a lively London based band creating music to make you dance! Formed in 2012, we are influenced by the style and swagger of old London Town. Our unique ‘Folk ‘n’ Roll’ style marries the energy of Indie rock with the captivating storytelling of Folk.

Our first EP was met by 5 star reviews on iTunes and rated by Paul Weller! He said "It's quirky, I love the title track Coins and Cards, good luck, keep working at it!"

We are planning on releasing our 3rd self released EP "Sneaky Peekers" this summer and we need to raise funds to work with a respected PR company that were responsible for the rise of many successful bands such as Elbow. Please check out our video for a "Sneaky Peek" at us recording the EP.

This is our third EP and we have learnt that in this business you need more than great songs to sell recordsand by working with a professional PR company we can maximise the potential of our material and get it out there into the world for people to hear.

PR doesn't come cheap! We need £900 for a six week campaign that will get our EP plugged to the best radio stations and online platforms, this is vital for us to get the exposure we need to release a successful EP. Unfortunately in this day and age unsigned bands are miles away from the radio presenters and music journalists that can spread the word of your work and this is why it is so important to work with a respected PR company that can bridge the gap and get your music heard by the people who matter.

We have managed to raise £400 ourselves by putting into a band account but the quicker we can raise the remaining £500, the quicker we can get the ball rolling and get Penny For The Workhouse where we should be.

Any Little helps, so if you believe in new music please help us on the road to success!

Please check out our  website for more info and upcoming gigs

Keep Folkin'n'Rollin!

PFTW

2012, we are influenced
by the style and swagger
of old London Town. Our unique ‘Folk ‘n’ Roll’ style marries the energy of
Indie rock with the captivating storytelling of Folk. 
Our first EP was met by 5 star reviews on iTunes and rated by Paul Weller! He said "It's quirky, I love the title track Coins
and Cards, good luck, keep working at it!" 
We are planning on releasing our 3rd self released EP "Sneaky Peekers" this summer and we need to raise funds to work with a respected PR company that were responsible for the rise of many successful bands such as Elbow. Please check out our video for a "Sneaky Peek" at us recording the EP.
This is our third EP and we have learnt that in this business you need more than great songs to sell recordsand by working with a professional PR company we can maximise the potential of our material and get it out there into the world for people to hear.
PR doesn't come cheap! We need £900 for a six week campaign that will get our EP plugged to the best radio stations and online platforms, this is vital for us to get the exposure we need to release a successful EP. Unfortunately in this day and age unsigned bands are miles away from the radio presenters and music journalists that can spread the word of your work and this is why it is so important to work with a respected PR company that can bridge the gap and get your music heard by the people who matter.
We have managed to raise £400 ourselves by putting into a band account but the quicker we can raise the remaining £500, the quicker we can get the ball rolling and get Penny For The Workhouse where we should be.
Any Little helps, so if you believe in new music please help us on the road to success!
Please check out our  website for more info and upcoming gigs
Keep Folkin'n'Rollin!
PFTW

story:
Who am I?

Hi!  My name is Brian Hernandez.  I am an independent artist/producer in the Washington DC Metropolitan area.  I have always had a passion for music ever since my childhood, I developed the gift of rapping at the age of 12 and started to produce music at 17 years old.  
Two years ago I was able to launch a EP (9 track CD) thankfully with a low budget, I didn't have much knowledge of how everything worked I simply just wanted to launch my music.  Currently I am working on my first big album!  And since its a big project I need your help to fund the expenses that go with finalizing this project!  

Where Will The Money Go Towards?

As stated earlier, there are many expenses that go along with professionally launching a music album.  Below is a breakdown of the expenses to give you more of an idea where all the money will go towards:

Copyright for whole album (12 songs) - $660

Professional Album Mastering by Audio Animals (12 songs) - $1860

CD Duplication - $500-$600

Album Artwork - $500

Videos (Documentary and 2 Music Videos) - $350

Maketing/Promotion Package from Rapzilla - $2000

Travel Expenses and Radio Play - $1030

The Purpose

Many could think and say that they'll be helping me to get more publicity or fame.  But my heart is to make a difference in someones life.  The album concept is that if you want to see a change in your life, there first must be a change in your heart. And that change that I've received has come only by Jesus Christ!  And that's what I want to share with the world, speaking about real life issues that many of us face, and embrace the fact that Jesus can set us free! 

How Can You Benefit From This?

I am offering a bundle of Merchandise that I still have from the release of my EP.

Any donations that are $25 or higher will get one CD Hard Copy of the 2014 EP Release and a T-shirt that goes with it that reads "No Limits"  *Limited Sizes Available ** 

Donations at $12 will get a tank top that reads "No Limits" * Limited Sizes Available** 

Donations at $50 or higher will get one CD hard Copy, One T-Shirt, and One Tank Top.  OR!  One CD and Two T-shirts/or two Tank tops.  


To stay connected with me you can email me at brian.hernandez1028@gmail.com

And you can follow my social media pages to stay connected:

Facebook: Facebook.com/bh.official1

Instagram: @bh.official1

Twitter: @bh_official1

                                        

                             Thank you for your support!  Much Love x Blessings!

story:
Who are you?!

My name is Kate Wilde. I'm a harpist, singer, songwriter, performance artist and recording artist. I've been playing a 26-string lever harp for 3 1/2 years now, and I'm humbly asking for your help to go to the next level with a pedal harp!

Why Do You Need a Pedal Harp?

I'm simply outgrowing the small harp that I have. Currently, many of my songs hang on C and D notes because they're the lowest notes I have. I have to use my hands to change keys, which makes it impossible to smoothly change keys while playing. On a pedal harp, I'd be able to change keys in the middle of playing a song, by using the foot pedals. Not to mention I'd have double the amount of strings to work with tonally. My connection to my instrument will deepen, because I'll be able to truly FEEL the instrument vibrate on my body- something I don't experience with my small harp. I had a truly healing experience when I played a pedal harp for the first time; the sound is incredible. Just look up "Venus pedal harp" on youtube and maybe you'll start drooling as much as I have been lately. Here are a few more crucial differences between the lever harp and the pedal harp:
PEDAL HARP
~ Has 40-47 strings
~ Beautiful, big sound and much better bass response (can deeply feel it in your body)
~ Even sound across all registers, if you get a good quality instrument
~ Primarily gut strings, much more beautiful feel & sound
~ Foot pedals change keys, very easy to do while playing
~ Can play in all keys
~ Stays steady on the floor so you can have healthy body technique
~ Generally very heavy and large but that allows for good technique and big sound
LEVER HARP
~ Has anywhere from 11 to 40 strings (Mine has 26)
~ Mine has a slightly twangy sound, with uneven registers (hard to feel in the body and to control during performances & recording)
~ Nylon plastic strings
~ Turn levers with your hands to change keys (very difficult during playing)
~ Plays in half the possible keys
~ Smaller harps like mine are awkward to hold while playing, making proper technique nearly impossible
~ Lighter to move around than pedal harps

What Will You Do With It?

After releasing 6 albums featuring the harp, writing over 50 songs on the harp, and playing 150+ concerts over the last few years, I've proven to myself that I'm serious about this instrument. This is an investment into my career. There aren't enough harpist singer/songwriters in the world in my opinion, and I'm excited to continue to help fill that gap! Harps are often seen in the orchestra pit or at a wedding, but there's so much more it can do. Pedal harps don't degrade in value very much if they are cared for, and I'll be able to get a wider range of work with a pedal harp - weddings, concerts, recording work, and without having to sell it, I could keep my smaller harp to teach lessons on or to rent out.

How Much Are You Asking For?

My goal is $15,000. Pedal harps are extremely expensive instruments, ranging from $10,000-50,000 (or sometimes more!). I would have to save money for many years to be able to afford something like this, but with your help, I can start performing, writing, and recording on a pedal harp this year! Generally $15,000-20,000 will get you something pretty good, so the more money I raise, the better quality instrument I can afford.

All of the money I raise will go toward the base cost of a pedal harp. If there happens to be anything leftover, it will go towards these items: a case ($300-500), a dolly (~$350), an adjustable stool ($150-up), and a proper amplification setup ($300-1000). If I don't make my goal or come close to it, I'll either settle for a lower-end pedal harp or place the money towards a deposit, paying off the rest later. However, financing will probably not be an option for me, because of my small amount of student debt that wrecked my credit. Your help is truly needed!


What Will I Get For Donating?

Firstly, my DEEPEST GRATITUDE! Second, there are some great perks listed~ I'll be offering Ancient Wild CDs and concert tickets, music lessons, personal concerts in your home or via Skype, harp CDs in handcrafted sleeves, and more. Know that you're supporting someone who is deeply passionate about music and will continue to bring forth earth-inspired, heartfelt songs into this world.
Another way to help is just to share the campaign on social media! Get the word out to people who would be inspired to support the arts. The link is easy: www.igg.me/at/dreamharp.
Thank you so much for your support! 
All love,
Kate Wilde
theancientwild.org
youtube.com/theancientwild

story:
<<NOTE: Please select a perk if that is your intention! Use the donation box if you'd just like to provide a cash donation without a perk!!>>

ABOUT GRASS VALLEY TAIKO

Grass Valley Taiko (http://grassvalleytaiko.com/ ) is the local Japanese Taiko drumming group in Grass Valley, CA. Taiko drumming is a traditional Japanese art form which has been a part of Japanese culture for centuries. Under the guidance and teaching of our director, Mitzi Garnett, Grass Valley Taiko has been the place to learn Taiko drumming and perform for the local community since 2000. This year, marks a significant milestone in the life of Grass Valley Taiko. We’ve been invited to perform at the 2016 California Worldfest (http://worldfest.net/ ) taking place at the Nevada Country Fairgrounds on July 14-17, 2016.

OUR DRUMS NEED SOME LOVE!

We build all of our large performing drums out of recycled wine barrels. The process in making a Taiko drum takes several months and involves many hands. It’s a process of labor and love that we feel embodies the spirit of those who help contribute to the making of the drum. 

Unfortunately many of our drumheads are beginning to show the wear and tear of having been played over the last 16 years. We want to go on stage at Worldfest with the deepest thundering sound possible and that’s where we need your help. It costs about $250 to replace a Taiko drumhead, and we need to replace 14 drumheads in our inventory of performing drums.

We would love to have you in the audience at the California Worldfest, supporting us and knowing that you have helped make this performance the best that we can offer. Therefore we are offering you the opportunity to join us by contributing to this crowdfunding campaign. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP

If you enjoy our music and the Taiko artform, why not contribute $250 to help us replace a drumhead?

In exchange, we’ll give you a 4-day adult pass to the event (value: $190), along with a Grass Valley Taiko t-shirt to wear at the event, this year’s tenugui** and we’ll engrave your name* on the drumskin so that you can be with us in spirit on stage.

If $250 is too much for your budget, we have other contribution levels and rewards or we’ll take any monetary contribution you’re able to make and help support us in this fundraising effort. We'll take all the love you can give us...

WE NEED TO START NOW

The California Worldfest event is only 3 months away. Rehearsals have started already and we need to work the reskinning project into our busy schedules. We are going to have some busy weekends ahead in order to get the drums in shape for the event. If you are going to contribute, please do it early, so that we can get started on the reskinning project.

HELP GET THE WORD OUT

Please help us spread the word about this campaign to others in your circle of family and friends who love Taiko! Use the sharing tools below to share on your social media circles.

*Note:  Due to lack of space, names engraved on drumheads are subject to edits [with your approval]

**A Tenugui (手拭い) is a thin Japanese hand towel, about 35 by 90 centimeters in size, and made of cotton. Each year, we print a new Tenugui with a unique image along with the Grass Valley Taiko stamp.

JOIN GRASS VALLEY TAIKO

We are proud to bring you this exciting traditional Japanese art form. If you’d like to experience the excitement of Taiko first hand, we invite you to join our beginner classes which take place every Thursday evening 5:30 – 7:00 pm. Check out the Grass Valley Taiko website for more details!

story:
Our New Home

Wicked Squid Recording Studios is a family.  We have all come together for the love of music and our deep passion for creativity.  As some of you may know we opened our brick and mortar recording studio at 429 State St. this past summer.  Although the space has been a sanctuary for a long list of bands over the past months, we have decided to take the leap of faith into a much larger facility.  It is with joy and a hopeful eye to the future that we come to you, our family, friends, and community, to help us build it!


Why We Need Your Help

Plain and simple we are in need of three things… designs, materials, and labor. 

The materials list for our buildout is a bit different from a typical business.  Whereas many construction jobs require run of the mill materials, ours requires materials that are specifically engineered to deal with sound.  For all of the materials we have budgeted $19,000

Recording studios can also be a tricky thing to plan.  Unlike a conventional office space, recording studios require careful attention to detail to ensure the acoustic integrity of each room.  Because of this, the design process requires a pro!  For this we have budgeted $4,000.    

Finally, we do need to hire a masonry team to aid in the pouring of our floors.  Although we are planning on building the majority of the studio ourselves, masonry is something we simply can not do.  For this we have budgeted $3,000. 


Building a Community

No matter the amount, your friendly donation will make a huge impact on not only the construction of a new studio, but more importantly the development of a community.  When it comes to recording studios there are few that offer the wide variety of services and community events that we do here at Wicked Squid.  By donating today you are fostering a community of music lovers that is heavily engaged and committed to the Rochester music scene.  

As you can see from our donation incentives, we are not only offering customizable recording packages, but gear repairs, lessons, and educational workshops as well. Your contribution will allow us to continue to provide community events such as our monthly Trash-Wave Revue Show, our Bands N Brews web series, and other community outreach initiatives.

Ultimately, your help will provide a home away from home for a variety of established and emerging artists. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people are not able contribute financially, we understand that!  There are many ways you can help! We happily accept donations of any kind, including those in the form of supplies and labor!

You can also help by getting the word out! Posting our campaign on social media is tremendously helpful, and crucial to making this a successful campaign.

Click on the Indiegogo share tools, and share now! 

Sincerest thanks from the Wicked Squid Family!

story:
All Aboard the Love Train!

Sammy Bravo will return to NYC’s famed music venue, The Cutting Room (44 E 32nd Street) on Friday, March 4, 2016 to launch the Spring leg of his upcoming tour, entitled Sammy Bravo: Love Train.


L is for Love

Love Train is Bravo’s most widely known song, a soon to-be-released single, and the basis of the 2016 tour. The song itself was inspired by a 2010 New York Times article detailing the high volume of missed love connections that take place on the L train, the “horizontal hotbed of hipsters,” that services Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The Love Train concert will loosely tell the story of a relationship through a gritty, upbeat and sexy series of original songs by the NYC-based, Honduran-born singer/songwriter.

Joining Bravo on the Love Train tour and recording will be a 10-piece band of talented musicians including superstar Israeli DJ, Ann Streichman, who will jump start each engagement with her own unique brand of electronic funk.  Bravo’s 13-song set will integrate Latin, Reggae, Funk and Disco for an explosive night of music, dancing, special guests, and tons of surprises. 


A is for Artist

Sammy Bravo is an NYC-based singer / songwriter. Originally from Tegucigalpa, Honduras, Sammy moved to the United States at the age of eight, first to Miami and then to Houston. Sammy’s love for music began at the early age of three when he would replicate jingles from television commercials and the music his mother listened to on his toy piano. Recognizing his passion for music, his mother eventually bought him a proper keyboard and he began playing in school and at church. His musical abilities grew further when he joined the school band, playing the bass clarinet. At college, he studied musical theatre and discovered a love for the work of composers like Stephen Sondheim, Andrew Lloyd Webber, Cole Porter and other greats. He started to experiment with writing his own lyrics to their melodies, which gave way to an interest in songwriting. Sammy quickly began writing and performing his own music which was a perfect way to merge his love of singing with his natural musical ability. His love of Cole Porter’s music lead him on a musical journey that started with early jazz, African American spiritual music, and eventually Gospel and Soul. As his talent for writing expanded, he began to blend his new musical tastes with the sounds of favorite artists from his childhood, including Selena, Shakira, and Gloria Estefan. In 2008 Sammy moved to NYC and began to seriously pursue a career in music. Now with nearly 90 songs in his catalogue, Sammy has performed in venues throughout New York City, including The Triad Theater, Uncle Charlie’s, The Duplex, The Shrine World Music Venue, Sylvana,The United Palace Theater and most recently a sold out 13 piece band showcase at The Cutting Room. Drawing inspiration from artists such as Stevie Wonder, Selena, Amy Winehouse, and Erykah Badu, Sammy has truly honed his unique singular sound. He describes his music as Latin Soul and makes heavy use of brass, bass, strong percussive rhythm, and heavy background vocals. 


S is for Support

Sammy Bravo is seeking $12,000 to cover the following:

LOVE TRAIN SINGLE - Sammy needs to go back into the studio to finish production on the Love Train single and several remixes (acoustic, club, guest DJ, etc.). The goal is to release the EP on Friday, May 27, 2016 on Bravo’s own label, BELLO Records. The process is already underway thanks to donations from Bravo’s Living Room Series at Sutton Place South and personal funds.

LOVE TRAIN MUSIC VIDEO - Sammy will begin shooting the Love Train music video on April 2, 2016 on location in Williamsburg and various venues in NYC.

LOVE TRAIN TOUR - Donations to the Indiegogo Campaign will partially underwrite the Love Train Tour, which will include:

       The Cutting Room (Tour Launch) - Friday, March 4, 2016

       RockWood Music Hall (Single Release Concert) - Friday, April 1, 2016

       Stage 72 (Video Release Concert) - Thursday, May 26, 2016

       Private Venue (EP Release Event) - Friday, June 24, 2016

       Fire Island Pines White Hall - July 2016


B is for Budget

If Sammy reaches his goal of $12,000, donations to the Indiegogo Campaign will be disbursed as follows:

Tour Rehearsals

Music Direction: $1,000

Musicians: $2,000

Video Production: $1500

Marketing: $600

TOTAL: $5,100

EP Recording Studio Session

Engineer: $800

Back-Up Singers: $400

Musicians: $1,000

Mixing and Mastering: $300

Album Art: $100

Copyright: $100

Marketing: $600

TOTAL  $3,300

Love Train Video Shoot

Film Crew: $2,000

Editing: $500

Marketing: $600

Production: $500

TOTAL: $3,600
story_txt:
All Aboard the Love Train!

Sammy Bravo
will return to NYC’s famed music venue, The
Cutting Room (44 E 32nd Street) on Friday, March 4, 2016 to launch the Spring leg of his upcoming tour, entitled Sammy Bravo: Love Train.

L is for Love
Love
Train is Bravo’s most widely known song, a soon to-be-released
single, and the basis of the 2016 tour. The song itself was inspired by a 2010 New York Times article detailing the
high volume of missed love connections that take place on the L train, the
“horizontal hotbed of hipsters,” that services Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The Love
Train concert will loosely tell the story of a relationship through a
gritty, upbeat and sexy series of original songs by the NYC-based,
Honduran-born singer/songwriter.

Joining
Bravo on the Love Train tour and recording will be a 10-piece band of
talented musicians including superstar Israeli DJ, Ann Streichman, who will jump start each engagement with her own
unique brand of electronic funk.  Bravo’s
13-song set will integrate Latin, Reggae, Funk and Disco for an explosive night
of music, dancing, special guests, and tons of surprises. 


A is for Artist
Sammy Bravo is an
NYC-based singer / songwriter. Originally from Tegucigalpa, Honduras, Sammy
moved to the United States at the age of eight, first to Miami and then to
Houston. Sammy’s love for music began at the early age of three when he would
replicate jingles from television commercials and the music his mother listened
to on his toy piano. Recognizing his passion for music, his mother eventually
bought him a proper keyboard and he began playing in school and at church. His
musical abilities grew further when he joined the school band, playing the bass
clarinet. At college, he studied musical theatre and discovered a love for the
work of composers like Stephen Sondheim, Andrew Lloyd Webber, Cole
Porter and other greats. He started to experiment with writing his own lyrics
to their melodies, which gave way to an interest in songwriting. Sammy quickly
began writing and performing his own music which was a perfect way to merge his
love of singing with his natural musical ability. His love of Cole Porter’s
music lead him on a musical journey that started with early jazz, African
American spiritual music, and eventually Gospel and Soul. As his talent for
writing expanded, he began to blend his new musical tastes with the sounds of
favorite artists from his childhood, including Selena, Shakira, and Gloria
Estefan. In 2008 Sammy moved to NYC and began to seriously pursue a career in
music. Now with nearly 90 songs in his catalogue, Sammy has performed in venues
throughout New York City, including The Triad Theater, Uncle Charlie’s, The
Duplex, The Shrine World Music Venue, Sylvana,The United Palace Theater and
most recently a sold out 13 piece band showcase at The Cutting Room. Drawing
inspiration from artists such as Stevie Wonder, Selena, Amy
Winehouse, and Erykah Badu, Sammy has truly honed his unique singular sound. He
describes his music as Latin Soul and makes heavy use of brass, bass, strong
percussive rhythm, and heavy background vocals. 

S is for Support
Sammy
Bravo is seeking $12,000 to cover the following:
LOVE
TRAIN SINGLE - Sammy needs to go back into the studio to finish production on
the Love
Train single and several remixes (acoustic, club, guest DJ, etc.). The
goal is to release the EP on Friday, May 27, 2016 on Bravo’s own label, BELLO Records. The process is already
underway thanks to donations from Bravo’s Living
Room Series at Sutton Place South and personal funds.
LOVE TRAIN
MUSIC VIDEO - Sammy will begin shooting the Love Train music video on
April 2, 2016 on location in Williamsburg and various venues in NYC.
LOVE TRAIN
TOUR - Donations to the Indiegogo Campaign will partially
underwrite the Love Train Tour, which will include:
       The Cutting Room (Tour Launch) - Friday, March 4, 2016

       RockWood Music Hall (Single Release Concert) - Friday, April 1, 2016
       Stage 72 (Video
Release Concert) - Thursday, May 26, 2016
       Private Venue (EP
Release Event) - Friday, June 24, 2016
       Fire
Island Pines White Hall - July 2016


B is for Budget



If Sammy reaches his goal of $12,000, donations to the Indiegogo Campaign will be disbursed as
follows:

Tour Rehearsals

Musicians: $2,000

story:
Sejam bem vindos à minha jornada musical!!! 

Meu nome é Bárbara Starling, sou uma compositora brasileira, e desde pequena, a música sempre foi, para mim, uma espécie de viagem astral.... A sensação de tocar um instrumento sempre foi fantástica, os cenários mentais que a música me despertava traziam a certeza de que podemos ter uma percepção diferente do tempo.

Foi partindo deste ambiente onírico que comecei a compor o album Sonambulando, fundamenta­ndo-me no princípio de que partes e todo, em sentido absoluto, não existem. A parte é o todo em si mesmo e, simultaneamente, uma parte de algo maior. Assim tenho buscado, através destas composições, construir uma narrativa harmônica voltada para a subjetividade do pensamento, na qual a música é uma máquina do tempo, uma ferramenta de teletransporte da alma na ligação sensorial entre realidade e sonho. 

***************************************************************************

SONAMBULANDO - BARBARA STARLING´S DEBUT ALBUM

Welcome to my music journey!

My name is Bárbara Starling, I´m a brazilian composer and since I was very small, music´s been, for me, a sort of astral projection… all those awesome sensations I had while playing an instrument, built mental landscapes and brought the feeling that we can have a different perspective about time.

From this dreamy environment I started composing Sonambulando album, substaining on the principle that parts and whole, in their absolute meaning, don´t exist. The part holds the whole in itself and, simultaneously, it´s a part of something bigger. Therefore, I seek through this compositions, to build an harmonic narrative focused on the subjectivity of thought, in which music is like a time machine, a tool to teletransport the soul in its sensorial connection between reality and dream.

São incontáveis as horas que estudo para aprimorar meus conhecimentos musicais em busca de uma identidade sonora distinta, e para realizar este projeto, há sempre o aspecto financeiro que envolve o processo de produção de um album.

Toda a gravação tem sido realizada no Estudio Verde, em Belo Horizonte, sob orientação do produtor Robertinho Brant, o qual tem inúmeras colaborações com grandes talentos da música brasileira, como Seu Jorge, Bebel Gilberto, Milton Nascimento, Beto Guedes, Toninho Horta, Nivaldo Ornelas, Jaques Morelembaum, Boca Livre, Lô Borges e Marina Machado.

Para conseguir suportar os gastos referentes a um trabalho de qualidade, surgiu a idéia de abrir um espaço virtual onde aqueles que sintam vontade, possam contribuir, através de doações, para a execução desta idéia. 

A sua doação irá ajudar a cobrir os seguintes custos:

1. Pré- Produção: A aventura começa aqui! Reúno-me com o produtor, fazemos uma revisão das músicas já compostas e delineamos um esboço dos arranjos para cada uma das músicas. É nesta primeira etapa que traçamos mapas estruturais que irão guiar todos os músicos envolvidos no projeto, desta forma, rentabilizamos melhor o tempo de gravação em estúdio e clarificamos os objetivos para cada uma das músicas.

2. Gravação: Esta é a etapa na qual gravamos todos os instrumentos, vozes e quaisquer outros elementos que farão parte dos arranjos musicais. É nesta fase que convido músicos talentosos para adicionarem "cor e textura" às paisagens sonoras. Até agora tenho trabalhado com baixo, bateria, teclados vintage, ukulele, hang drum, berimbau, trompete, saxofone, percussão, violoncelo, guitarra, violão e sintetizadores. 

3. Mistura e Masterização: Nesta fase, todas as músicas passam por um processo de equalização no qual o volume dos instrumentos, texturas e dinâmicas são balanceados de forma a criar um ambiente equilibrado, dando vida a uma entidade única. Como etapa final, as faixas do album passam pelo processo de masterização, que consiste em revisar todo o material com o objetivo de apurar a qualidade do que foi produzido e utilizar ferramentas para colocar o áudio dentro dos padrões necessários para replicá-lo.

Logicamente, o aspecto econômico não é a única forma de participar, a ajuda em difundir esta campanha é igualmente importante!

I spend countless hours studying, finding inspiration, creating original songs and researching the best way to put everything collectively together. So, to carry out this project, there is always the financial aspect related to an album production process.

All recording process has been made at Estudio Verde, Belo Horizonte, oriented by the producer Robertinho Brant, which has many collaborations with great talents of brazilian music such as Seu Jorge, Bebel Gilberto, Milton Nascimento, Beto Guedes, Toninho Horta, Nivaldo Ornelas, Jaques Morelembaum, Boca Livre, Lô Borges and Marina Machado.

In order to support the high costs related to a top quality work, I came up with the idea to create a virtual space in which those who feels like, can contribute through donation, to implement this idea.

So, your donation will cover the following costs:

1. Pre-Production: This is where the journey begins! I meet the producer, we start to review all original song ideas and draw an arrangement sketch for each of these tracks. Here we map out the music´s structures to guide all musicians and ensure a maximum use of the studio and establish clear goals for each song before we start recording.

2. Recording: At this point we record all instruments, voices and any other element that will eventually become a part of the arrangement. It´s in this phase that I invete very talented musicians to join me and put some "colors and textures" to the sound landscapes. Until now I´ve been working with drums, bass, guitars, ukulele, violoncelo, trumpet, saxophone, berimbau, hang drum, percussion, vintage keyboards and synthesizers.  

3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.  

Of course, the economic aspect is not the only way to participate, all help on spreading this campaign is also very important!

Tenho o prazer de oferecer packs de "recompensa" como forma de demonstrar minha gratidão pela auxilio em seguir com este sonho. É para mim uma felicidade muito grande poder partilhar com todos este universo sonoro que há muito permeia meu ser!

****************************************************************************I am pleased to offer packages of "reward" as a way to show my gratitude for your assistance in following with this dream. I feel blessed to share with all of you this sound universe that long permeates my being! 

Best Vibes to all of you!!!

story:
Hi, and welcome to SNUG!

My name is Vihren Paounov. I am a bassist, a 3D modeler and animator and I am the inventor of SNUG. 

SNUG is the ultimate solution to your guitar stand troubles!

Gigging is a big part of my life and going to venues has always involved howling equipment. My guitar stand was always the last thing I wanted to carry on top of my already voluminous gear. So as a result I almost never took it along and I'd end up leaning my bass on chairs, on my amp or on the wall. Nothing wrong with that, only It would often slide and come crushing on the floor. And we have all seen it happen. Well, no more! With SNUG I can lean my bass, guitar, violin, cello, 4,5,6 string bass or my upright bass safely anywhere.  I take my SNUG along everywhere, every time I play and I use it at home as well. Always.


The device allows you to safely lean your guitar on any wall or even your amp. It is  super stable and  incomparably smaller than any guitar stand in the market today . You simply clip the gadget to the instrument’s neck and then lean the instrument on the wall, just like you normally would. SNUG will safely guard all standard string instruments from the violin to the upright bass,

For more on the product please visit 

https://www.facebook.com/SNUGstand/

SNUG is versatile:

SNUG will work with all standard neck instruments from the violin to the upright bass, including the 5 and 6 string electric bass.

Snug is safe:

Snug is made of materials gentile to your instrument and the surface it leans on. The sturdy steel core of the legs is covered with a stylish foam rubber which comes useful when you lean your instrument on a corner of your amp or wall. Also, at the end of each leg there is a non-slip clear silicon tip. The silicone tips will grip to most surfaces including glass.

SNUG fits:

Snug weighs next to nothing and will fit anywhere you could fit a pair of drumsticks.It’s safe to put SNUG inside your case next your guitar. It’ll fit in most guitar case pockets.

SNUG is simple:

SNUG is simple and elegant by design but it's got a great deal of precision and technology behind it. SNUG has moving parts which must rotate smoothly but with a good degree of stiffness. SNUG must remain tightly attached to your instrument and at the same time be gentle to the neck's surface. A lot of experimentation and research goes to insure those requirements.


SNUG Is patented in the United States and is invented by a musician for musicians.

I’ve been working on this invention for two years now and today I have a US patent and a working prototype. My technical education and my professional experience in 3D modeling and animation has allowed me to create hi quality, 3D printed  prototypes, which I am now able to test and tweak to hi precision.

With your support I’ll be able to: 

-cover initial startup expenses, such as office rent, the purchasing of a desktop 3D printer etc.

-continue prototyping until design and functionality are perfected through testing and feedback from users, -

-manufacture a 3D printed mold for injection molding. A  3D jet printing technology  will be used to create a smooth and accurate mold.

-manufacture a significant number of sample prototypes which will be used for percks and to create interest around the product and hopefully generate orders by the end of 2016

Thanks for tuning in and thank you for your support!

story:
What is Again Again?

As first time moms and veteran recording artists in Los Angeles, we started getting tired of our kid's music rotation.  In the search for expanding our playlist so that both children and their adults could enjoy it, we started writing our own songs. The next step was to produce those songs and the step after that.... share them!

We have created kid-friendly music for ages 0 through 99 in hopes that on that next long car ride... there's something you and your kids can agree on.  The music is geared for children 2 through 6 with content that supplements academic lessons as well as life.  We've had classroom experience and there are certain educational topics we wish we had music to accompany the lesson.  We want to fill in the gaps. Not only can Again Again be listened to in the car or at home, but also in the classroom.

Through song, Again Again wants to help children develop well in the heart and in the mind.

We are indie artists and know what it takes to complete a music project. The biggest obstacle to getting amazing music out? Funds, and we need your support.

This collection of music will have 10 songs covering topics ranging from getting dressed to the first day of school.  Check out our playlist so far! 

https://soundcloud.com/againagainmusic/sets/again-again

What We Need & What You Get

The math has been done, the numbers have been crunched and the total comes to $14,000.

With your assistance,  Again Again can bring these compositions to life.  This project needs to be professionally mastered.  Our producers, musicians, artists and designers need to be paid. Replication is needed. Promotion and social media presence is required. And if Again Again takes the show on the road, we'll need a few items of gear to make that happen. We need your help.

Here's a basic list of expenses yet to come:

PHASE I ($7,000):

•Mastering • CD Replication • Production • Musicians • Copyright  • Distribution • Artwork

PHASE II ($7,000):

• Public Relations • Radio Campaign • Web Design • Photography • Self Published Lyric and Art Book • Performance Gear • Music Video Production • Editing

Team Work makes the Dream Work!  

In addition to the money we've already put into this project, any money we raise will first go to compensating the artists that are joining us to make Again Again a reality.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the music, share this page, talk about Again Again with your friends and child's teacher, give us feedback on which tracks you like and what you'd want to hear in the future!!

The next step was to produce those songs and the step after that.... share them!We have created kid-friendly music for ages 0 through 99 in hopes that on that next long car ride... there's something you and your kids can agree on.  The music is geared for children 2 through 6 with content that supplements academic lessons as well as life.  We've had classroom experience and there are certain educational topics we wish we had music to accompany the lesson.  We want to fill in the gaps. Not only can Again Again be listened to in the car or at home, but also in the classroom.Through song, Again Again wants to help children develop well in the heart and in the mind.We are indie artists and know what it takes to complete a music project. The biggest obstacle to getting amazing music out? Funds, and we need your support.This collection of music will have 10 songs covering topics ranging from getting dressed to the first day of school.  Check out our playlist so far! https://soundcloud.com/againagainmusic/sets/again-againWhat We Need & What You GetThe math has been done, the numbers have been crunched and the total comes to $14,000.With your assistance,  Again Again can bring these compositions to life.  This project needs to be professionally mastered.  Our producers, musicians, artists and designers need to be paid. Replication is needed. Promotion and social media presence is required. And if Again Again takes the show on the road, we'll need a few items of gear to make that happen. We need your help.Here's a basic list of expenses yet to come:PHASE I ($7,000):•Mastering • CD Replication • Production • Musicians • Copyright  • Distribution • ArtworkPHASE II ($7,000):• Public Relations • Radio Campaign • Web Design • Photography • Self Published Lyric and Art Book • Performance Gear • Music Video Production • EditingTeam Work makes the Dream Work!  In addition to the money we've already put into this project, any money we raise will first go to compensating the artists that are joining us to make Again Again a reality.  Other Ways You Can HelpShare the music, share this page, talk about Again Again with your friends and child's teacher, give us feedback on which tracks you like and what you'd want to hear in the future!!

story:
So, what's this all about?

Hello friends, I'm Lauren Nikohl, singer and songwriter based in Los Angeles, California. I began my musical journey with your help in Minneapolis, Minnesota when I released my debut EP titled The Night last year. Being an independent artist through this journey has been a rewarding experience, and I now wish to continue my momentum into 2016!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about this campaign on social media. Use those Indie Gogo share tools!
  • Message/Email all of your friends and ask them to follow Lauren Nikohl on Spotify, Facebook, SoundCloud, Instagram, and spread the word about her as a recording artist. Maybe even share a YouTube video to help her gain a larger audience!
Thank you all so much for your efforts in this process. It is with a humble heart that I accept your financial support in this time of my music career, and I will never go a day in my life without being grateful for all of the support I have already received in order to pursue my dreams!
Warm Regards,
     Lauren Nikohl

story:
Clearly Invisible - The New Album

It's been a busy few years and now the band and I are ready to bring you a new album.  We're really excited about this next step in the band's career and we'd really appreciate your help to make it happen.  It's our first, full studio album with 14 new songs exploring adversity, fatherhood, blood ties, family and escapism all in our unique blend of pop/alternative with a classical twist. 

Songwriting is my true passion in life and I've always felt a desire to create music that utilises classical instruments, particularly strings.  As a result, my influences and inspirations span Rachmaninov, Vaughan Williams, Samuel Barber, John Barry, Ludovico Einaudi and Hans Zimmer crossed with Damien Rice, Elbow, Pink Floyd and Burt Bacharach. 

The past few years has seen the orchestra performing live regularly across the South East of the UK with regular slots at The Pheasantry in London, as well as tours of Germany and the USA.  In the winter of 2014, I was invited to support Joan Armatrading on tour and have been lucky enough to receive airplay on BBC Radio 2, BBC Radio London, BBC Radio Kent as well as many independent and international radio stations. 

 Watch our video that we released last year for 'Don't Forget'.


Performing is what we love to do but at the same time a catalogue of new material has been building and we'd love to get it out to a wider audience. The immediate goal is to record and produce these new songs for release in the early summer 2016.  This will be supported by single releases to promote the album with the longer term objective of touring later in 2016 with the new material. 

The Goal & Your Perks

 

We're looking for £4000 which will cover:Studio recording time, producer, mastering, duplication, artwork and promotion. 

In return, we're offering options from signed copies of the CD, VIP album launch tickets, signed prints of the orchestra or signed copies of the CD artwork to the opportunity for a personal mini concert. 

We have opted for flexible funding, so if we don't achieve the full goal, all funds will still go towards the project. 

If we are lucky enough with your help and support to over-achieve our target, we will use additional funds for promotion and towards an album tour.

Other Ways We'd Appreciate Your Help 

We know that not everyone is able to help financially.   If you like our music and you would like to help, we'd hugely appreciate your support in getting this campaign to a wider audience.

We will be actively promoting our album campaign via social media (facebook, twitter, instagram) in addition to physical leafleting and email marketing. We would heartily appreciate any help you can offer in terms of spreading the word.

Thank you so much in advance for your support

Best wishes

Paul

story:
Join Jason Simonds as he produces his debut CD!

Some things are a long time in coming, and so it is with this CD project. Jason formed the Wicked Blues Band in 2012 with the goal of writing and singing his own music and for a little over two years, that is just what happened. During this time he and his initial band members worked on the Maine club scene where Jason worked on his stage presence and polished his style and wrote many songs.  A very prolific writer, Jason cranks out lyrics faster than he can put them to music, and getting these works recorded is a major goal.  This CD project will feature at least 11 of his original songs (probably more, oh heck who are we kidding, there are over 20 originals that the band is playing now!) in a studio recording project with a release date of late winter of 2017.
 



What We Need

The "Wicked" group has the talent and the material, but we will need a little help to fund this project. In order to bring out a CD, fees have to be paid in advance to cover the costs of manufacturing the and paying for things like UPC codes, inclusion in distribution through online outlets, and for downloadable purchases of the CD. There are also studio musicians to pay for recording sessions.  The target is to raise at least $2500.  


The funds raised will be used to in part to pay for:

  • Recording space
  • Artwork preparation
  • Photography
  • CD & case production and printing
  • CD Posters for use in retail selling and promoting.
  • Session Musicians Fees
  • Mastering Fees
     

Jason operates a venture called Bunker Hill Sound and has been providing sound and recording services since 2014. What this means to the project is that the recording process will take place "in house" and that the many thousands of dollars normally required to record and mix  a project of this nature will not be needed.  It is Jason's goal to pay all musicians a session fee, along with being able to bring in some very special guests. When the campaign reaches its goal, much of the funding will be used to help manufacture and market the CD to radio and other media sources locally, nationally and internationally. Your support makes all this possible! You can help make a dream come true.


A Little Back Story

This is quite a leap. Imagine yourself at the age of 50+ deciding that you want to be a singer of blues and record your own songs. Jason's past is filled with being on stage acting, singing and even dancing! He has filled lead roles in many plays singing to large and small audiences, but he will tell you that being out in front of a band, singing your own songs is such a totally different experience than acting out a role.  As he contemplated this path back in 2011, Jason started feeling out his potential singing at open mics and even (gasp) Karaoke. Once enough people had told him he needed to do more with his singing, he sought out musicians to form a band and to get the show on the road.

Developing an onstage presence is a thought provoking process according to Jason.  He felt it was crucial to his music, to not "put on the performer suit" when he went on stage, but to allow himself to grow into his stage skin as an extension, or amplification, of himself. He says that the blues is a way of life. What he means by this is, the blues is the expression of those deepest feelings, the ones that thrill us and the ones that bring us crashing down. He is now ready to share his version of the blues with the world. Your support will allow this dream to become reality.


Jason Says "It has been a lot of hard work, getting to this point. So many hours of rehearsals and time spent writing lyrics and creating melodies, singing in the shower, in the car and almost any time it won't freak other people out. This project is ... daunting ....very challenging ... it is me putting myself out there. I have a solid group of musicians behind me and some guest artists lined up that will be sure  to please. I also am very excited to be able to include  everyone else in it through this Indiegogo funding campaign. I myself have recently funded three other artists because I believe in what they are doing, and it takes so little. It has been a joy to watch several other artists fulfill their dreams.

This is a heart and soul project. It is me, putting myself out there. I have said before, that it may have been a good thing to wait 35 years to start a music career. I do know that I am proud of the songs I have been writing and I want to share them with everyone. The band and I think we have something good to show everyone.

There will be a few of the older tunes that fans will remember, but will also be many new songs that few have yet to hear. The Wicked Blues Band is sounding better than ever and we'll have many new surprises the next time you see us. I am excited to also be working with some special guests that have been invited to be on this CD, and you too can join the band and be a part of one of our songs by grabbing one of the exclusive "Be There" park rewards.

Thank you for considering contributing and as a way to thank you I have put together a few Perks that will sweeten the pot a bit and make your support  a little more special for you and more helpful to this project.

I would be remiss if I did not also thank the members of the band and the guest artists that have agreed to work with me in creating this recording. You see, I am just a singer and writer. I cannot play the instruments they do, and although I have tried, my focus is on singing and writing and I am ok with this. However, were it not for the talent and patience of the talented musicians I work with, none of this would be possible. So to them, Thank You!!"


What Do You Get?
By participating in this fundraising effort you will be helping an original artist create his music in a format that will be shared and distributed to a world wide audience via the Internet, radio, international distribution, and sales right here at home through local merchants. You  have the opportunity pre-buy the CD, or a download, or a CD with various perks. You will be one of the very first to get hear it!  Many efforts like this can offer all sorts of interesting premiums for higher levels of contribution and you can avail yourself to a few limited opportunities here as well. The real reward will be the music! ... but read on...

 

Above is a picture of the Limited Edition Wicked T... Very limited size availability!

The Poster is 17" wide and 11" high and looks sum sharp!


Other Ways You Can Help

Every Dollar Counts. There will be a few large contributors, and their funds will be critical, but so will the support from any and every one who is able to contribute. If you only have a dollar to donate, it will be appreciated and it will add up with the other participants efforts.

You can also be of *enormous* help by sharing this campaign on your Facebook or other social media outlets. If you have heard us play and know the band, please help spread the campaign.  Your ability to share this effort is almost as important as any funds you can give.

Thank you!

story:
Dear friends and supporters of Sahara Blues!
I'm ready to record a new album. After my first solo album from 2012, Anewal, my journey as a 'walking man' continues. From Niamey to Berlin and back to the Sahara.


Who am I?

My name is Alhousseini Mohamed Anivolla a.k.a. Anewal, which means 'walking man' and I am the lead singer and guitarist of the internationally known Desert Blues band Etran Finatawa from Niger. Since 2004 I have toured with them around the globe. Together we made four successful CDs for the British label World Music Network.

In 2012 I made my first solo album Anewal, a diary of my travels around the world and back again into the wilderness. It received international critical acclaim and Songlines magazine recently listed it as one of the '10 best Desert Blues' albums.

Since then it seems the world is changing faster than ever, sweeping us along like a flood. I have written a collection of new songs inspired by these changes and the need to speak out and communicate a message of peace and understanding.

In my songs I sing of the loss of cultural diversity throughout the world, social changes, climate change and the direct impact of these global effects on the people of my homeland as well as the importance of keeping our culture, our way of life, alive, strong and relevant.
My music is rooted in tradition. My music gives me strength. I would like to share this feeling with you through my new songs on a new album. Previously I have always worked with a record company but today the music industry is in crisis and many labels can no longer even offer to cover the costs. So I have decided to create the album myself, from recording to pressing.

And I'm making this campaign to ask you to help me finance it and share in the creative process!

The Project

Whatever the outcome of the campaign, the album will be made. The process is already under way! My new songs are ready and in June I will travel to Wales to record the new album with my friend Colin Bass as producer at Wild End Studio. Travel, studio time for recording and mixing will be the initial expenses.

After mixing there will be further costs for cover design, lay-outing and printing CDs. With your help I'm hoping to cover all these production costs. And if we get past the target I'll be able to employ someone to help promote the album across the media. All in all, the more support I can get, the more chance I will have to reach people with my music.

I hope you will join with me to help realise this very exciting project. Have a look at the 'perks' and make your own choice, whether for a digital download, a CD, signed copies, a signed cover photo, your name in the booklet or having your name in the album cover credits as executive producer!

All help is appreciated and I look forward to share the results with everybody.

I will be posting updates here and on my facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/anivolla2016/

Please feel free to contact me!

Thank you, Merci, Danke...!!

My music stands against the destruction of cultural diversity and it is an announcement to all destroyers: As long as we live, we make music!

Alhousseini Mohamed Anivolla

story:
The Basics

We started Amplify a little over a year ago with no idea about the kind of reception we would receive. We filmed our first Single Session with Stephen Day, releasing it in January 2015, and since then we've had the opportunity to work with over 50 artists from all different genres. Most of our Single Sessions feature our classmates at Belmont University, but now we're starting to grow outside of Belmont, producing sessions with artists in Nashville and Atlanta. Just a few weeks ago our production team even traveled to Los Angeles to capture Single Sessions. 

We're at a pivotal moment with Amplify and we have even more opportunities to spotlight artists in different cities. That's why we've decided to take Amplify on the road this July, hitting as many cities as we can between Nashville, TN and Boston, MA in a three week period. This is the first time we've ever done something on this kind of scale, and we're very excited. We do, however, need your help to get us started.

What We Need & What You Get

Amplify will be going on tour this July to create Single Sessions with artists all the way up the East Coast, but we need your support.

What We Need

  • ~$2,180 USD - Safe places to sleep at night for us and our car full of gear
  • ~$255 USD - Gas for all that driving we'll be doing
  • ~$400 USD - Royalty suite software and music distribution for the sessions
  • ~$165 USD - Cash for all those toll roads in New England
What You Get
  • $5 USD "The Smaller Swag" - We'll mail you an Amplify button and a sticker! We expect to have these out by August 2016.
  • $10 USD "You've Got Mail" - We'll mail you a postcard from a city we visit with a handwritten thank you note written on it plus all the perks from the previous tier! We expect to have these all sent by August 2016.
  • $35 USD "You Look Good in Green" - We'll mail you one of our first ever Amplify t-shirts plus all the perks from previous tiers! We expect to have these mailed by September 2016.
  • $50 USD "Stay Thirsty, My Friends" - We'll mail you a custom Amplify water bottle in addition to the perks from previous tiers! We expect to have these shipped by October 2016.
  • $75 USD "Ooh! Coffee Table Stuff!" - We'll be working on a printed tour journal while we're on the road, complete with photos from the road and journal entries from all of our members. Like the other packages, this one also includes previous perks. We should have these out by October 2016.
  • $200 USD "Share the Love" - Instead of putting a regular ad at the bottom of our Single Session webpages, we'll feature your business or cause. We'll also put your logo in the back of the printed tour journal to show our thanks and to get your name in front of as many people as possible. The tour journals should go out by October 2016, and the videos will be releasing on a recurring, weekly basis until we've released them all. This will ensure your business receives regular, consistent exposure to our audience of thousands of viewers.

I Can't Donate Financially, But I Can Help in Other Ways

As people living on tight budgets ourselves, we fully understand your situation and do not expect you to give anything out of your range of comfort. That being said, if you’re interested in helping out in other ways, such as making donations in kind, spreading the word, or helping us find artists to work with in the cities we’ll be visiting, you can let us know at the link to this Google form here. We sincerely appreciate any way in which you want to help and thank you for taking the time to tell us about it.

Some Final Words

Having the opportunity to help artists through Amplify over the past year has been one of the defining experiences of our lives thus far. Being musicians, photographers, videographers, engineers, actors, and writers ourselves, we all believe in the importance and power of art to impact people’s lives in big and meaningful ways. We want to help support the wonderful people who make that possible and ask that you please consider joining us in our commitment by donating.
Sincerely,
Mitchell, Joey, Forrest, and the rest of the Amplify Family
story_txt:
The Basics We started Amplify a little over a year ago with no idea about the kind of reception we would receive. We filmed our first Single Session with Stephen Day, releasing it in January 2015, and since then we've had the opportunity to work with over 50 artists from all different genres. Most of our Single Sessions feature our classmates at Belmont University, but now we're starting to grow outside of Belmont, producing sessions with artists in Nashville and Atlanta. Just a few weeks ago our production team even traveled to Los Angeles to capture Single Sessions. 
We're at a pivotal moment with Amplify and we have even more opportunities to spotlight artists in different cities. That's why we've decided to take Amplify on the road this July, hitting as many cities as we can between Nashville, TN and Boston, MA in a three week period. This is the first time we've ever done something on this kind of scale, and we're very excited. We do, however, need your help to get us started.   What We Need & What You Get
Amplify will be going on tour this July to create Single Sessions with artists all the way up the East Coast, but we need your support.
What We Need  
~$2,180 USD - Safe places to sleep at night for us and our car full of gear

~$255 USD - Gas for all that driving we'll be doing

~$400 USD - Royalty suite software and music distribution for the sessions

~$165 USD - Cash for all those toll roads in New England 


What You Get




$5 USD "The Smaller Swag" - We'll mail you an Amplify button and a sticker! We expect to have these out by August 2016.

$10 USD "You've Got Mail" - We'll mail you a postcard from a city we visit with a handwritten thank you note written on it plus all the perks from the previous tier! We expect to have these all sent by August 2016.

$35 USD "You Look Good in Green" - We'll mail you one of our first ever Amplify t-shirts plus all the perks from previous tiers! We expect to have these mailed by September 2016.

$50 USD "Stay Thirsty, My Friends" - We'll mail you a custom Amplify water bottle in addition to the perks from previous tiers! We expect to have these shipped by October 2016.

$75 USD "Ooh! Coffee Table Stuff!" - We'll be working on a printed tour journal while we're on the road, complete with photos from the road and journal entries from all of our members. Like the other packages, this one also includes previous perks. We should have these out by October 2016.

$200 USD "Share the Love" - Instead of putting a regular ad at the bottom of our Single Session webpages, we'll feature your business or cause. We'll also put your logo in the back of the printed tour journal to show our thanks and to get your name in front of as many people as possible. The tour journals should go out by October 2016, and the videos will be releasing on a recurring, weekly basis until we've released them all. This will ensure your business receives regular, consistent exposure to our audience of thousands of viewers.

I Can't Donate Financially, But I Can Help in Other Ways
As people living on tight budgets ourselves, we fully understand your situation and do not expect you to give anything out of your range of comfort. That being said, if you’re interested in helping out in other ways, such as making donations in kind, spreading the word, or helping us find artists to work with in the cities we’ll be visiting, you can let us know at the link to this Google form here. We sincerely appreciate any way in which you want to help and thank you for taking the time to tell us about it.

Some Final WordsHaving the opportunity to help artists through Amplify over the past year has been one of the defining experiences of our lives thus far. Being musicians, photographers, videographers, engineers, actors, and writers ourselves, we all believe in the importance and power of art to impact people’s lives in big and meaningful ways. We want to help support the wonderful people who make that possible and ask that you please consider joining us in our commitment by donating.

Sincerely,
Mitchell, Joey, Forrest, and the rest of the Amplify Family

story:
Brief Summary

Photographer Eric Garrison will travel to Nepal to document the production of the first western opera ever produced in Nepal.  On the first trip he will accompany the production team as they scout locations for the production, audition local talent, meet and hire local artisans and craftsmen to create sets, provide vocal workshops to local students, opera lectures for the local community, and more. Not only will the photographs tell the tale of the production, but also will tell the visual stories of the community that the production impacts.  

Later in the year Eric will travel back to Nepal to document the actual production of the opera itself. Eric plans to create a documentary photobook that also may include stories from the production team and others involved in the production of Arjuna's Dilemma.

The Photographer 

Eric  is a photographer living and working in Shanghai, China.  He specializes in street and documentary photography. His photographs are known for their human quality and authentic representation of life.  He also is technically sound but possesses a strong vision that allows him to capture the true nature of everyday life and find the beauty within it. He is a great fit for this project due to those photographic traits.  The production team hopes to capture the passion, creativity, cooperation, culture and hard-work, that all involved are bringing to the production.  

You can find his latest project as well as some of his photographic work at his website, Crossing China, or on 500px, or follow him on Instagram.


Nepal

The people of Nepal have been through a great deal since the two devastating earthquakes of 2015.  They are still rebuilding, still healing, and still in need of support.  Local expat advisor and member of the opera production team has helped raise $9,000 dollars so far for his friends in Nepal.  See his crowdfunding project here.  Find other ways to support Nepal here.


What We Need & What You Get

Funds donated to the campaign will be used in the following ways:

  • Help to fund two round-trip flights to Kathmandu for the photographer 
  • Help to fund the daily costs of the photographer while in Nepal over the course of several months 
  • Help to create a professionally produced, high-quality photobook documenting the production.
  • Any funds exceeding the $2000 sought will be used to fund a short documentary video of the production of Arjunna's Dilemma as well as for general support of the production of the Opera.

Perks

To show our appreciation for helping this project take place, we have a number of perks available based on your funding tier.  Please see the perks page for more information on each perk.

  • Handwritten thank you card from the photographer and production team sent from Nepal
  • Acknoweldgement in the photobook
  • Exclusive Discount on purchase of digital or physical photobook
  • Exclusive High-Res Digital Images for desktop wallpaper/mobile background
  • Exclusive High-Quality Prints from the Production of Arjunna's Dilemma 
  • Sponsorship Credit in Program 
  • Executive Producer Credit in Program and on Video Documentary 


The Impact

Helping to fund the documentary photography will

  • Increase awareness for tourism in Nepal 
  • Promote the work of local artisans and other members of the community hired to be part of the production
  • Fund a photobook and potential short video documentary about the project
  • Increase awareness for opera and performing arts in Nepal and across the globe
  • Help bring an open-air Western Opera production to the people of Nepal for the first time ever
  • Lay the groundwork for future productions of Arjunna's Dilemma around the world
  • Raise money for the people of Nepal through charitable contribution from the proceeds of this campaign as well as through hiring local workers and artists throughout the production


Risks and Challenges

Enough funding has been secured to ensure that production takes place, however we would like to spread awareness before, during and after the production in order to support the people of Kathmandu and Nepal as a whole as well as to further support this exciting production.  To achieve this the production team would like a documentary photographer present and part of the production. The production does have the funds to pay a photographer but Eric Garrison has generously agreed to donate his time and pay for as much as he can out of his own pocket. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, don't worry!  Help spread the word by sharing our campaign with your photography-loving friends and family or with your theater and opera loving friends and family!  Even without your monetary contribution, if you help spread the word far enough we will still have enough to support the artistic journey of the photographer and the production as whole, and you'll have the opportunity to enjoy the passion, pain, and ultimate success of our project through our photo and video documentary journey.




More About The Opera - Arjuna's Dilemma 

Arjuna’s Dilemma is a 70 minute chamber opera/oratorio by the American composer Douglas J. Cuomo, with text from the ancient Indian epic the Bhagavad Gita and the poetry of Kabir. It is a work of both sweeping grandeur and piercing intimacy. Produced by One World Theatre, the Asian Premiere of Arjuna’s Dilemma will take place in Kathmandu, Nepal, in September, 2016. 

DOUGLAS J. CUOMO, COMPOSER -

He creates unique original music for concert and theatrical stages, television, and film. Recent works include the operas Doubt, commissioned and premiered by Minnesota Opera; Arjuna's Dilemma, produced by Music-Theatre Group, premiere at Brooklyn Academy of Music Next Wave Festival; and Black Diamond Express Train to Hell, premiered by the American Composers Orchestra at Carnegie Hall. 

ONE WORLD THEATRE, PRODUCING THEATRE  -

Dedicated to presenting intercultural, social justice productions, especially plays from South Asia, the Western canon and contemporary American plays that are affordable, professional, experimental and relevant. One World Theatre is a registered not-for-profit theatre in Nepal. 

DEBORAH MEROLA, CO-PRODUCER AND STAGE DIRECTOR  - 

Founding Artistic Director of One World Theatre, 2003 and 2011 Senior Fulbright in Theatre in Nepal, Guest Lecturer at the Institute of Advanced Communication, Education and Research, and Director of the Theatre Program at Sushila Arts Academy. A Ph.D. in Dramatic Arts from UC Berkeley, Dr. Merola has directed over 60 productions. 

ROY STEVENS, CO-PRODUCER AND VOICE OF ARJUNA - 

International opera singer who has performed major roles in leading theatres and with symphony orchestras around the world, from Teatro alla Scala in Milan to the Metropolitan Opera, Barcelona’s Gran Theatre del Liceu, Dresden’s Semperoper, Valencia Symphony, and Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra. 

JONATHAN KHUNER, MUSIC DIRECTOR -

International conductor and prompter for the San Francisco Opera, the Metropolitan Opera, Lyric Opera of Chicago, Bayreuther Festspiele, New Israeli Opera and many other theatres and orchestras. In 2013 he conducted Albania’s first ever Wagner opera production Tannhäuser. 

GREG MITCHELL, SCENIC DESIGNER  -

Assistant Professor of Theatre at the University of California, Santa Barbara, and a freelance designer for theatre, opera, dance, music, television, and corporate events. His lighting and set designs have been seen internationally and nationwide in New York, Off-Broadway and regionally, in many important theatres and venues.

story:
Earlier this year in August, Sidekick Envy performed at the AMMBCON Showcase. At this showcase, scouts from WOMEX, MIDEM & SXSW attended. Sidekick Envy was successful in being selected to perform at SXSW (South by South West) Music Festival in March of 2016.

 

What is SXSW?

South by Southwest is a huge multi-media event held in Austin, Texas. SXSW features the kind of bands that typically only cool people know about. Mixing bands you've never heard of with legends in the same place at the same time.

The South by Southwest (SXSW) Conferences & Festivals offer the unique convergence of original music, independent films, and emerging technologies. Fostering creative and professional growth alike, SXSW is the premier destination for discovery.

Year after year, the event is a launching pad for new creative content. New media presentations, music showcases and film screenings provide buzz-generating exposure for creators and compelling entertainment for audiences. Conference panel discussions present a forum for learning, business activity thrives at the Trade Shows and global networking opportunities abound. Intellectual and creative intermingling among industry leaders continues to spark new ideas and carve the path for the future of each ever-evolving field, long after the events’ conclusion.

For more info check: http://www.sxsw.com/

 

Why is your support and contribution to this trip important?

  1. At SXSW many major record labels send their scouts to find new and potential artists to sign and to book for tours. Sidekick Envy would have the opportunity to be signed and booked. This would be a milestone for any Rock n’ Roll artist from Trinidad & Tobago.
  2. We are going to use this opportunity to start a movement. These SXSW performances will be filmed and videos will be uploaded and shared on YouTube, local & international television stations as well as social media sites such as Facebook & Twitter. Local excitement will be created as we reach the masses.
  3. Our goal is to to promote Sidekick Envy’s music as well as showcase to the world that amazing original Rock music is available in Trinidad & Tobago and create a market that international producers and record labels would be interested in investing.

 

Your contribution will help assure the success of Sidekick Envy reaching international exposure.
