story:
Short Summary

"I don't think in English; I think in Patwa!" This was one comment from a middle-aged woman living in an inner city community in Kingston.

"When I hear the bible in Patwa, I get it instantly!" This came from a teen-aged boy in a children's home in Clarendon, Jamaica.

Working with a Bible translation organization helped me to see the value of people hearing the Word of God in the language they understand at a heart level. My joy was full (or as we would say: "Mi glad bag bos!") when the Jamaican New Testament was launched in December 2012.

For over a year I have been posting to You Tube and Facebook video clips of me reading the Jamaican New Testament, aka the Patwa Bible. The positive responses have been overwhelming and I never cease to be amazed at the impact it is having on old and young, uptown and downtown, educated and pre-educated, Christian and non-Christian and Jamaicans and non-Jamaicans alike!

Up to this point, I have been using borrowed equipment to record and share these readings. The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds to purchase a Macbook Pro and a high lumens multimedia projector, to facilitate the continued sharing of the Word of God in the language that most Jamaicans understand at a heart level.

Here is a sample of the reading of the Jamaican New Testament by yours truly:



What We Need & What You Get
At the very least, we will need a Macbook Pro and a projector that will be effective in any lighting. However, what we would really like is to be able to produce these video clips at a much higher level for broadcast on television and internet to Jamaicans and non-Jamaicans locally and overseas. This could cost approximately US$200 per production. Aiming at at least one production per week, we would need $10,400 for one year's worth of programmes!
All productions will be done under the umbrella of CREW 40:4, a registered non-profit organization in Jamaica. CREW 40:4's mission is to promote love and unity in Christ through culturally relevant expressions of worship.

We have already, with the help of a gifted videographer/director/producer, produced a pilot of the project. Here it is!
In Here is another sample of his work, showcasing one of my compositions from the album Kom Mek Wi Worship:


Other Ways You Can Help

No contribution to this campaign would be considered too small! However, if you are currently unable to contribute, please consider sharing this appeal with your family, friends and acquaintances. Spread it abroad to all the people in your network. Share it far and wide, and KOM MEK WI WORSHIP!!

story:
Boycott The Baptist

Hi there we're Boycott The Baptist, a grindcore/punk/nun-core band based in Aberdeen/Lincoln UK.
We've been gigging constantly for the past 2 years of being together, 102 shows to be precise by January 2016 and after recording a demo and two ep's we are now looking at recording our debut album at Music Vision in Aberdeen.
To be able to successfully record/mix and release this album we need to raise the £1000 cash, put fuel in our band car to get us from A to B and so we can also get a decent music video sorted as well as band merchandise to go along with the release.
We're not into making a profit from all this, we just want to be able to get out music out there and not have to be too out of pocket at the end. Even if you can't donate get the word around.
Cheers, appreciate all the help.

story:
A little backstory

Hi, I'm Darius, a 35 year old aspiring singer/songwriter from Tennessee with a tremendous passion for music.  I began singing in my church's youth choir at the tender age of 3.  There I would develop a love for the harmonious sounds of blended voices and the church organ-so much that I'd eventually take piano lessons to hone that passion but unfortunately playing the piano would not be my gift.  

Despite my slow development to master the keys, my voice had not ever let me down.Even after puberty I found that I could still reach some pretty high notes.  But having a high voice during those teen years turned into a pretty brutal experience. I'd be ridiculed and teased often because of it which would ultimately keep me from performing at all.  My confidence was so bruised that I developed severe anxiety and stage fright.  

It wasn't until high school that I would find confidence in performing again after auditioning for an advanced choral group. I was eventually asked to write and perform music for an original high school musical. Although I knew music would be the avenue I needed to follow toward fulfillment I struggled a bit after graduation to find my footing or my place in the world.  Insecurity and eventually depression got the best of me and I settled for anything to make a living.

 It wasn't until 2006 that I'd post my first cover video on YouTube.  That video would turn into 40 more, attaining over 450 subscribers and an unexpected out pour of encouragement and support from people I'd never met, all over the world.  I'd rediscovered my passion for writing and pen some of my most personal lyrics to date. This is what I wish to share with you.  In honor of those you would not let me give up, even when I felt I wanted to.   

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign is to record an EP, which is a compilation of 6 original songs that will be available for free after it is recorded.  Recording and releasing this EP will give me the opportunity to get my music out there to the people who've continued to encourage me and hopefully to new fans who just appreciate good music.  The EP will be entitled 'Different' and is named after one of my most personal songs.  I struggled as a child, trying to find exactly where I fit in. I want this to be more than a song with catchy lyrics, but an anthem for anyone who needs an affirmation that it is absolutely ok just being yourself.  

Industry standard for mastering is generally around $100-$150 per track (estimated costs, $900). A mix engineer that will spend a 8 hours per song, will probably charge about $50 an hour (estimated costs, $2400). One can expect to pay $250-$500 per song to a producer (estimated costs, $3000). Potential budget will be a bit over $6000. 

To completely fund this project, I will need to raise $6000.  With the money you pledge, in addition to receiving the free download of the album, there will be something special in exchange for every donation you contribute.  I'm giving away everything from T-shirts with the printed 'Different' logo, to signed posters and free tickets to a live performance, featuring yours truly and a live band.  

The Impact

My lifelong dream is one day to be mentioned in the company of the greats, like Donny Hathaway, Carole King, Roberta Flack, Stevie Wonder.  These are just a few of my greatest influences.  I would describe my sound as a mix of soul, rock, r&b and gospel.  I think a lot of what is missing from music that we hear on the radio is that raw sound, pure emotion-lyrics that instantly connect you to that time in your life you'd forgotten, then awakens you in a way like nothing else.  I feel it is important to appreciate diversity in music.  I have something to say-I have something to sing!

Risks & Challenges

I'm giving myself 40 days to reach my goal to raise $6000.  If it is not met, I will use the funds I've raised to develop a shorter compilation of material (maybe a single or two) to just get started.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate you for even taking the time to check out my campaign.  Even if you can't or don't wish to contribute at this time, please spread the word by sharing the link to the video via Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, etc. Thank you for your time and consideration.
story_txt:
A little backstory Hi, I'm Darius, a 35 year old aspiring singer/songwriter from Tennessee with a tremendous passion for music.  I began singing in my church's youth choir at the tender age of 3.  There I would develop a love for the harmonious sounds of blended voices and the church organ-so much that I'd eventually take piano lessons to hone that passion but unfortunately playing the piano would not be my gift.  
Despite my slow development to master the keys, my voice had not ever let me down.Even after puberty I found that I could still reach some pretty high notes.  But having a high voice during those teen years turned into a pretty brutal experience. I'd be ridiculed and teased often because of it which would ultimately keep me from performing at all.  My confidence was so bruised that I developed severe anxiety and stage fright.  
It wasn't until high school that I would find confidence in performing again after auditioning for an advanced choral group. I was eventually asked to write and perform music for an original high school musical. Although I knew music would be the avenue I needed to follow toward fulfillment I struggled a bit after graduation to find my footing or my place in the world.  Insecurity and eventually depression got the best of me and I settled for anything to make a living.
 It wasn't until 2006 that I'd post my first cover video on YouTube.  That video would turn into 40 more, attaining over 450 subscribers and an unexpected out pour of encouragement and support from people I'd never met, all over the world.  I'd rediscovered my passion for writing and pen some of my most personal lyrics to date. This is what I wish to share with you.  In honor of those you would not let me give up, even when I felt I wanted to.      What We Need & What You Get The campaign is to record an EP, which is a compilation of 6 original songs that will be available for free after it is recorded.  Recording and releasing this EP will give me the opportunity to get my music out there to the people who've continued to encourage me and hopefully to new fans who just appreciate good music.  The EP will be entitled 'Different' and is named after one of my most personal songs.  I struggled as a child, trying to find exactly where I fit in. I want this to be more than a song with catchy lyrics, but an anthem for anyone who needs an affirmation that it is absolutely ok just being yourself.  
Industry standard for mastering is generally around $100-$150 per track (estimated costs, $900). A mix engineer that will spend a 8 hours per song, will probably charge about $50 an hour (estimated costs, $2400). One can expect to pay $250-$500 per song to a producer (estimated costs, $3000). Potential budget will be a bit over $6000. 
To completely fund this project, I will need to raise $6000.  With the money you pledge, in addition to receiving the free download of the album, there will be something special in exchange for every donation you contribute.  I'm giving away everything from T-shirts with the printed 'Different' logo, to signed posters and free tickets to a live performance, featuring yours truly and a live band.  
    The Impact My lifelong dream is one day to be mentioned in the company of the greats, like Donny Hathaway, Carole King, Roberta Flack, Stevie Wonder.  These are just a few of my greatest influences.  I would describe my sound as a mix of soul, rock, r&b and gospel.  I think a lot of what is missing from music that we hear on the radio is that raw sound, pure emotion-lyrics that instantly connect you to that time in your life you'd forgotten, then awakens you in a way like nothing else.  I feel it is important to appreciate diversity in music.  I have something to say-I have something to sing!
    Risks & Challenges I'm giving myself 40 days to reach my goal to raise $6000.  If it is not met, I will use the funds I've raised to develop a shorter compilation of material (maybe a single or two) to just get started.  
    Other Ways You Can Help I appreciate you for even taking the time to check out my campaign.  Even if you can't or don't wish to contribute at this time, please spread the word by sharing the link to the video via Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, etc. Thank you for your time and consideration.

story:
¿QUÉ SERÁ LA GIRA TRICICLO 2016?

La Gira Triciclo 2016 saca su nombre por las tres bandas que lo componen,

Hot Sugar Mama, Filoxera y Kontra(bando) quienes son las tres llantas que le darán movimiento a un espectáculo de música independiente de bandas guatemaltecas y los tres organizadores cada uno experto en su área que lo harán posible. 

La gira se realizaría los fines de semana, en nueve ocasiones:

2 de Abril - Ciudad de Guatemala
9 de Abril - Antigua Guatemala
23 de Abril - Cobán
29 de Abril - Quetzaltenango
30 de Abril - San Marcos
7 de Mayo - Chiquimula
13 de Mayo - Ciudad de Guatemala
14 de Mayo - El Salvador
18 de Mayo - Ciudad de Guatemala

El propósito es tener contacto directo con el público, compartir e intercambiar una experiencia fundamental. 

El show que ofrecemos es único en su clase, unimos el hip hop con funk psicodélico y pop rock en un estilo que nace de años de convivencia musical entre las bandas. Llevamos al mejor equipo con nosotros que está al tanto de todos los detalles para que esto sea realmente especial.

¿QUIÉNES SOMOS?

Somos las bandas guatemaltecas Hot Sugar Mama, Kontra y Filoxera, un grupo de amigos que persigue el sueño de hacer y compartir su música. Este estilo de vida nos ha llevado por caminos increíbles, nos ha dado la oportunidad de conocer a muchas personas y de tocar en varios escenarios alrededor del país.

En 2016 queremos llevar nuestra música a más personas y tenemos pensado hacerlo en forma de una gira. La gira consistiría en 9 shows grandes en el centro e interior del país de Guatemala y países aledaños.

Contamos en el área de organización con la ayuda de Varinnia Recinos organizadora del Proyecto internacional Sofar Sounds en Guatemala y asistente de dirección de la película “Hunting Party”,  Christa Krings y productora del WanderProject de Wanderlust en la cual trabajaron junto a Recinos en su 4ta entrega en 2015 y David Lemus licenciado y maestro de música. 

También tenemos la valiosísima colaboración cubriendo el área visual y documentación de la diseñadora gráfica Light Andrade, en el área de fotografía a Manuel del Busto.

Al ayudarnos a llevar a cabo esta gira contribuyes a que el alcance de la música sea más amplio, a que existan más giras de éste tipo dentro del país y a que la industria musical se desarrolle. ¡Principalmente nos ayudas a darte el show que te mereces!


¿POR QUÉ ESTAMOS RECAUDANDO FONDOS?

Presentar un buen show requiere de organización y equipo. Nosotros realizaremos esto 9 veces.

PERSONAL

·  Bandas y músicos

·  Equipo técnico de sonido

·  Equipo técnico de documentación

·  Management & Staff

EQUIPO

·  Equipo de audio

·  Equipo de luces

·  Instrumentos

Hemos logrado recaudar parte de la suma por nuestros propios medios, sin embargo esto requiere de una inversión mayor a la cual no podemos aspirar sin ayuda. 

En esta campaña pretendemos colectar un total de Q24,000 o $3,000. Esto es para asegurar los costos fijos como la renta del sonido, los salarios del equipo técnico y la iluminación como también cubrir el porcentaje de esta genial plataforma que nos permite lograr la meta. 

Por eso estamos ofreciendo varios beneficios a cambio de tu ayuda. Desde descargas, discos y  t-shirts EXCLUSIVOS DE LA GIRA, como también CONVIVENCIAS ESPECIALES con los artistas y agradecimientos PERSONALIZADOS. 

PERKS

Estos son algunos de los artículos maravillosos que te podes llevar. Recordá que la mercadería que te enviamos por tu contribución a esta campaña son versiones exclusivas a las que ofreceremos durante la gira.

¡SOLO FIRMAS!


LA MÚSICA


DISCO DE LA GIRA


TRICICLO


BACKSTAGE PASSES


JINGLE N MINGLE


JUNTA CON LA BANDITA


STAR GUITAR


¡TODA AYUDA ES BIENVENIDA!

Nos podes ayudar de muchas formas; donando en esta campaña, yendo a los toques, comprando la música y la mercadería de la gira y las bandas, nos podes ayudar compartiendo esta campaña con tus amigos (podes usar el botón que hay en esta misma página para compartir), compartiendo la música, siguiendo nuestra actividad en redes sociales y livestream.

El apoyo es fundamental para que el proyecto se pueda desarrollar, especialmente el de los fans, pues son quienes construyen este tipo de actividades y son desde ya una parte fundamental de la gira.

Se pretende perseguir un sueño y construir una industria musical.  Al final, se trata de que existan más opciones musicales, más impulso al arte y artistas expresándose en la región. ¡Vivos!

story:
TU MIRADA ME DICE: "AQUI ESTOY, DEJATE AMAR" - Hijo Mío (2007)

Mi nombre es Francisco Ruiz, soy cantante, compositor y educador musical. 

Hijo Mío es mi primer album completo, dedicado a toda mi familia de Schoenstatt en Ecuador, y de Latinoamérica.

Durante mis años de colegio comencé a jugar y explorar componiendo canciones. Los temas “La Respuesta Está En Tí” que habla de la lucha contra las drogas y el himno  “Tu y Yo Por Ellos” que nació en una Vigilia de Jose Engling, marcaron una línea en mí de expresar a través de la música ideales como joven Católico Cristiano, plasmar en la música vivencias tanto personales como de comunidad, y tratar de vivir mi espiritualidad de manera creativa.

La música tiene un poder impresionante. Actualmente trabajo en una Fundación en el centro-sur de Los Angeles con chicos de 8 a 21 años que viven en constante exposición a drogas, pandillas, abuso en el hogar, etc. Muchos te comentan que su amor y compromiso a un instrumento musical o a la composición o producción, literalmente les salvó la vida.


La música es el medio de desahogo para muchos, y he sido testigo de cuántas vidas han sido salvadas gracias a la disciplina y constancia que la música inspira en la vida de estos jóvenes. El trabajar día a día con ellos despertó en mí el anhelo de terminar éste disco que espero ayude a muchos jóvenes a seguir sus anhelos, a sentirse amados por Dios y reasegurar que en su vida existe un plan perfecto y un propósito en constante movimiento.


Lo Que Necesitamos, Y Lo Que TÚ Recibes

Mucha gente no es consciente del gran sacrificio y esfuerzo que es sacar un disco adelante para un musico independiente. Ahi es donde juegas TU:

Con tu apoyo podrémos terminar de cubrir los costos del estudio de grabacion, músicos, ingenieros, mezcla, masterizacion y por ultimo la impresion y distribución tanto fisica como digital del Album Hijo Mío. El album contará con 12 temas,  10 en español 1 en ingles y 1 en portugués. 


Más detalles de los costos en el siguiente gráfico:

Estudio de Grabación $2,000
Produccion y Grabación $5,000
Mezcla y Masterización $800
Impresiones (Discos) $1,500
Diseño y Arte $700
Total $10,000

LOS BENEFICIOS DE AYUDAR

Este proyecto cuenta con BENEFICIOS para toda persona que nos apoye con $5 o más. Chequea nuestra lista de "PERKS" y elige la que desees! Yo recomiendo los Albums Digitales con Videos, Cover Exclusivo Para Tí , Lecciones por Skype y por supuesto, el Concierto en Vivo /Online.

El Impacto De Tu Ayuda

Hijo Mío es un proyecto que pretende llevar nuestra música católica Schoenstattiana Ecuatoriana a un nivel Internacional. Querémos que así como nosotros aprendemos las hermosas canciones de Misión País de Chile, así mismo los Santuarios de Todo el Mundo puedan escuchar nuestras canciones.

Los fondos de las ventas de éste disco servirán para continuar generando música, impulsar a nuestros jóvenes de Schoenstatt Ecuador para generar un movimiento musical que transforme corazones y comenzar un proyecto Nacional que viaje por el mundo con NUESTRA música y testimonio como Familia.


Riesgos y Desafíos

Hijo Mío es un proyecto que tiene el único riesgo de que no alcancemos nuestra meta de $10,000 porque, a primera vista, parece muchísimo dinero y puede haber escepticismo. Al mismo tiempo, el sistema de pago por tarjeta de crédito puede no ser familiar para muchos. Si éste es el caso, te pido que te comuniques por email a franciscoruizmusic@gmail.com , y podemos encontrar otras opciones ;)

Otras Maneras de Ayudar

Si no podemos contar con tu aporte económico lo entenderemos, solo te pedimos que reces por nosotros y que lo compartas con tus familiares y amigos! Ayúdanos también compartiendo en Twitter, FB, Instagram. Síguenos @franciscojruizm


Más sobre Francisco Ruiz en www.franciscovocals.com

story:
Bien chers jeunes et moins jeunes, 

Voici venu le temps du second album...

Et voici venu le temps de m'adresser à vous (faut pas compter sur mes deux petits protégés pour ça, ils sont trop couards).

Pourquoi me direz-vous, oui, pourquoi Monsieur toto lui-même sort-il de son bien aimé salon pour s'adresser aux petites gens ?

Et bien, même si je répugne à l'admettre, Monsieur toto (à savoir moi donc) a besoin de VOUS !

"De NOUS ?" vous entends-je déjà vous exclamer !

Et bien oui !

En effet, mes deux larbins et MOI avons travaillé d'arrache-pieds ces derniers mois afin de vous concocter un 33Tours varié, aux tempos divers, aux ambiances sombrement claires voir clairement obscures. Un nouvel album comportant non moins que 14 titres écrits à deux ou 4 mains, tantôt acoustiques, tantôt électriques ou électroniques, bref, un disque qui, sans renier son prédécesseur, explore de nouveaux horizons, agrandit son spectre sonore.

Après avoir oeuvré dans l'ombre, il est maintenant temps pour nous de passer en studio mixer tout ça, de faire masteriser le résultat afin que le disque passe bien partout...que ce soit à la TSF ou sur vos cassettophones, voir, pour les drogués de la modernité, sur vos disques compacts...Disques compacts qui d'ailleurs seront ensuite produits en 300 exemplaires, le tout dans un bel écrin digipack (ne me demandez pas ce que c'est...en gros ce sera comme celui d'avant mais en mieux encore d'après ce qu'on m'a dit). 

C'est pourquoi nous vous proposons de contribuer à cette oeuvre magistrale ( à ne pas confondre avec le jambon du même nom) en commandant un de nos packs que nous avons spécialement conçus pour vous !

Ceux-ci, en plus d'être de merveilleux cadeaux, serviront à payer le mixage, le mastering, le pressage des cds, la promotion de l'album ainsi que les clips vidéo qui l'accompagneront. 

Un grand merci déjà à ceux qui nous aideront dans cette aventure !

Signé: Monsieur toto

PS: Si vous ne nous connaissez que peu, n'hésitez pas à faire un tour par notre "gallerie" (photos/videos) sur cette page !

Les champs réservés aux pack sur la droite de l'écran étant limités à 500 caractères, voici une présentation plus claire de ce qu'ils contiennent !

PACK MAURICE CHEVALIER-1 euro

---------------------------------

Votre nom dans les remerciements de l'album

PACK YVETTE HORNER-5 euros
---------------------------------
Votre nom dans les remerciements de l'album 
Le titre "Faux Rêveur" en version digitale exclusive (2 mois avant la sortie du cd)
Un autocollant 9,5/9,5cm de Monsieur toto

PACK PASCAL SEVRAN-10 euros
--------------------------------- 
Votre nom dans les remerciements de l'album 
Le titre "Faux Rêveur" en version digitale exclusive (2 mois avant la sortie du cd)
Un autocollant 9,5/9,5cm de Monsieur toto
LE NOUVEL ALBUM "Le Coeur En Joie" dédicacé (CD digipack) 
1 badge de Monsieur toto

PACK HERBERT LEONARD-15 euros 
---------------------------------
Votre nom dans les remerciements de l'album 
Le titre "Faux Rêveur" en version digitale exclusive (2 mois avant la sortie du cd)
Un autocollant 9,5/9,5cm de Monsieur toto
LE NOUVEL ALBUM "Le Coeur En Joie" dédicacé (CD digipack) 
1 badge de Monsieur toto
L'album "monsieur toto remet le couvert" en version digitale

PACK DIDIER BARBELIVIEN-20 euros
--------------------------------- 
Votre nom dans les remerciements de l'album

story_txt:
Bien chers jeunes et moins jeunes, Voici venu le temps du second album...Et voici venu le temps de m'adresser à vous (faut pas compter sur mes deux petits protégés pour ça, ils sont trop couards).Pourquoi me direz-vous, oui, pourquoi Monsieur toto lui-même sort-il de son bien aimé salon pour s'adresser aux petites gens ?Et bien, même si je répugne à l'admettre, Monsieur toto (à savoir moi donc) a besoin de VOUS !"De NOUS ?" vous entends-je déjà vous exclamer !Et bien oui !En effet, mes deux larbins et MOI avons travaillé d'arrache-pieds ces derniers mois afin de vous concocter un 33Tours varié, aux tempos divers, aux ambiances sombrement claires voir clairement obscures. Un nouvel album comportant non moins que 14 titres écrits à deux ou 4 mains, tantôt acoustiques, tantôt électriques ou électroniques, bref, un disque qui, sans renier son prédécesseur, explore de nouveaux horizons, agrandit son spectre sonore.Après avoir oeuvré dans l'ombre, il est maintenant temps pour nous de passer en studio mixer tout ça, de faire masteriser le résultat afin que le disque passe bien partout...que ce soit à la TSF ou sur vos cassettophones, voir, pour les drogués de la modernité, sur vos disques compacts...Disques compacts qui d'ailleurs seront ensuite produits en 300 exemplaires, le tout dans un bel écrin digipack (ne me demandez pas ce que c'est...en gros ce sera comme celui d'avant mais en mieux encore d'après ce qu'on m'a dit). C'est pourquoi nous vous proposons de contribuer à cette oeuvre magistrale ( à ne pas confondre avec le jambon du même nom) en commandant un de nos packs que nous avons spécialement conçus pour vous !Ceux-ci, en plus d'être de merveilleux cadeaux, serviront à payer le mixage, le mastering, le pressage des cds, la promotion de l'album ainsi que les clips vidéo qui l'accompagneront. Un grand merci déjà à ceux qui nous aideront dans cette aventure !Signé: Monsieur totoPS: Si vous ne nous connaissez que peu, n'hésitez pas à faire un tour par notre "gallerie" (photos/videos) sur cette page !Les champs réservés aux pack sur la droite de l'écran étant limités à 500 caractères, voici une présentation plus claire de ce qu'ils contiennent !PACK MAURICE CHEVALIER-1 euro---------------------------------Votre nom dans les remerciements de l'album

story:
Lyon Pride music officially got its start in 1999 working with local musicians, artists and performers, while continuing to nurture new talent and giving time to volunteer organizations the company grew to include west coast concerts booking and tour transportation. The next step in the vision is creating a place for teachers, entrepreneurs, & musicians to come together to share, learn and grow. Today, many young adults want to learn and participate in non-traditional careers but lack the resources and structure to succeed. With your help we can provide an environment that develops their talents and abilities and creates a home to network with other like-minded individuals. Whether you Skate, Play Music, Blow Glass, or are interested in video, photography, recording, sound mixing, or Maybe event production interests you? These alternative careers need incubation and the Den Alternative Center is what we are building.  So far we've taken the initiative and purchased a 14,000+ sq. ft. warehouse in the shadow of the Tacoma Dome. The Den will house 10 band rehearsal rooms, Art rooms, Art Walls, Live Glass blowing studio, Graphic Design, media center, live concert hall, 4,000 sq. ft. of Indoor Street Style Skate Park and Photography & Video green screen space

What does the community think?


Think a cross between Rob Dyrdek's Fantasy Factory & Seattle's own Vera Project! We the people need a place to skate and play music year round. We the artists need a place where can get messy and show off our creative abilities. Our community needs an alternative solution that interests us!


Community Impact


Let's get the kids off the couch and out of the street! Our project will be beneficial to people of all ages by providing a facility that not only engages artistic activities but provide a healthy physical and interactive environment. A venue where community leaders teach great values that can carry on a lifetime. A place that provides positive attitude and self-worth.


How does this benefit you?


Well it feels good to help out a great cause plus your company as a sponsor will receive write ups in our newsletters, showcased on our webpage, included on our banner and founders’ plaque. With a larger contribution you can even receive radio, news and media campaigns. In fact, we'll make sure your financial involvement will go further and get more recondition than most other advertising ventures

Target Market

Ø  All ages to Adults

Ø  Musicians

Ø  Artists

Ø  Skate Boarders

Ø  Glass Blowers

Ø  Teachers

Ø  Photographers

Ø  Videographers

Ø  Event Producers

Ø  Sound and Lighting engineers

Product

Ø  Live concert venue

Ø  Indoor skate park

Ø  Artist studios

Ø  Band rehearsal space

Ø  Photo and video green screen

Ø  Special event space

Ø  Glass studio

Ø  Screen print

Ø  Computer/media lounge

Ø  Rotating graffiti wall

Ø  Recording studio

Team

Ø  Levi Lyon-Owner/Director of Music and Artist Development

Ø  Zachary Rodriguez-Operations Manager and Educator Recruitment

Ø  Chris Malone-Video Director

Ø  Bill Duncan-Web and App Development

Ø  Director of Arts

Ø  Skate Park Operations

Ø  Recording Studio Operations

Ø  General Maintenance

Ø  Secretary

Ø  Sales/Marketing

Ø  Sound/Lighting

Ø  Newsletter Editor in Chief

Promotion Plan

Ø  Featured on 5 local FM radio stations

a.  Kiss 106.1

b.  Kisw 99.9

c.  Kube 93.3

d.  Now 102.9

e.  Brew104.9

Ø  Local college radio

a.  Kgrg 89.9

b.  Kups 90.1

c.  Kaos 89.3

Ø  Local Newspapers

a.  The Tacoma Weekly

b.  The Seattle Medium

center, live concert hall, 4,000 sq. ft. of Indoor Street Style Skate Park
and Photography & Video green screen space

What does the community think?


Think a cross between Rob Dyrdek's Fantasy
Factory & Seattle's own Vera Project! We the people need a place to skate
and play music year round. We the artists need a place where can get messy and
show off our creative abilities. Our community needs an alternative solution
that interests us!


Community
Impact


Let's get the kids off the couch and out of the
street! Our project will be beneficial to people of all ages by providing a
facility that not only engages artistic activities but provide a healthy
physical and interactive environment. A venue where community leaders teach
great values that can carry on a lifetime. A place that provides positive
attitude and self-worth.




How does this benefit you?


Well it feels good to help out a great cause
plus your company as a sponsor will receive write ups in our newsletters,
showcased on our webpage, included on our banner and founders’ plaque. With a
larger contribution you can even receive radio, news and media campaigns. In
fact, we'll make sure your financial involvement will go further and get more
recondition than most other advertising ventures

Target Market

Ø  All ages to Adults
Ø  Musicians
Ø  Artists
Ø  Skate Boarders
Ø  Glass Blowers
Ø  Teachers
Ø  Photographers
Ø  Videographers
Ø  Event Producers
Ø  Sound and Lighting
engineers

Product

Ø  Live concert venue
Ø  Indoor skate park
Ø  Artist studios
Ø  Band rehearsal space
Ø  Photo and video green
screen
Ø  Special event space
Ø  Glass studio
Ø  Screen print
Ø  Computer/media lounge
Ø  Rotating graffiti wall
Ø  Recording studio


Team

Ø  Levi
Lyon-Owner/Director of Music and Artist Development
Ø  Zachary Rodriguez-Operations
Manager and Educator Recruitment
Ø  Chris Malone-Video
Director
Ø  Bill Duncan-Web and
App Development
Ø  Director of Arts
Ø  Skate Park Operations
Ø  Recording Studio
Operations
Ø  General Maintenance
Ø  Secretary
Ø  Sales/Marketing
Ø  Sound/Lighting
Ø  Newsletter Editor in
Chief

Promotion
Plan

Ø  Featured on 5 local FM
radio stations
a.  Kiss 106.1
b.  Kisw 99.9
c.  Kube 93.3
d.  Now 102.9
e.  Brew104.9
Ø  Local college radio
a.  Kgrg 89.9
b.  Kups 90.1
c.  Kaos 89.3
Ø  Local Newspapers
a.  The Tacoma Weekly
b.  The Seattle Medium

story:
What Are We Doing?

Thani and UFO Funk Band are collaborating for the first time to bring the world an experimental hip-hop fusion project. 

Some brief history: UFO has been playing around the Denton, TX area with numerous shows in the last year. Primarily playing the music of the 70's, the leader Toshi Clinch, decided to branch out and challenge the band with new material. This developed into a conversation with Thani (a friend and fellow musician) in early June 2015, and has now evolved into a major studio production.

We are excited to present this unique collaboration, and are looking to make the album at the highest possible quality. Because of the required demands to make such a high quality album, we are in need of additional funds.

What We Need & What You Get

In total, we are looking at $7000 USD to fund everything for the album. This money will be going towards 28 hours in the studio, HD video recording of the entire 28 hours (which will be edited into an hour long DVD), album artwork, video editing, mixing and mastering, marketing, and much more. Regardless of the amount we will make, all of the money will be used towards these goals.

So now we can get onto what you will get out of donating! We want every person that donates, from the smallest to largest contributions to be recognized. Because of this your name will be included in the liner notes of the album. After that, depending on the price range we have a variety of unique perks available. 

For packages over $100 we have not created additional perks just yet. But if you plan on donating more than $100, then Toshi and Thani will contact you personally and work out additional benefits for you!

The Impact

As any album does, this project has a considerable amount of details which goes into it. We have an incredible team of people working on this project with us, and a serious amount of work ahead of us to complete before the final copy of the CD/DVD lands. Having any donation will seriously help us out in making this album bigger and better and we promise to provide a professional and stylish final product that you will enjoy! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know a huge portion of our audience is college students that are poor like us, so if you can't donate - we understand. But (!) there are many ways you can help us other than money, namely: SPREAD THE WORD! Word of mouth is an everlasting tool for success and we can't do it by ourselves - so please, share the campaign via social media, real-life conversations, and interactions with your people circles. 

This work of art is something that all of us are investing our lives into for the next few months. We're very confident in the project and we can't wait to share this music with you guys. Thanks so much for your time and donations; we love you guys!

story:
Summary

We're a local, acoustic duo from Southeast Texas called Curse and the Cure. 

Our mission is to create a strong family based relationship with our fans.. and to have a successful campaign to promote, inform and strengthen the Curse and the Cure brand!

  • Curse and the Cure consists of Jason Touchette and Norma Hopson.
  • Curse and the Cure have performed a total of 267 shows since February of 2014. Many of which are solo shows, showcases and festival dates.
  • Curse and the Cure was a featured artist for 2015's Springboard South Music Festival.
  • Curse and the Cure has been published in Bridge the Beats Magazine, Cat5 Magazine, as well as many local newspapers and online articles.

What We Need & What You'll Get

We appreciate every single pledge and we will be using it for recording, tour support, promotions and merchandising.

             We have included some very fun and creative perks for our faithful fans and donators, including:
  • Curse and the Cure shirts, cd's, koozies, stickers, autographed lyric prints/sheets, dinner with the band, acoustic guitar giveaways, a night of bowling, show posters, and even a private party with the band!
  • If our goal is not reached, all pledges will be used for as much of the above as possible!

The Impact

The difference that your pledge makes for Curse and the Cure is immense! We are a young band working hard to spread our music to the masses. We are currently using both of our personal vehicles to make all of our show dates in town and out of town and it is limiting the amount of miles we can travel. Purchasing a touring vehicle would be a huge success for us and will allow us to travel out of state and even further to make more fans! Your pledges will make a huge difference in promoting, marketing, recording and keeping Curse and the Cure with plenty of merchandise to provide for our fans.

TRUST FACTOR: We will be videoing and posting progress photos of all pledges spent in the trust of our fans.. so you will have a front row seat to everything we do! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that while not everyone that sees our campaign may not be able to monetarily contribute, but there are still ways that you can help tremendously by:

  • Sharing the link to our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Myspace!
  • Sharing and 'Liking' our Facebook Page.
  • Following us on Twitter & Instagram.
  • Like our Campaign video and Subscribe to our Channel on YouTube.
  • Turn your friends on to our music.
  • Come and see us at a live show. 
  • Sign up for our mailing list!!

story:
Bible Belt

Hello, friends. In case you’re wondering what this is, I’m cookin’ up my very first full-length album, being released under Horton Records. It is called Bible Belt, based on experiences and people living in my good ol’ home state of Oklahoma. I’m very excited to be working with such a solid lineup of musicians and friends, including Cody Clinton, Roger Ray, Dylan Aycock, Rachel La Vonne, Scott Bell, Dylan Layton, and even more. It’s hard to convey how much your support will help, but let me try…I CAN’T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU. 

What you should know

About me, quickly: My name is Kalyn Fay Barnoski, but I go by Kalyn Fay to weed out all the mishaps that happen when you’re Native American and have a polish last name. I am Cherokee, born and bred in Oklahoma. I am currently in my master’s program at The University of Tulsa for Graphic Design, with a little printmaking, as well. Music keeps me moving. I write sad songs, but I like giving hugs.

The album: I have been playing and writing for a few years now, both with others and without, and I feel like it is finally time to have something to hand people when I am on the road or at a show and they ask, “Hey, you got a CD?” So, I have been recording this album for over a year now, working with Dylan Layton on the tracking and, just recently, Scott Bell on mixing. It has been amazing to see the process progress and I think the result is going to be something magical, thanks to some really talented friends. It's a lot more ambient than when I play solo, but still retains a folky, singer-songwriter undertone about it. I am happy to say it involves a full band, too! The super rockin' awesome musicians involved are: Cody Clinton, Dylan Aycock, Dylan Layton, Roger Ray, Kevin Warren-Smith, Rachel La Vonne, Jordan McLeod, Erin O’Dowd, Kurt Nielsen, and maybe even a few others!

Where the money goes: What your money is going to is exactly what I am advertising, the album and all it entails. It helps me pay my musicians, pay for tracking, mixing, mastering, cd production, and merchandise for all ya’ll kids to wear around or give away. No amount will go unused.

Why I need your help

Here’s the dang truth that most of us creating deal with when we have this sort of project: we only have enough to get by. Between working and going to graduate school, I don’t have an excess of time or money. I’m happy with this truth, but I would really love to have this album as something I can share with people and that means I need a little more than just getting by. 

I am not a well known artist with lots of exposure, but I’m doing the best I can with what I have. Thanks to you all and your kindness in caring for my music, I have been able to not only play all over Oklahoma, but on tours throughout the Midwest, as well. These opportunities have matured me and seasoned me more as an artist and this album is the next step! Many of you have walked beside me, seen me grow and change, and this album is definitely a representation of that. I hope that you can join me in this process because it would mean a whole heck of a lot to me to have friends, families, and listeners show their support.

I have some options listed, if you’re the perks kind of person. They involve anywhere from digital downloads to a silkscreen printing party. If you’re not a perks person, there is also a “contribute now” option. Honestly, whatever you contribute helps. In this sort of thing, a little goes a long way and I am thankful for anything.

Other ways to help

Share this link! Tell your friends! Please help me spread the word. Helping album funding is something that is really important to me and my friends these days. Please send this along to anyone you feel would be happy to help this kiddo out, even if you don’t have the funds either. 

Heck, I’m thankful for you to even have you get this far into my story. So, I’m sending love to you. I appreciate each and every one of you.

story:
The debut album from The Quincey - presented by Bad Panda - is now available to pre-order through PledgeMusic.

The album is presented on vinyl and digital formats. The vinyl will be shipped at the beginning of December.  Limited edition Signed copies are also available.

All physical album formats will come with a free MP3 download upon release.

From now until the album release date (27th of Nov, 2015), the band will keep you updated with the album’s progress and news from their world through the ‘Access Pass’ section here once you have placed your order.

story:
Short Summary

We're The Superbytes! We play pop punk/rock accompanied by Gameboys and NES systems used as synth.

We have released an album and a few EPs that are available at our Bandcamp page, and we have written and begun recording 13 new songs that we want to share with you!

Currently, however, we lack the funds to do this ourselves. We have families and myriad of expenses that plague musicians and human beings in general, and are relying on our listeners to help us finish this album. We can't do it without you!

What We Need & What You Get

We have completely written the new album, and used our own money to begin recording it. We do not, however, have the funds to complete it. If we reach the $2000 goal, we can afford to finish mixing the album, have it mastered, and then pressed, along with matching merch. The crowdfund will act essentially as a preorder: you can get the album along with shirts and other goodies once it is finished, and, at the same time, fund the album itself. When and if we near the $2000 mark, we will add stretch goals and perks for vinyl and cassette pressings of the new album, along with special editions of the new album. Also anyone who purchases a physical version (the $10 perk or higher) will have their name featured in the liner notes of the record! You helped make this so you deserve credit! Also we will release visual representations of our perks once designs have been finalized

The Impact

We love what we do, and we want to keep doing it! We have never crowdfunded anything, instead funding our music heavily out of pocket. Donating to the new album relieves an insurmountable amount of stress for us, and puts new music in your hands!

Risks & Challenges

This will be our second full length album, and probably not our last. We WILL finish this album and get it to you, but we do have obstacles and difficulties. We all have full time jobs, as well as families and kids. Donating to our crowdfund means we won't have to push back the album until we can raise the money ourselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by donating, another way you can support us is by simply sharing this page with your friends. Posting our page to your Facebook or Twitter is a huge help! Indiegogo also has tools built into the page to make it really simple to share on your social media. We're depending on you!

Stretch goals!!!!


At the $3500 mark, we will offer the album on vinyl and include new perk bundles with vinyl!
At the $4000 mark, we will offer vinyl in multiple colors!
More stretch goals to be announced!

story:
ILIA is heading back into the studio!

ILIA is a rock/hard rock/alternative band based out of Little Rock, AR.  ILIA was formed in 2007 and has released 3 EPs.  They will be heading into the studio on January 4, 2016 with Travis Wyrick at Lakeside Studios in Knoxville, TN.  The new EP will be picking up where their latest EP "Reborn" left off.  It will continue with the creative vocal melodies along with harsh vocals sprinkled throughout to bring intensity.  The guitars and drums will fill up the space with a powerful raw/hard rock feel.  It promises to bring songs that are filled with passion and energy.  It won't disappoint!

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $12,000 which will cover travel to the studio, recording, mixing, mastering, and cd duplication.  We've got all kinds of perks for you guys to choose from:  Limited edition t-shirt (that will only be available to backers), signed limited edition 8 x 10 of a photo from the studio, limited edition camping inspired mug, and insight to exclusive updates, videos, and announcements along the way.   

The Impact

Please know that whether you donate $1 or $1,000 we appreciate your contribution. ILIA is more than just a band. We are a ministry. We strive to be a positive influence in people's lives and to give back with our talents. All your money is going to help this ministry stay active and continue to pour out the love of Christ through music. From the bottom of our hearts we thank you, our supporters, for helping us to be the hands and feet of Jesus.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially, no problem!  Help us get the word by sharing our project on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, or however you would like to share!  

We appreciate you guys!  You're the reason we are passionate about getting new music out there!  Hope you will become a part of this process with us!

Thank you!

ILIA

story:
We're almost there...

Hey yall, GR here and as most of you know, we have been recording my album "Outlaw In Love" since March 2015.  For those of you that don't, and are learning about it for the first time, "Outlaw In Love" is my 3rd full length album as a solo artist.  It is also my first sole production, and the most important group of songs I've written in my life.  It is the most honest, raw and emotional material I've ever put out to the public.  For many years I hid behind an image, a persona, and now I've removed the facade and am showing people the true artist, the real girl, that fuels the music.

I am an independent artist, which means I have no major funding or backing.  I am not signed to any label or management.  I am very blessed to have endorsements that help me with amazing gear, and friends and fans who continue to support my career, but when it comes to putting out an album, it is very expensive and would be impossible without your help. 

We ran an Indiegogo campaign in January 2015 to raise the starter funds for the album.  That campaign made a 3rd of its goal, which was enough to get the ball rolling and the music flowing.   Pictured below are some of our sessions and the incredibly talented musicians I have the honor of working with: on drums is Chris Hoffman, on lead guitar is Ian Charlie, and on bass in Erik Ralston.

In September, we released the first single titled "Hollywood Rain".  I am so blessed to have my amazing friend and filmmaker Amy Campione in my corner, so we were able to release an awesome music video to accompany the single.  There was no budget for this video and would have not happened without a group of filmmakers and friends that believed in it and worked hard and creatively to get it done.  I am grateful to them for their help and talent!  You can check it out here:

We've also been very fortunate to have help from some amazing companies and people in the industry including, first and foremost, our talented mixing engineer and my partner on this project Francisco Rodriguez, our friend Rafa Sardina, my endorsements Telefunken Elektroakustik and Gibson Brands, and our friends at Bedrock LA who have all done much to help in the recording process.

Unfortunately, like with any creative project, we have run into additional production costs and need more funds to finish recording and print CDs to release this album to all of you.  "Outlaw In Love" is something I am very proud of and I believe is some of my best material yet, so I hope you can help push us over the hump to get it out to the world!

What We Need & What You Get

We don't need a lot, our finishing costs include:

  • $1,000 - recording, production and mastering
  • $1,000 - artwork and CDs printed
  • $250 - distribution, bar code, etc.
  • $250 - Indiegogo and Paypal fees, S&H costs

    • In return, I'm offering several of the great perks that were offered in our original campaign, which include:

    • Singed copies of "Outlaw In Love"
    • GR swag packs which include t-shirts, exclusive "Outlaw In Love" posters, whiskey glasses and more.
    • Private whiskey tasting party with me and friends!
    • Exclusive invite to our private filming of the "Outlaw In Love" CD Release and Acoustic Live Performance at Gibson Brands Showroom, Beverly Hills
    • ...and more!


    Pictured is the exclusive "Outlaw In Love" poster, whiskey glass and koozie


The Impact

Art, in any form, is a priceless treasure yet we desperately try to sell it every day.  Music especially, is almost something you can't even sell anymore, as it is available for free in so many ways and through so many outlets.  The reality of it is that it still costs money to put it out there, whether you'll make money on the product or not.  I have no expectations for "Outlaw In Love" to make me any notable amount of money.  All I want is to be able to release it to the world, so you all can enjoy the music and hopefully be inspired in some way, as I am by artists I love.  You helping us make this last small bit of funds, will make that possible.  This video is a throwback to December 2014, when the album conception was finalized and we started spreading the word about the new music to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word!  Share, comment on the actual campaign, Tweet, Facebook, Google +, email your friends, tell people about the music and why its important for us to make our goal. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!  You can share the campaign directly from this page.  Also, please leave us comments on the campaign page as it raises our ranking in the Indiegogo community and shows people what we're about!

And that's all there is to it. It's all about spreading the love of music and the possibilities are endless!  Thank you so much for helping me in my journey to release this album that is very dear to my heart.  I want you all to enjoy it with me :)

story:
** TOTAL AMOUNT AT CAMPAIGN'S END TO BE DOUBLED! (READ THE NEW UPDATE)

** FINAL WEEK PERK ADDED: YOUR NAME IN THE ALBUM THANK YOU NOTES **

** NEW PERKS FOR UK ONLY SHIPPING ADDED**

Music has been a means of expressing myself since I was very young, and it has proven itself as a vehicle to convey both deep emotions and deep convictions for me. After four decades working as a professional musician, composer and (lately) a music therapist, I am now gearing up for a very special string of concerts in October that will lay the foundation for a 30th Anniversary Recording of 'Alpha & Omega', one of my most recognised and loved works!


The Project

'Alpha & Omega' is a project that was and is close to my heart. In the mid-Eighties, I set about on a journey of discovery along the roots of my christian faith, whilst trying to grasp the meaning of conflict in the world (specifically WWII and the Holocaust) in light of the promises and perspective my faith holds. The subsequent album was originally released in 1986 and was ambitious by incorporating choirs next to a full band. 

The journey that the work has been on, is nothing short of amazing to me. Most notably, myself and several colleagues had the profound privilege of performing pieces of this work, along with (the later project) 'Song of an Exile', in the Holocaust Memorial of Yad Vashem in Jerusalem. It holds a special place in my body of work to this day. 
Still, looking back, I wasn´t as pleased with some of the sonic aspects of it as I had hoped to be and I always held out hope that one day, I could re-record it for the current day and age.

As we set out to celebrate the 30th Anniversary of 'Alpha & Omega', I believe that time has finally come. We will be playing a string of concerts in the Netherlands and we'll record these performances in order to have the foundation of what will become a re-recording of 'Alpha & Omega'. It will be quite the undertaking: a 60-piece choir (led by Dutch director Maarten Wassink) and a full band with top musicians from the UK & the Netherlands (including past & present members of IONA: Dave Bainbridge, Frank van Essen and David Fitzgerald). And all of it presented with spectacular sound and lights! 

Not only do I cherish the opportunity to present you this work in a way that I feel will be more 'current' sounding, I also believe this work's core message rings all the more true today in our time of conflict and turmoil.


The Challenge

Getting a proper live recording is a challenge in and of itself. Getting this project made the way we have always hoped it could be, will require even more! This is why we need your help. With your contributions, we will be able to gather the necessary funds for what is, in essence, a 'two-step' approach:

1) Fund the live recordings. This will include musicians, producers, editing and mixing fees, manufacturing and design costs.

2) Expand on the live takes by adding soundscapes, effects and studio takes that will bring the full vision of 'Alpha & Omega' to life!

Of course, there´s also added costs like the percentage Indiegogo gets from collected funds, bank fees and postage.  

To be frank: our initial goal covers step 1. Any and all funds we manage to collect on top of that, will contribute to making step 2 a reality. This is why we hope you will join us and invite your friends along! 


Join us on the journey

We plan to do much more than simply collect funds through a campaign. For us, this project is a journey that we hope to share with you in more ways than one. This is why we have set up a number of perks that allow you to be involved in numerous ways, from getting a unique 'behind the scenes' look to never-before-heard live audio to being added as an executive co-producer on the finished album!

(Performance of 'Alpha & Omega' in The Netherlands, 1986)

Throughout this campaign, we will post regular updates for all pledgers and I´ll share thoughts and stories from the orginal work, as well as the many musicians and singers who make this possible. 'Alpha & Omega' has been (and still is!) performed by choirs around the world, meaning literally thousands of people have a personal experience with the project. I hope to help you relive that experience, enhance it or introduce you to what I believe is a culturally and spiritually relevant work: especially now.


Thank you!

Well, there you have it. From the bottom of my heart: thank you for either being a supporter of my work throughout the years or getting involved now. Thank you for contributing. Or, if you cannot but wish to be involved anyway, for spreading the word on social media with your family & friends. Reach out to those choir members you know appreciate the project, post links on Facebook and Twitter... whatever you do, helps us! This campaign page offers you several tools to share.

In the current music 'industry', the connection between a musician / composer and his audience is more important than ever. I actually dislike the term 'industry', as it often diminishes and obscures the pure intentions behind music. Your involvement does much more than enable me to do what I do: it reminds me of the intentions and personal impact that music has, time and again. There is no greater gift in creativity.


with deep appreciation,

Adrian Snell

story:
HAHA SOUNDS 

Behind HAHA Sounds are the Hackney-based music producer and bassist Syd Kemp and singer and keys player Victoria Hamblett.

Having both been in numerous bands, we want to keep closer to the release of our own music and that of bands we love. We’re aiming to use sharp local services to make a community based label happen in our own living room.

With the help and love of our friends and family, HAHA Sounds are looking for an initial investment to set us in motion. Your investment will fund:

• The manufacturing of our first batch of records

• Getting the word out online and in person

• Showing off our charming logo on some really good-looking merch

• Having our bands’ sweet music heard.

Basically, with your help, we can launch our company.

We need to hit a £2,500 goal in order to fund the first two vinyl releases and get the merch within our grasp!

• The break down: £1,000 will fund the Neil’s Children mini-album ‘Reduction’ - manufacturing and distribution. We are both in this band and it means a great deal to us. We love our band mates, John Linger and Brandon Jacobs, first and foremost as friends, but we also want to make the most of this superb mini album, ‘Reduction’.

Its a fantastic record and we'd be really proud to host it. 

Neils Children in action here:

          
          

 

• £600 will fund the new Syd Kemp single release called ‘FRANCE’, including manufacturing and distribution. Syd’s sound has become really refined. It’s melodically diverse, stylistically progressive and instrumentally sound. The new single really showcases all of the band’s finest attributes and we can’t wait to get it on vinyl.

Syd Kemp here..

         
         

 

 

• £800 will make our logo wearable on your bodily parts.

Badges, tote bags and T-shirts will be made using high-end services from Hackney, including local screen printers.

• Everything else will go towards the maintenance of our label for the first year (website, bandcamp and soundcloud subscriptions, etc).

 

With all of this in mind, we know that some of you may not be able to contribute financially,  but you can still like and share our Facebook page and our crowdfunding page! Please do so here   -> https://www.facebook.com/HAHA-Sounds-1055636767863188/

THANK YOU!

We really appreciate any contribution and know we'll work hard to ensure that we make the most of all of your help.

If all goes well, we will be representing more artists we love on our label and by February 2017, we hope to see the likes of some great US bands, French artists, Syd's first full album release... and an EP from Victoria.

story:
God already did an amazing thing by providing the €6400 I needed for recording my EP (click here to hear the story). It was bizarre and amazing.  Finally a dream that I have had since I can remember has come true: to record my music! I’ve had the privilege of working with René de Vries from Dufry Music Recording Studio in Amsterdam and he’s really made a masterpiece of these heart-songs of mine! Because the quality is great, I want it to be mastered well, which is expensive.

The second expense is printing. Someone sparked the idea and it caught flame: why print a CD, why not try something different? So I’m considering releasing the album on a USB stick in addition to (or instead of) an actual CD. I’ve been in contact with a company that makes custom USBs and I’m really excited about this option.

The mastering & printing (& distributing) together is going to cost an estimated $3500 (€3000). The plan is to send the album for mastering in October and to print (CD and/or USB stick) in November.

Please help me get my music from the studio to the masses by supporting the mastering and printing of this EP: it's going to be amazing and you can be part of the story!  

You can also help by sharing this page to get the word out to more people who want to help me reach this goal.

  • The Next Web
  • Product Hunt
  • Hacker News

This being my pet project I decided to keep it free and open source. I need your help with the cost of running it on a server given the traffic which I can't afford after a while.

story:
About the "CEO" Video Project

Do you love music? And, are you like me, and want more music videos that really tell a story? I'm Aradia, a fully independent alternative electropop artist who sings about my observations of the world & aims to inspire and empower listeners. One of the most powerful ways to change perceptions & spread ideas is through visual media, and that's why making this music video is so important to me.

As a true DIY musician, I do everything myself, from writing & recording to costumes & videos. Getting heard & building an audience takes - first & foremost - great material, and just as important: exposure. You can help me achieve this goal by contributing to this campaign.

Most of my music focuses on what makes us the same, but I have a current single, titled “CEO,” that focuses on the position of women in the entertainment industry, and the challenges of finding true success as an independent musician. The goal of this campaign is to make a fun, cheeky video for “CEO” that illustrates how an artist can stand in her own power in a positive way, and be successful by believing in herself & working hard. I'm excited to share the power of “CEO” with you! With its New Wave-infused electronic pop style, this song is sure to get you dancing!

 

HEAR A CLIP OF THE SONG!

Want to know what you're investing in? Get a glimpse of the unreleased single "CEO" here on Soundcloud! https://soundcloud.com/aradias-music/aradia-ceo-clip/s-DEqJi

 

What We Need & What You Get

To make the "CEO" music video, we need at least $7,500 in funding. I'm starting there with the goal of keeping costs down, while making a video with tons of production value. Costs include: Location shooting rentals (stage set and street shots; roughly $55/hr for a 3 day shoot), props, stage light rentals, casting actors, production insurance, food for actors & extras, makeup/hair artist, grip/camera crew, and more. If I don't reach my entire goal, I'll still make the video! I'll cut costs by limiting the days of shooting, as well as locations.

Risks & Challenges

Making a professional video has its potential risks. I like to plan carefully and keep things simple to avoid any pitfalls, but hey, you never know :-)  Some risks include:

  • Shoots getting canceled
  • Actors not showing up
  • Equipment failures
  • Film crew tantrums & other random shenanigans

But I'm creative! I always come up with ways to fill in the gaps. Sometimes things turn out better that way. It's like Bob Ross said, "There are no mistakes, only happy accidents!"

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute - or just not ready to - you can still be part of this journey!

  • Follow me on Social Media (I'm very active on Instagram & Twitter)
  • Please share this campaign with your friends and ask them to spread the word

To make the "CEO" music video, we need at least $7,500 in funding. I'm starting there with the goal of keeping costs down, while making a video with tons of production value. Costs include: Location shooting rentals (stage set and street shots; roughly $55/hr for a 3 day shoot), props, stage light rentals, casting actors, production insurance, food for actors & extras, makeup/hair artist, grip/camera crew, and more. If I don't reach my entire goal, I'll still make the video! I'll cut costs by limiting the days of shooting, as well as locations.

Risks & Challenges
Making a professional video has its potential risks. I like to plan carefully and keep things simple to avoid any pitfalls, but hey, you never know :-)  Some risks include:

Shoots getting canceled
Actors not showing up
Equipment failures
Film crew tantrums & other random shenanigans

But I'm creative! I always come up with ways to fill in the gaps. Sometimes things turn out better that way. It's like Bob Ross said, "There are no mistakes, only happy accidents!"

Other Ways You Can Help
If you're unable to contribute - or just not ready to - you can still be part of this journey!

Follow me on Social Media (I'm very active on Instagram & Twitter)
Please share this campaign with your friends and ask them to spread the word

story:
The Story

This is singer Jim Gillette. When Nitro first got together, guitar virtuoso Michael Angelo Batio and I set out to build the band we'd always envisioned. A band of amazing musicians that combined everything we loved about aggressive Heavy Metal. That band became known as NITRO. We stormed onto the Los Angeles music scene like a "Freight Train" with our over-the-top, in-your-face brand of Metal. People didn’t know what hit them!

Off The Rails

NITRO got signed after performing only 1 show (at Gazzarri's on the Sunset Strip) and soon afterwards, started to record our first album "OFR." We were excited that being in the Hollywood Glam Metal scene, where bands basically sounded the same, we were different and getting attention for our musicianship and more aggressive sound. Unfortunately, that’s when the "Freight Train" went down the wrong track. The "suits" started to change our vision and eventually pushed NITRO in a direction that they thought would be more profitable. The rest is history.

On the Siding

After NITRO disbanded, Michael began a successful solo career and travels the world doing solo Guitar shows, continuing his legacy as the "No. 1 Shredder of all time." I became a Fighter. Teaching and competing in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu. I also became a Father, raising two amazing young men. Michael and I remained very close friends and continued to write music together every now and then. We never really felt that we achieved that goal of the ultimate Metal band. We felt that the time was right to resurrect our dream and put together the band that we had always envisioned.

Reinventing, Revolutionizing and Rebuilding The Machine

In August of 2016, Michael and I began planning the rebirth of NITRO. We knew that we had to create something really special and could not repeat the mistakes that lead this "Freight Train" down the wrong track. It's time to make NITRO the aggressive, brutal, and technical Metal band that we always envisioned - on our terms. That meant putting together a team that shared the same vision. We knew that getting the ultimate Metal Drummer was a top priority. Only one Drummer's name came to mind - Chris Adler. As a founding member of Lamb Of God, Chris managed to rack up several Grammy nominations. Chris has also played and recorded with many other heavy hitters like Testament and Megadeth, is a constant staple on the cover of all the major drum magazines, and has been voted “Drummer of the Year” multiple times.

Refueling and stoking the boilers

To restart the engine, we need fuel in the form of money to get this project restarted and running at full speed as soon as possible. This is where you come in.  Our fundraiser is to create the first and only Nitro album that is 100% our vision, on our terms, and with the music the way we've always wanted.  But this album is not just for us. It's also for you! Nothing would make us happier than to give you that record! It's going to be an extremely expensive task to record an album like this. Not having a record company looking over our shoulders, telling us what to do,  will be a blessing and at the same time, our biggest challenge.  I've always taken challenges head on and put every ounce of strength and passion into reach my goal. Michael and Chris are the same.

Full speed ahead

By participating in our fundraiser, not only do you qualify for Perks, but you get to act as an Executive Producer for an independent record company! You are helping us to fund everything that goes into producing the best possible music that we can create. The team is secure and with your help, NITRO is ready to do everything it takes to push Metal to the extreme. Musically there are no limits - there are "No Boundaries."

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? (WHAT YOU GET FOR HELPING US)

Lot’s of original collector’s items!

Funding our goal will give us the ability to realize our musical vision. If we exceed our goal, we will invest the extra money exclusively into this new album! Additional music videos, radio promotion, more merchandise - everything possible. We have detailed every aspect of the budget so you get an exact idea of what we are doing and what the cost's are.  Again, this campaign allows us to make the best album we can, write songs to the best of our abilities, work with the top people in the music industry and give you our finest performances.

All merchandise is currently being designed exclusively for this campaign. We have some retro items up now and will update as new items are available. Once they’re gone they will never be re released, reprinted, or duplicated the way they're available here. These are collectors items!

The Impact

By taking part in this campaign, you are taking charge and helping us make an historic new album. You are putting faith in us to come through and deliver the greats (and no that wasn't a typo.) We won't deliver the "goods" because you deserve much better than good. You deserve great and that's exactly what we will deliver. A great new Nitro release!

With this in mind, we give you our word that we will not settle, we won't take any shortcuts, and above all – all the money we raise in this campaign will be used to make the best album we can.

Thank you for helping us make it possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't sure you can commit – there are other ways you can help spread the word. Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. Please help us let other people know this is happening. By posting links to this page you are helping us reach places we would never be able to get to without your help.

Special thanks:

Luke Hoskin and Tim MacMillar of Protest the Hero (great band!), Mr Kane Churko, The Hideout Recording Studio, Marc Ricciardelli, Marc Milliard and all at Collider Films, Brian K Willard, Rich Fernandes, Priya Panda, Aurielle St Cyr, HH, RainMan, Doug Marks, Metal Method, DV Mark, Evan Rubinson and all the great people at Dean Guitars, and everyone else that helped with the video, album,  and campaign.

Extra Special thanks:

You! Thank you for visiting our campaign. Our friends and fans are the best a band can get! You are who we strive to please and we will continue fighting the good fight because of your encouragement and support.

Exclusive Fundraiser Packages


Budget

Here's the projected budget. We're posting it so you know how the funds will be used. 

ALBUM BUDGET: Includes studio time, engineer, producer, mixing, mastering, travel, accommodations, artwork, etc. 

Grand Total                                                                                      $95,400.00

 

Fundraising Total                                                                           $135,000.00

Indie GoGo Fees (5%)                                                                 -$6,750.00

Credit Card fees (3%)                                                                 -$4,050.00

Adjust Gross                                                                                     $124,200.00

Cost of Goods for Perks (22%)                                                -$29,700.00

Money for recording expenses                                                   $94,500.00

story:
Your ongoing support of my music as both Super XX Man and Silver Scooter has enabled me to do so much over the years and I love you for it. Here we go again! Please consider making a pledge today! You can help me produce my brand new Scott Garred "little tiny things" LP just by making a small financial contribution.  

As you can appreciate, making music is a passion for me and one that requires resources I just don't have without asking for help. 

This project is also special because it reunites a very dear group of friends. I joined Shawn Camp and Tom Hudson (both of Silver Scooter fame) in Austin, TX at the beautiful Idler Recording operated by Tyler Mallory (also ex-Silver Scooter) who recorded and mixed most of the songs. Dave McNair (Bob Dylan, David Bowie, Los Lobos, Willie Nelson, and of course Silver Scooter) was enlisted to mix the hit songs and master all the material available for perks. The songs sound amazing and I couldn't be happier.

What is needed:

Total goal: $7500 - This will pay for the completion of the album and help pay for the manufacturing of the LPs. 

    When the campaign has reached 60% all backers will receive several unreleased Silver Scooter demos and live recordings from the early days. Everyone will be rewarded regardless of what level you pledged. The recordings (original 4 track cassette) have not seen the light of day ever! Some of these are of great quality and some of them are of... well you know... 'can I get more vocals in the monitor?'

    Please consider sharing this campaign in your social media posts.

    Also, join me at scottgarred.com/blog to see what I'm up to. I'm recording songs and making videos in my VW Westy. I'm about to tour as well. Lots to share and celebrate.

    Download the new single "Will Follow"

story:
My Summary

When I moved to Nashville almost two years ago now, I had decided to not make another record until I felt compelled to do so. I wanted to bring my writing front and center. I also entered into a new town where I didn't know anybody. The new kid on the block. And it has not been easy. This is the farthest I have ever lived away from my family and friends, from my beloved New York, from anything familiar.  But, it has opened more doors for me then I anticipated! I only new that I wanted to learn from the best, write with the best and find myself. These two years have been filled with meeting new people, performing for a whole new audience, writing almost everyday and traveling to festivals that have become the foundation for believing in my music again. Believing that I am not finished making music.

What I Need

The financial support that I will receive  through this  campaign will go to studio time, production, the amazing musicians who will play on the record,a music video, new fantastic merch and the opportunity to finally take this show on the road!!  A dream that I have always had. 

What you get:

FUN STUFF!!!!   The rewards range from digital download and signed CD's, T-shirts, signed lyrics, all the way to a coffee date w/acoustic performance! 

Any contribution large or small would mean the WORLD to me. I wanna get these songs to YOU! If we don't reach our goal, any funds received will all go into recording this  EP!!! WE CAN DO IT!!

The Impact

When I moved down south to work on my craft, I remember making the choice to stay off of the stage for a while. Look inward , really dig deep and find my passion for music again. When I stepped back on the stage, after almost a year, the answer became very clear to me. I love to sing in front of people who love to hear music. And the more I put myself out there, the more love and support I felt. An overwhelming feeling of love and acceptance. Because of this new community, I find myself so inspired and excited to put myself out there , that I can't sit still!  The success of this campaign would mean that I can give back , to all of you wonderful supporters, what I feel is the common bond we all share....love of music. 

From the bottom of my heart, Thank you!!

Other ways to help

If anyone understands how tough it is to want to give but can't, it is me.  BUT, something as simple as sharing this campaign with people you know helps tremendously!!!!

story: Every time I have played my music in public, audiences have asked me where they can find my songs and I haven't been able to tell them. Now my tunes will soon be available for the world to listen! Help bring my EP with beautiful, heartfelt songs into the world! Your financial support will assist with: travel to the studio, recording, mixing, mastering, and pressing of CD:s. Thank you so, so much for your help!
