story:
What is a Denielle Bassels?

 A "Denielle Bassels" (pronounced BASS-elles) is a rare breed of songstress whose souls perch from their music. Through their musing voices they are capable of refreshing the weariest of souls, and bolstering the invigorated to new heights of living. They are most often spotted in their natural habitat of Toronto, Canada; though recent reports found one roaming European city streets,  with a ukulele, and bootstraps of whimsy. Should you come in contact with a Denielle Bassels, don't make any sudden or jerky movements.  Just smile, be friendly, and she will sing you a loverly song.

TO PREVIEW NEW ALBUM !!! CLICK HERE:

 

Hello supporters and fans! 

For the past 2 years I've been writing, arranging and recording my first full length original album, and after a ton of sweat, rivers of tears, and plenty of setbacks, this beautiful album is finished and ready to share!  

My goal was to create a new kind of jazz that seamlessly fused my diverse musical influences. From Nina Simone and Ella Fitzgerald, to 60's Northern Soul, Rockabilly, and Indie. I wanted to create music that was out of the box, and that embraced and entwined the dark, silly, dreamy depths of my mind. Thanks to my dear friend Mike Mathieson; my co-writer, co-producer and engineer extraordinaire, who pushed me past my limits and stretched me further than I ever imagined I could go.  This album is truly all I thought it would be and more.  And I can't wait for you to get your hands on it!

A wee bit of history.. 

I found the musician in me while working as an Au Pair (that's a fancy word for nanny) in Switzerland, when some musicians showed me around to the jazz caves and threw me up on stage one night.  We made up some songs up on the spot and I was swept off my feet by jazz and improv.  Singing with such talented and diverse artists made me hungry for new music skills, so I flew back to Canada to study composition, arranging, rhythm etc. I enrolled in Humber College's music program and got in! There I met my amazing band; Joe Ryan, Jacob Gorzhaltsan, Andy Mac, and Scott Hunter, I have been playing with them ever since and am so grateful they could all contribute their incredible talents to my album!

In 2014, my original song "Cool Cool Water" won grand prize in the Jazz Category of the John Lennon Song Competition and I took it as a sign that I was indeed on the right path.  Phew!.

Shortly after, I wrote, created, sang and poured my entire self into the making of this album.  I was priviledged to work with my amazing band, and was also graced with guest appearances from the incredible musicianship of Aline Homzy (Violin), Andrew McCansh (Trumpet), PJ Anderson (Trombone), and two gorgeous accompanying singers, Meg Contini and Lydia Persaud.

I am now so proud to present to you my first original full-length album:

"What About Wool Wishbags"
 

But We're Not Quite There Yet!!

We need a total of $6800 to master, manufacture, and launch my CD into the world.

The album is written, recorded and mixed. The band is rehearsing for the release. The artwork is gorgeous thanks to, Keren and Avi Gorzhaltsan, who listened to the music and created amazing paintings for the front and back covers. I'm doing the graphic design myself and the lyric art. It's so close!  

You can help me reach the final level!

Level 1.  $2000  gets the album mastered, and ready for manufacturing

Level 2. $4500  gets the above plus 1000 manufactured CD's and a lyric video made for  the first single.

Level 3. $6800 gets promotion to press and radio, so that the music I poured my soul into is able to reach as many ears as possible.

If we are lucky enough to exceed our financial goal, the extra funds will go towards the launch.  There are always surprise costs when launching an album, so the surplus will soften those blows!


The Impact

- A Canadian made album that barters with the boundaries of jazz and indie music.  
- New music 100% artist owned and created.  
- An album that goes over and beyond to make your experience extra special from the writing and production, to the CD package filled with hand-drawn art and lyrics.
- And for me personally; music is my life's journey, and to have the feet that this album could give me will have the most dramatic impact on how far I'm able to go.

Risks & Challenges

Risks are that I won't raise enough money to create the video or to promote the release properly.

  • If this is the case, I will fall to my great team of friends, and family to help me push this album with some love and a lot of extra elbow grease.  I'll go door to door if I have to.  There is no stopping me!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far - thank you!  Just look to the right and see which pledge package fits your lifestyle the best. If you can't afford the minimum amount to pledge, that means your probably a musician too, so please just share this campaign on your social media and you're bound to have some philanthropic friends that might like to pledge!  Thank you for supporting and sharing!!! I truly appreciate it!!
 

ART FOR ALBUM COVER and BACK COVER By Avi and Keren Gorzhaltsan - Original oil paintings  

H

My goal was to create a new kind of jazz that seamlessly fused my diverse musical influences. From Nina Simone and Ella Fitzgerald, to 60's Northern Soul, Rockabilly, and Indie. I wanted to create music that was out of the box, and that embraced and entwined the dark, silly, dreamy depths of my mind. Thanks to my dear friend Mike Mathieson; my co-writer, co-producer and engineer extraordinaire, who pushed me past my limits and stretched me further than I ever imagined I could go.  This album is truly all I thought it would be and more.  And I can't wait for you to get your hands on it!
A wee bit of history.. 
I found the musician in me while working as an Au Pair (that's a fancy word for nanny) in Switzerland, when some musicians showed me around to the jazz caves and threw me up on stage one night.  We made up some songs up on the spot and I was swept off my feet by jazz and improv.  Singing with such talented and diverse artists made me hungry for new music skills, so I flew back to Canada to study composition, arranging, rhythm etc. I enrolled in Humber College's music program and got in! There I met my amazing band; Joe Ryan, Jacob Gorzhaltsan, Andy Mac, and Scott Hunter, I have been playing with them ever since and am so grateful they could all contribute their incredible talents to my album!
In 2014, my original song "Cool Cool Water" won grand prize in the Jazz Category of the John Lennon Song Competition and I took it as a sign that I was indeed on the right path.  Phew!.
Shortly after, I wrote, created, sang and poured my entire self into the making of this album.  I was priviledged to work with my amazing band, and was also graced with guest appearances from the incredible musicianship of Aline Homzy (Violin), Andrew McCansh (Trumpet), PJ Anderson (Trombone), and two gorgeous accompanying singers, Meg Contini and Lydia Persaud.
I am now so proud to present to you my first original full-length album:"What About Wool Wishbags" 

But We're Not Quite There Yet!!
We need a total of $6800 to master, manufacture, and launch my CD into the world.
The album is written, recorded and mixed. The band is rehearsing for the release. The artwork is gorgeous thanks to, Keren and Avi Gorzhaltsan, who listened to the music and created amazing paintings for the front and back covers. I'm doing the graphic design myself and the lyric art. It's so close!  
You can help me reach the final level!
Level 1.  $2000  gets the album mastered, and ready for manufacturing
Level 2. $4500  gets the above plus 1000 manufactured CD's and a lyric video made for  the first single.
Level 3. $6800 gets promotion to press and radio, so that the music I poured my soul into is able to reach as many ears as possible.
If we are lucky enough to exceed our financial goal, the extra funds will go towards the launch.  There are always surprise costs when launching an album, so the surplus will soften those blows!


The Impact
- A Canadian made album that barters with the boundaries of jazz and indie music.  - New music 100% artist owned and created.  - An album that goes over and beyond to make your experience extra special from the writing and production, to the CD package filled with hand-drawn art and lyrics.- And for me personally; music is my life's journey, and to have the feet that this album could give me will have the most dramatic impact on how far I'm able to go.

Risks & Challenges
Risks are that I won't raise enough money to create the video or to promote the release properly.
If this is the case, I will fall to my great team of friends, and family to help me push this album with some love and a lot of extra elbow grease.  I'll go door to door if I have to.  There is no stopping me!!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you've read this far - thank you!  Just look to the right and see which pledge package fits your lifestyle the best. If you can't afford the minimum amount to pledge, that means your probably a musician too, so please just share this campaign on your social media and you're bound to have some philanthropic friends that might like to pledge!  Thank you for supporting and sharing!!! I truly appreciate it!! 
ART FOR ALBUM COVER and BACK COVER By Avi and Keren Gorzhaltsan - Original oil paintings  

H

story:
LISTEN TO THE NEW SINGLE *FROGTOWN* HERE

***Reward options are flexible. If you want to customize a reward, please email me at yellowbirddd@gmail.com and we will work something out, thanks!

***Also, if you simply want to donate, without receiving a reward, please use the hot pink "BACK IT" button to the right of the video. Thanks!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi there!

My name is Liam. I just turned 32. I currently live in Los Angeles, I grew up in Massachusetts. I love songs. I love songwriting. I love lyrics. Since 2010, I've released 7 albums (4 LPs, 3 EPs); But this new album...is going to be a game changer. 

I'm a sucker for a quiet, sad indie/folk song. Great lyrics? Ugh, count me in. Don't worry, the new record is going to have some of that. But it is also going to be unlike any album I've ever made before.

I wanted to release a song, previewing this new approach, in conjunction with my IndieGoGo campaign. I approached my producer friends (who I am respect and admire sooo much), Peter Recine and Joanna Katcher, about working together on the first single...and the fun and excitement has not stopped ever since. Pete and Joanna fill in each other's blanks, they are a powerful pair with top level insight and talent. Check out the resulting first single, Frogtown, via modern-vinyl.com 

Pete and Joanna loved the Frogtown creative experience so much, that they even created a name for their production team: Real Boy. How f-ing cool, right?

As you might guess, at this point, we can't wait to make an album. To grow our ideas and working relationships further. I have 9+ other songs that have I written over the past 2 years, and I feel really strongly about them. With each new album, I try to select my very best songs. For this album, I feel I have done that; and I have two producers to utilize for their trusted feedback. 

I want to follow the path of this full band sound, see where it goes, and get many friends and acquaintances to sing and play on the album. Give the album their feeling, their experience, their life. Take my songs to new places, via their choices. And because I am a professional musician myself, I want to properly pay everyone involved.

Ok, so, here is where you and IndieGoGo come in...

The making (fingers crossed!) of this new album actually marks the first time I have:

- Attempted a crowd funding campaign.

- Aimed to have two producers working on one yellowbirddd album. (2 heads are better than 1!)

- Invited more than 6 different musicians to play on a yellowbirddd record. (the more the merrier!)

- Made a full band album, since 2011.

- Planned to have the album mixed by a dedicated mix engineer, instead of the producer pulling double duty for the mix.

- Been truly open to having a more eclectic, wide ranging sonic palette on a yellowbirddd album.

- Lastly, this is the first time I have ever created a yellowbirddd t-shirt, pin, or sticker. (All merch on this page is exclusive to this indiegogo campaign and will not be made again)


Exclusive IndieGoGo T-shirt! (Pin + Sticker designs coming soon!)

As you can see, historically, yellowbirddd has always been a project with pretty modest execution, and expectations. The dream for this new album, You're Already In Paradise, is to change all that and "build it bigger" as they say. ("they" say that, right?)

I am so grateful for any support you can give, financially, or just by sharing this indiegogo link on social media and email.

Share Link: http://www.yellowbirddd.com/donate

I am psyched on the rewards available to those who donate, and I hope you are psyched too!

Feel free to contact me with any questions at yellowbirddd@gmail.com

Endless thanks,

Liam / yellowbirddd

story:
HI, I’m Steven Ybarra,

I am a Country Pop artist living in San Diego and I am ready to produce some brand new songs that I recently wrote. They are ready to be recorded in Nashville! These country songs infused with pop undertones are the culmination of many experiences and insights. Each of them carries a very special meaning and message to me. There are songs about bridging distances, and relationships, songs about great memories of really good summers growing up in Houston, songs about what dreams dream about, and songs about a never-ending love that stays. For more information on my background, go to www.stevenybarra.com.     

Click here for a sample acoustic teaser of a few songs for my next CD that I'll be recording in the Nashville studios. This snippet is just a hint of how this music will sound before including the top-quality musicians, professional engineers and multi-talented arrangers I’ll be using.       

A bit of background on me:

On my journey of creating and performing music for many years and touring nationally, I’ve been a featured artist for Eric Church, Darius Rucker, Shania Twain, Gavin DeGraw, Carrie Underwood, and many others. I won the Durango Songwriter’s Expo in the Country category and my most recent CD, What I Really Want to Say, reached the top 75 on the Country iTunes chart on release day. The song ‘Stand’ from that CD made it into the Top 10 Chart for Best Country Radio. What I Really Want to Say was considered for 2 Grammy’s in the Best Country Solo Performance and Best Country Album categories. It is because of the loyalty and ongoing support of my fans and friends that I was able to hit those milestones, and keep my career moving forward. I am also grateful to have fantastic sponsors, including Taylor Guitar, Dunlop, Levy’s Leathers, and Elixir Strings.

For more insight into my music and who I am as an artist, you can listen to songs from my most recent CD, What I Really Want to Say, by clicking here. This CD also would not have been possible without the support of my fans.  

The goal is to raise $30,000. All funds received will go toward recording in Nashville, mixing, mastering, duplication, packaging, and distribution. I am really enthusiastic about this campaign, and fully believe that we can push past the initial goal, and take it all the way to the National Tour level and beyond! After the stretch goals are reached, the new songs will go out to every major country radio station in the world, a national tour will be booked, and a new music video will be created. 

As a collaborator on this album, you should know how your investment is being used. I have written all of the songs, and am ready for the next step in the process of creating a new CD. The process will take approximately 2-3 months. Your contribution to this campaign is also your commitment to my music. It’s greatly valued and not taken for granted. As a backer, you are supporting something that I believe in with all my heart and soul, and I am thrilled to have you with me on this journey!

Here is the cost breakdown: 

Here is our projected timeline:

Here are other ways you can help us reach the masses about this campaign too!

Here are other ways you can help this campaign reach the masses!

~Use the Indiegogo share tools.                                                                              

~Share the profile photo above (with the Indegogo logo) along with the URL www.stevenybarra.com/indiegogo.

~Make that image your Facebook profile photo for a few days.

~Create a Facebook event and invite your friends to participate in the campaign.

~Share the URL link www.stevenybarra.com/indiegogo with your email database, friends and family.


 

Let’s really make some noise about

this campaign.

We can hit all the goals!

 

Please check out the great perks above!

 

I hope you’ll join me and help get my new songs recorded, produced and heard worldwide. When you hear these new songs on the radio, you’ll know that YOU were an integral part getting this new music out to the world! Thank you for supporting country artists such as me, and please pledge your support today. Every dollar makes a world of difference, and even sharing my campaign with everyone you know is priceless! Get ready for some awesome new music that will strike a chord with you! 

Thank you! I am forever grateful for your support in getting these new songs out to the world. I will never give up on my dreams to have my music, and the story and message of my music, reach millions of people. With your help this will go all the way!

 For the love of country, for the love of music, for the love of country music, we're gonna do this.

Steven Ybarra

story:
Artie Blue's debut CD!

Hallo allemaal!

Mijn naam is Thijs Antonneau, jullie kennen me zeker en vast vanuit de Ketnet reeks D5R of jullie weten dat ik ook zing! Nu wil ik jullie uitnodigen op deze trip naar nieuwe muziek & een nieuw hoofdstuk in mijn leven. 

My name is Thijs Antonneau and I'm an Actor & Singer. I want to invite you to this journey to new music and a new chapter in my life.

Wat?

Ik werk nu aan een gloednieuwe CD met 5 nieuwe liedjes! Niet alleen de muziek, want er komen ook super coole videoclips & optredens aan!

I'm working on a brand new CD with 5 new songs! Not only music, musicvideo's and performances are coming!

Wanneer?

Vanaf nu kan je je hulp doneren. Let op! De campagne duurt maar 5 weken lang, een unieke kans om zeker bijvoorbeeld mee te doen in een van mijn videoclips.

From now on you can donate. Beware! The camaign only last for 5 weeks, an unique opportunity to get a role in one of my videoclips for example.

Hoe?

Voor dit project heb ik jullie hulp nodig. Jullie kunnen NU al mijn nieuwe liedjes vooruitbestellen. Jouw steun zal me dan ook helpen om alles te financieren van muziekopname's tot vidoeclipopname's.  

For this project I need your help.  From NOW on you can already pre-order my songs.  Your support will help me to fund everything from music recordings to videoclip recordings.

​Praktisch gedeelte:

Je kan doneren via Paypal, bankoverschrijving of kredietkaart (via PayPal). Vergeet zeker niet je naam, adres, e-mail & je fangroep (zoals, ARTIE DIGITAL, ARTIE SIGNATURE...) te vermelden zodat we in contact kunnen blijven. Voor donatie via bankoverschrijving dien je de overschrijving te doen naar onderstaande rekening. Je donatie word binnen de 5 dagen hier geupdate en verder verwerkt.

You can donate via PayPal, bank transfer, or credit card (Via PayPal). Don't forget to mention your name, adres, e-mail & your perk (such as, ARTIE DIGITAL, ARTIE SIGNATURE...) so we can stay in touch. For donations via bank transfer the bank account information is below. Your transfer will be updated on indiegogo within the 5 days.

Bank Account :  THIJS ANTONNEAU  BE68 3770 7989 8634   (BIC: BBRUBEBB) + Mededeling bv: ARTIE DAY, ARTIE LIVE...

story:
Songs about books

Help Charlie and I bring our songs about books to the West Coast!

  • I founded Bushwick Book club in 2009 at Goodbye Blue Monday in Bushwick.  We put on regular shows featuring new music, art and snacks inspired by a chosen work of literature.  Charlie is a long time recording engineer, producer, musician and songwriter who started contributing to Bushwick Book Club in 2013.  We've formed a duo, Lusterlit, as a new context for what we've done for years-- write, record and perform our songs inspired by literature.
  • We're bringing ourselves and our songs to the west coast to connect with existing Bushwick Book Club chapters and songwriting friends and also let the literature-inspired sparks fly in BBC-virginal areas like... Portland, Oregon!
  • You're helping create the first Bushwick Book Club Tour.  We're planning for it to be the first of many as Bushwick Book Club keeps growing, and literature-inspired creativity spreads to other cities in the U.S. and beyond (hello, Malmo, Sweden!).

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal of $2000 is going towards the printing of physical CDs of Lusterlit's two recordings -- "Hopeful Monsters" and "Everything is Sateen: Five Songs Inspired by Vonnegut" which are right now only available online.  We're also printing bookmarks, stickers and Tshirts in addition to purchasing the flights and car rental.  Luckily we have friends with couches out there, so we're saving that way!
  • Every donation receives an invite to the fundraising brunch party sponsored by BUSHWITCH--Bushwick's new everyday magic service created by Julie Lamendola and Susan Hwang.
  • Other levels of donations qualify for gratitude in the shape of Lusterlit recordings, postcards from the road, custom songs, live performances and special services and gifts at the BUSHWITCH party!

Thank you for spreading the word

We appreciate anything you can do to help!

  • We appreciate you spreading the word about this tour and about Bushwick Book Club in general.  We're spreading the love of songs about books.  We figure love is the best thing going in any scenario, but we appreciate you helping us to do it in this particular form.  Thank you!!

story:
We are the only website that is entirely dedicated to this beautiful genre of psy-downtempo music, we are happy to support the scene !

We started psybient.org in 2013, to become a daily source of "chill" and other mind expanding music. This project is non-commercial. Small team of volunteers, lead by Iurii Gagarin are making constant efforts to keep you updated with news of psychedelic "chill" realm. We are passionate about "chill / downtempo" music and believe that it has a positive impact on humans, music is beneficial for body, mind and spirit !

2 years ago, we successfully crowdfunded psybient.org forum , and it has now 730 members and 6000+ posts.

Today we need to gather funds, to finance - upgrade and redesign psybient.org website - make it FAST and more interactive ! We have many ideas and you are welcome to share yours. We noticed , than our site is outdated, it can take up to 24 seconds to display pages. Many people abandon half open page. We need to fix this.

If you don't have credit card, you can use paypal or bitcoin

Or alternatively you can donate via paypal or bitcoin.  (our paypal is : contact _AT_ psybient.org paypal CAD :  promo _AT_ psybient.org )

Support us and receive MUSIC (perk's start with only €1)

We know that money are hard to earn,  we appreciate any contribution (1 eu, 5 eu or more). Together, we can put a new milestone in history of psybient / psychill movement !

if you support a campaign you will receive exclusive presents / perks  - great high quality lossless music from our partners - best labels in the scene (Altar Records, AstroPilot Music, Dubmission, Maia Brazil, Merkaba Music, Microcosmos, Mystic Sound, OM Mantra and Street Ritual. A list of around 20-40 recent albums for you to choose from.) 

 

Why do we need money :

In short we need money to migrate to new server, setup reliable backup and make a code optimization. After this we will redesign website , make interactive and modern.

We want this project to live and evolve, we want to give you a smooth experience of music discovery.

 

 

How we will spend money (details):

Our first priority is to make website faster and to resolve technical issues. After this, we will design and code new version of website. Crowdfunders will be able to influence new design and functionalities. 

1st Priority (speed improvements):

- new hosting (for 2 years) = 300 euros

- backup dropbox pro account (for 3 years) = 300 euros

- database migration technical support = 200 euros

- wordpress migration assistance = 200 euros

- wordpress plugins migration assistance = 300 euros

- wordpress fixes and improvements  = 500 euros

- css fixes  = 300 euros

- campaign perks/presents (printing stickers and postal services) = 227 euros

- campaign fees 250 eu (indiegogo takes from 10% for services)

------------  1st priority total : 2550 euros ------------

2nd priority (new design + developments ) :

- new logo design = 200 euros

- purchase plugin to manage events = 200 euros

- new custom design wordpress theme  = 400 euros

- custom developments of wordpress backend = 500 euros

- forum support licence extension ( 2 years) = 200 euros

- campaign fees 150 eu (indiegogo takes from 10% for services)

------------ 2nd priority total : 1650 euros ------------

- if we gather enough money we will make a digital release to mark our 4th year in the internet space

------------ 1st +  2nd priority total : 2550 + 1650 = 4200 euros ------------

 

If we don't reach entire goal :

We would love to accomplish all plans soon, and all extra cash will help to make things easier. However, if we don’t get all funds now, we will start to implement according to available funds and will make a second crowdfunding campaign later. We need your participation and believe in your support !

The Impact

Our website is the probably one of most important news channels that support chillout music, we help artist and labels to connect with listeners, we help listeners to discover music .

Our website is visited by 40'000 of visitors monthly, we are providing an important source of content from chillout lovers from over 50 countries.

Our forum.psybient.org has 730 users, there we discuss music, music production and other interesting subjects.

 

Risks 

Luckily some of our members have a background in web development and will help to advise in order to find the best solutions.

We will advance step by step to make sure everything go smoothly.

in 2015 we successfully made a crowdfunding campaign and forum is online.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to contribute and to help us to make this happen :

  • Share links to this campaign with your network of friends (you can use Indiegogo share tools!)
  • Invite your friends to facebook event (link coming soon)
  • Donate now or later via our donation page.
  • Labels and artists: give us a "shout" in your next newsletter or share on your pages in social medias.

 

Got questions or propositions ? Contact us

feel free to contact us if you have other ideas or suggestions or if you want to help psybient.org project and team in some way:

FB PAGE => https://www.facebook.com/psybient.org

Contact form =>  http://www.psybient.org/love/about/

Project future discussion => http://forum.psybient.org/index.php/topic/384-psybientorg-celebrates-2-years-help-us-with-ideas-for-the-future/

Thanks for stopping by and for your support :)

with Love and Light,

psybient.org team
story_txt:
We are the only website that is entirely dedicated to this beautiful genre of psy-downtempo music, we are happy to support the scene !
We started psybient.org in 2013, to become a daily source of "chill" and other mind expanding music. This project is non-commercial. Small team of volunteers, lead by Iurii Gagarin are making constant efforts to keep you updated with news of psychedelic "chill" realm. We are passionate about "chill / downtempo" music and believe that it has a positive impact on humans, music is beneficial for body, mind and spirit !
2 years ago, we successfully crowdfunded psybient.org forum , and it has now 730 members and 6000+ posts.
Today we need to gather funds, to finance - upgrade and redesign psybient.org website - make it FAST and more interactive ! We have many ideas and you are welcome to share yours. We noticed , than our site is outdated, it can take up to 24 seconds to display pages. Many people abandon half open page. We need to fix this.

If you don't have credit card, you can use paypal or bitcoin
Or alternatively you can donate via paypal or bitcoin.  (our paypal is : contact _AT_ psybient.org paypal CAD :  promo _AT_ psybient.org )

story:
WHO ARE THE YOUNG OFFENDERS??

We are a band called “Young Offenders”. A Brit style independent punk band made up of UK front man and guitarist Kyle Landman, bassist Anthony Katern and drummer Leigh Shags. We're 3 extremely hard working dudes who all share the same dream, to pursue a career making original music!  

YO have been making waves in Australia, playing sold out shows, developing a loyal following and supporting legendary punk bands such as The Dead Kennedys, The Ruts, The Exploited, Billy Talent, The Cribs & Stiff Little Fingers.

YO have also been brushing shoulders with some of Australia’s best up and coming acts playing alongside The Bennies, Dune Rats, DZ Deathrays, The Hard Aches, High Tension, Grenadiers, West Thebarton Brothel Party, Peep Tempel, Bad//Dreems & Horror My Friend...so it's only befitting that we hit the road ourselves! That's where you come in...

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Over the past three years we have built a strong, professional relationship with the Joe Strummer Foundation who are based in the United Kingdom. They have invited Young Offenders to play on the Strummerville Stage at Glastonbury Music Festival 2017 and have helped to book some of our tour of the UK after using our tracks ‘Boys Are Out’ on their first fundraising album, and helping Dr.Martens source ‘Watch This City Burn’ for an online campaign early last year.

This is an invaluable opportunity for us to expand our audience base on an international scale and undertake a tour of the UK for the first time. Not only will the band greatly expand its audience base, but will have ample opportunities for networking with other artists and industry professionals from around the world. 

 Your donations/purchases will go directly towards helping cover the costs of:

Flights

Accommodation

Visas

Insurance

Backline Hire

Van Hire

Petrol

Merchandise

Marketing

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Donations can be made straight-up via the 'BUY US A VIRTUAL PINT' perk,

or

You can help by purchasing one of the many goods and services we are willing to provide - including downloads of our music, t-shirts, hand made posters and even a private gig at your home or venue of your choice.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

The truth is...There are LOADS of challenges that go into making a band successful and we wouldn't be asking for your help if we didn't need it. 

But if you are like us and you're currently in a tight spot for $$$, fear not! You can help us out simply by sharing this page on social media, spreading the word, and telling your friends. 

Thank you all from the bottom of our hearts! The fact that you even visited this page means you're  awesome and we can’t wait to see you at a show very soon.

Cheers

Kyle, Ant & Leigh

TOUR DATES

June 3rd - London - Railway Tavern, Tulse Hill

June 8th - Leicester - The Shed

June 10th - Nottingham -

June 16th - North London - Camden Strummerville Show

June 21st - 25th - Glastonbury Music Festival

June 30th - Deal - The Walmer Castle

story: •

Friends and Family,

The pieces have fallen together, and the time has come for us to get in the studio and document our work. however, finances are proving to be the final obstacle. We are very grateful for all the support we have received from all of you up to this point and we look forward to  the opportunity of bringing you a great finished project.

The other musicians on the album include my great friends Eugenia Choe on piano, and Juan Sanchez on drums. It has been an absolute pleasure working with these musicians, each of whom has brought this music to life. Any help is appreciated!

We love you!

story:
About us

 

We are a 4-piece indie-rock band from London, England. All of us come from different music backgrounds, but  combined we create an interesting and unique sound. Our music is something special. It can be soft and grungy at the same time, topped with a massive energy and chill vibe. 

So we are asking you guys, indie-rock enthusiasts and just music lovers to support us on this special moment of our lives.

You guys are the main reason we write what we write. Music is an unique language that can make you feel different kinds of emotions even only listening to a 3 minute long song-masterpiece. 

 

What are we asking for?

We are looking forward to record our debut EP album, but for that to happen we need your help, music lovers!

Basically..

Recording a single song, radio quality. Consists of recording, mixing, mastering. In a professional recording studio.

It is about 375 £

So our plan for a normal-sized EP is about 4 songs.

One song (375 £) * 4 = 1500£ (EP ALBUM)

Anyone who funds us gets a free copy of our debut EP album. Doesn't matter how much you have helped us. 

But.. if you have helped us above the minumum funding, you'll get ever more extras with the copy of our EP album. As you help us more, we'll give and surprise you more!

And IF... we don't reach our goal..

We will still try to record at least one song and release it as a debut single.

Or two, or three..

But we trust our fans and supporters, that all of us can make this happen!

Help us to create something that we love

Music for us is like the meaning of life. Getting excited before every gig, smiling after every perfectly written song, having that eye-to-eye moment when you and your band play a great song, that gives you goosebumps.

It would mean the world to us if we are able to record our debut EP album.

A massive step forward for our band and each of us individually. 

 

How you can help us?

1. Help us reach our goal of recording our debut EP album!

2. If it is not possible to help us with the funding - you can still be really helpful and share this with your friends and followers. 

 

We can't wait to share our music with all of you!

story:
The funds raised through this program will be used to produce a world class music CD. Specifically, they will pay for the musical charts, package design, studio costs, musician fees, manufacturing costs including reproduction fees.

 

I am committed to execute and complete this project in a timely manner.   Rest assured, the most talented musicians and production will be engaged!   I consider this music as a history making endeavor.  

Please share this information with anyone you think this would excite!  

I thank you for your being part of this project and will post updates of the progress!   Jamie

campaign_city: San Francisco, CA/Bay area, United States

story:
I first fell in love with music when I was in the seventh grade in Zimbabwe, in the year 2000. Our class teacher, Mr Maposa taught all the subjects and music was one of them. I remember one day he arranged us in class according to our vocal capabilities and he went to the chalk board, thought to himself and scribbled some musical notation on it (it looked quite gibberish to me). Moments later he expressed what he had noted vocally, with a melody. I was in utter disbelief that one could do that! Sadly though, I never quite paid much attention to music after that due to the fact that I was at a new school, in a new country and learning things in a new language (English from Kiswahili which is my native tongue). I had to focus on my studies and get ready for my final exams but, I will never forget that day and I still remember the tune to the song Mr maposa wrote down. I never got the chance to learn music again, the schools I went to after did not have music programs and them being boarding schools in rural areas meant I had no access to anything music related really.


Music was not done with me and it would come to haunt me again. I was a freshman at university in Botswana (in 2007), I remember one night we were studying until late and I wanted to take a breather because I was tired. I then asked a friend of mine Kweku if I could listen to some music on his PSP (Playstation Portable game device). There were a couple of good tunes in there, I was feeling relaxed. I then started hearing some instrumentals, after the first two I looked over at the PSP to see who the artist was. I could not believe my eyes, Kweku had made those instumentals! I got up and I asked Kweku if he really had made them, his reply was yes he did. The next day we went over to his house, he showed me his set up (which was just a PC, the software he used were FruityLoops studio and Propellerhead Reason and a pair of studio monitors). I did not not have a computer of my own at the time so, whenever I got the chance I would go over to Kweku’s house and learn how to use the software. The following year I got my own laptop and oh boy, how excited I was!! I was studying Civil Engineering at the time and again I needed to focus more on my studies so I did music when I got the chance. My parents were working very hard to put me and my siblings through school and it would be unfair if I were to neglect the opportunity given.
I graduated in 2013, that same year we relocated back home in Tanzania. I had taken a break from doing music, I wanted to get a job experience. In 2014 I then decided that I will take music more serious, I then decided to save up some money and move back to Southern Africa (I was targeting South Africa mostly but I ended up settling in Botswana in January 2015). It was a very demanding, low pay position but it got me to put food on the table. 


I lost my job in February of this year (2017). It was a bittersweet moment for me, I was glad that the emotional and physical demands of the past 2 years are finally over but then again how was I going to survive? I took comfort in that, maybe I could use this time to work on my long dream of making music. I then started watching tutorials on how to get better at it. It has not been all that great, times have changed and music has evolved. I am still using an old software (Propellerhead Reason 5 from 2010) which is still okay but to keep up with the times and for me to express my full creativity I would need the latest version of the software on the market which is Propellerhead Reason 9. I would also need a more powerful laptop to efficiently run the software and other devices. My current laptop can hardly handle the software that I am using, hence most times I find myself not being able to make music of great quality. I would also be needing a midi keyboard and a pair of studio monitors so I can correctly arrange the sounds. 
This was a long post (I apologise for taking too much of your time). I would very much appreciate if you were kind enough to help me in any way to realize my long dream of making music full time. I could and would have saved up for this but I have also been helping my folks back home, resettling has not been easy but they’re okay . We have not met but I love you, for taking the time and for supporting me. Asante sana.


Below is a breakdown of what the money pledged will be spent on.


Apple MacBook Pro:                                                                                                    US$2500
Propellerhead Reason 9 software:                                                                          US$400
Akai Professional MPK Mini MKII 25 Key USB MIDI Controller:                    US$100
Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub With Individual Power Switches and LEDs: US$10
KRK RP8G3-NA Rokit 8 Generation 3 Powered Studio Monitor (Pair):     US$600
SANUS BF31-B1 31" Speaker Stands for Bookshelf Speakers:                     US$50
Office furniture for studio set up:                                                                            US$600

Thank you again. Here’s a link to some of the stuff I’ve made and shared. https://soundcloud.com/g-o-e-ideas-house


 I have made a bit more but I have not shared them online. I intend on making better sounding music should I reach the target.

I lost my job in February of this year (2017). It was a bittersweet moment for me, I was glad that the emotional and physical demands of the past 2 years are finally over but then again how was I going to survive? I took comfort in that, maybe I could use this time to work on my long dream of making music. I then started watching tutorials on how to get better at it. It has not been all that great, times have changed and music has evolved. I am still using an old software (Propellerhead Reason 5 from 2010) which is still okay but to keep up with the times and for me to express my full creativity I would need the latest version of the software on the market which is Propellerhead Reason 9. I would also need a more powerful laptop to efficiently run the software and other devices. My current laptop can hardly handle the software that I am using, hence most times I find myself not being able to make music of great quality. I would also be needing a midi keyboard and a pair of studio monitors so I can correctly arrange the sounds. This was a long post (I apologise for taking too much of your time). I would very much appreciate if you were kind enough to help me in any way to realize my long dream of making music full time. I could and would have saved up for this but I have also been helping my folks back home, resettling has not been easy but they’re okay . We have not met but I love you, for taking the time and for supporting me. Asante sana.
Below is a breakdown of what the money pledged will be spent on.
Apple MacBook Pro:                                                                                                    US$2500Propellerhead Reason 9 software:                                                                          US$400Akai Professional MPK Mini MKII 25 Key USB MIDI Controller:                    US$100Sabrent 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub With Individual Power Switches and LEDs: US$10KRK RP8G3-NA Rokit 8 Generation 3 Powered Studio Monitor (Pair):     US$600SANUS BF31-B1 31" Speaker Stands for Bookshelf Speakers:                     US$50Office furniture for studio set up:                                                                            US$600
Thank you again. Here’s a link to some of the stuff I’ve made and shared. https://soundcloud.com/g-o-e-ideas-house
 I have made a bit more but I have not shared them online. I intend on making better sounding music should I reach the target.

story: St. Groove have been a band for 7 years and we finally decided to make a body of work that is tangible. If you have seen us live, we want to make a record that translates that experience as best as possible. To do that, we need your support. We have decided to record in a professional studio where we can achieve that desired sound. We will be recording a FULL LP of material that we think represents us and our sound truthfully. We have recorded an EP in the same studio, and were looking to take it to the next level. Any support, small or large, is muchly appreciated.

We have recorded an EP in the same studio, and were looking to take it to the next level. Any support, small or large, is muchly appreciated.

story:
There's never been a better time to be a rebel.

  • I'm Geoff Byrd and here's my BIO: http://geoffbyrd.com/bio/

  • Here's a few pictures of me: http://geoffbyrd.com/photos/

  • Here's the thing: I don't love the music business at ALL. I just love the music. It really is a broken model based on human suffering and outright theft. You've all heard the stories on "Behind the Music" and the Vampiric nature of the industry. We all know the empty suits just squeeze an orange & then pat themselves on the back, claiming to discover orange juice. 

  • I had some success in my career, but long lasting financial success eluded me because I'm a bit of a headstrong rebel and they don't appreciate that much. If you do what you're told, they will help you, if you don't, you're on your own. But that's actually a blessing to tell you the truth. That's why I'm totally independent these days. And, no matter what the offer, I will always STAY independent. I don't want any "handler" telling me what to do, nor should ANY artist worth their salt. We know people aren't buying CDs anymore & it's harder than ever to make a living as a musician. I could use your help.

  • I want to speak from the heart with a rapid fire lyrical fearlessness. I also want to experiment with my voice as the only instrument on this record. I can cut & paste & take chances, use tons of syncopation & asymmetrical beats to create something that is fun & interesting. Stripped down production wise, but layered with interesting vocal tracks and spooky noises & whatever I come up with along the way. Organic, but not at all novelty. No cover songs, only brand new, original songs. I just want to speak my truth.

  • It seems like comedians are being censored. Thought crime & political correctness have suddenly become really overbearing, and many musicians are content to make music that is pure escapism instead of intellectually honest songwriting. They do that because "fun" is safer and escapism is avoidance. There's nothing wrong with fun music, but it seems like that's 99% of what's out there these days. It's good to take shots at the system, because let's face it, the system is pretty damn evil.

  • It's turbulent out there in the social sphere too. That's why freedom of speech seems more important than ever. I also think music has a large role in pointing out the absurdities of the control system. "Normal" is actually pretty insane if you really take an honest look at it; the inmates run the asylum. But most people are content to write songs about being in the club and how big that chick's booty is, and about how important they are because of their thick, gold chain, custom made with their name written in diamonds. rampant materialism & base consciousness doesn't HAVE to be the new normal for Hip Hop though.

  • There's been plenty of incredible music over the years that brought the truth regardless of consequence. Deep shit is not marketable these days. But so what! That doesn't mean it's not important. In fact, maybe it's more important than ever to write challenging lyrics. Who said doing what's right leads to popularity? Popularity is just peer pressure anyway. 

  • Privacy doesn't even exist anymore. We have apparently just accepted that government spying is the new normal. There will be a few shots across the bow on this record. Here's a line from one of the new songs: "All you agents in the NSA, I got one finger with a lot to say."

  • I accidentally wrote "Fly Free" while experimenting in the studio. But it was a happy accident for sure. The process was inspiring and it went down easy, so now I want to write & record 9 more songs in that same vain. Check out the video for "Fly Free" here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eq5yg2-qgGE

  • Also, check out my song "Planet X." Even though it's not an aCappella production like "Fly Free" is, you can get a feel for my lyrical content and my melodic flow. Check it out here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=as8d8T3HPWQ

  • I want to take aim at the establishment and the inauthentic life we are encouraged to live. I know that's not popular, I mean "Shots, shots, shots, shots, shots, shots" was a Grammy Nominated lyric a few years ago (wow, super deep) & now it's "Work, work, work, work, work" (meh) Not hating, it's just not groundbreaking or interesting to me conceptually. 

  • I just believe there's more to say out there, and I think I have an interesting way to deliver it. In an age where zombies run around taking selfies on railroad tracks, as they collect Pokemon while driving, & girls get ALL dressed up just to stare at their cell phones and text their friends sitting right next to them, I think we can do better. What happened to songs like "What's Goin' On" & "Peace Train" or "Another Brick In The Wall" that made you think?

  • Another line from a new song: "Gather courage, not Pokemon, go see the world you're standing on." We are in a culture that values Human 2.0, the cyborg. But I think the original model is classic. I prefer analogue. These days, man is merging with machine but to what end? Is our life really better now that we have 8 different social media accounts? It's stresses me the fuck out to be honest. But our true humanity is in our empathy, our emotions, our passion, our hearts. Everybody wants to be Spock; I'd rather be Kirk. Engage number one! Just light a match if you engage number two. Insert poop emoji here.

  • I appreciate your help very much. Thank you for being a patron of the arts & for encouraging truth & freedom of expression. We are not just the collective, the hive mind, the Borg. We are people that need each other, yes. But we must retain and encourage individuality. Otherwise, what is art for? Is it just for money and image and PR agents? Is it just for social media hit counts and the cult of personality? Is it just to be famous and be on TV? I think we should make art for the same reason they did thousands of years ago, to express ourselves and say something real. Sometimes people just have to step up and say things that need to be said. I know that's what I want to do with this record. 

  • I just want to buy groceries, have the right gear, and go all mad scientist in the studio like Brian Wilson did. I seriously can't WAIT to get started. I'm super excited to be honest. And I'm not the type that gets all unicorns and rainbows at the drop of a hat. But this project has some juice. Thanks for your help; for real, I appreciate you! 

  • To see artwork choices for 8x10 photo original artworks  by Geoff Byrd, go here: http://geoffbyrd.com/art/
  • My music website: http://geoffbyrd.com/ 
  • My BIO: http://geoffbyrd.com/bio/
  • My WIKI page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geoff_Byrd

story:
My name is Quinn Spencer, I have been playing and making music for the last 15 years. I have had the chance to play music and travel with my experience. Today I have a special opportunity to go on the road again and this time to the west coast. I was offered the position of bass on their upcoming tour and I need help getting out there and back.

 

In this campaign I want to offer you, the contributor, a digital copy of my new album Liquid Crystal before I release it to the public. Liquid Crystal features 16 instrumental, electronic beats that will melt you into a syrup like liquid consistent of bananas and strawberries, guaranteed. I put 2 years of solid focused effort into this release and The universe tells me this is the perfect time to release it. For minimum of a $10 donation I will send you a digital copy via email.

 

Your contributions will effectively help me get back into playing music out of Jacksonville.

 

Your Donations for the album will cover my travel cost and food, directly helping me.

story:
Our IMPACT = Your SUPPORT + My VISION

I am who I am today because of you all. My family, friends, my supporters <3 You brought the real Katarzyna back, filled with love and passion, ready to sing my heart out, give joy and inspire the world. THANK YOU! Hope you'll read until the end and CONTRIBUTE :)

My VISION

  • To discover a path of a successful musical theatre/film actress, to be the best I can in my career and impact life of those in need, not only an actress but a humanitarian as well. 
  • To be a role model and a mentor for young people to inspire and guide them in following their passion and making their dreams come true. Why - I never had that type of professional support myself.
  • To found an academy/institution different than all the currents ones. Here, both children with special needs and healthy children/ youngsters come together to explore their passion and grow especially through arts, become exceptional, giving them not only a talent development but also business skills to make money from their passion already while they study - long term goal

    *my story will help you understand my vision :) you can read it below*

My STORY

I was born and raised on the south-west of Poland in a home where spending time with each other, having meals together, gardening, helping was just living. My parents; dad, a plumber and mum, a retired-teacher, taught me compassion, warmheartedness, giving without expecting anything in return. Mum once said; "have tears for yourself and smile for the world". This rang true to me even to this day.

Since childhood, I felt it clearly that I had the ability to be who I want to be, that everything is possible, that we all have special gift to the world. But I didn't realise that so many people have not yet discovered theirs.

After exploring the world through travelling I may say, regardless the fact that my parents struggled to make ends meet, I am so grateful for the childhood I was given. I never wanted to give my parents additional worries. My wish was to always put a smile on their face, so I always did my best to get top grades at school, strove to be better and better at everything that I did, giving my all. I was able to stay among one of the top students in class. I attended all the extra classes and worked hard. This  probably might be the reason why I wasn't liked by other students. I learned to find joy in spending time on my own by singing, I could pour out all what hurt me.

Just by being one of the top students through the school years, I was always being bullied. I never had the courage to speak to anyone about this, or to stand for myself, but life is the best teacher. Now that I am older, I can see the bigger picture. I just didn't fit in. I was the weird one, what interested my friends didn't interest me at all. I liked older schoolmates or adults more, as they helped me to grow. I love the growth.

Nevertheless, ever since I was bullied I kept shutting down more and more, even though deep down, I knew that I had a lot to give to others and to the world, but I was not able to express my true self. Whenever I was offering help, I would be mocked, left alone until they needed me again. I was being taken for granted.

I remember telling my mum one time about my vision, that I saw myself in front of a giant audience, empowering them to be who they want to be using my voice and bringing them joy! Not knowing how mum would react, she said, “if that's what you feel, go for it". I was so happy to hear that. Mum has always been my most loyal supporter. I truly believe that money isn't everything, but love is.

More challenges arises when others’ voices kept telling me, “you should stop with all this music idea and focus on being a doctor or a lawyer with my brains, a serious profession, not being a dreamer”, but what about my heart? It was thanks to mum that I am able to be so strong today. She cared about my heart so much, if it wasn't for her I probably would have given up by now. My dreams would have died with me from all the bullying that I had went through. Even as I am writing this, my eyes are getting teary.  Adam Mickiewicz, a famous Polish poet and dramatist once wrote, "true love does not end, ever, the more you give, the more you receive".

Since then, I took the exam to do my secondary music school in vocal performance and started to study opera. After graduation, I got accepted into Music Academy. I did this collaterally with my English College. This time, I had a rough 5-6 years with another singing teacher I chose as I've heard students saying that this teacher is tough but if you survive you sing. Regardless all of the "painful" moments I am grateful to her, yes I am, because by loudly doubting in my voice she challenged me and the more she mocked my ability of becoming, the more I grew in strength. She saw the real me and the gift that I had. As challenging as she was, she also helped me discover how much I love musical theater.  I remember then coming across an actress who was not only a musical theater but also a film actress, her name was Kristin Chenoweth. She became one of my career-inspirations for the future, musical theater and film. I’ve always wished for someone like her as a mentor.

After being told constantly that I will never make it in this industry, I kind of lost hope. Just a part of me inside still wanted to keep going. I went on an inner-journey to rediscover my voice and my true self. Time alone was what I needed the most. I prayed for a mentor, like a father who could be there for me and guide me.

Shortly after, as if God have heard my prayers, after hearing me pour my heart into the song “Papa can you hear me", a mentor has found me and ever since then continuously supports me and believes in me. I have a lot to thank him for.

Ever since then, as if by magic, other people started to approach me, telling me how my singing have inspired them and have given them back something they once lost. The more I gave, the more I would receive back. All the new friendships I was given, this unexpected exposure and belief, they truly believe in me. Of course there are also those who don't believe, who still mock, but as I remember my friend Trent Shelton in his speech said once "Haters, are the confused supporters, give them time", I really love this sentence.

During my travel exploring the world, I had conversations with actors and actresses as well as my international peers on the way of becoming...  Because London and New York are said to be the musical theatre cradle I knew I want to learn the craft in one or the other one. Big Apple though, was more cheerful, giggly, more like me :) I wished to study there, but had no idea how and where. I was in London at that time when I saw New York Film Academy holding auditions. I couldn't believe, in 2010 at the dance camp I heard my friend being so excited about this school. I had a little dream deep in my heart since then. Everything has its right timing, I believe. I went there, listened about the program, very intensive, very condense and conservatory that means more practice than theory. In two years time I would learn so much. I felt extremely excited, but I didn't have the money so I auditioned for the short intensive 4 -week program. I got accepted, I read the acceptance email like a hundred times, before I actually believed! I earned for this course myself. When I went there... every day felt like I'm in the right place doing what I am supposed to be doing. Every day, all the classes we had, the support and encouragement, every subject what it was about, the deeper meaning of life, the natural truths, pouring your feelings through songs, this felt like home to my heart.

At the end of this course we could audition for a whole 2-years program. I took this chance, not having money, now or never. I was blown away when I found out that not only did I get accepted, but I was granted the highest talent-based scholarship available!

Now I promised myself, with YOUR support, I will do whatever GOOD it takes to continue in the direction of my heart!

I thank the Lord for all the challenging people that had taught me lessons and my supporters entering my life. Even with this campaign now, I couldn’t have made it happen alone without the help and support of my mum, my family, Mr Roger Del Pozo, Mr Joey Zangardi-Dixon, thanks for the amazing video & photos Abel Lawson, Denny Silva, Krzysztof Buratyński, Marek Walczyk, my amazing UK friends (Indiegogo team) Ich Loc, Jonathan Poon, Marium Zulfigar, Luke Scott, and all my offline and online friends-supporters. I truly love and appreciate every one of you. It means a world to me, just to hear words such as "keep up the good work", "keep moving forward", "well done" and more.

I am who I am today because of you all. You brought the real Katarzyna back, filled with love and passion, ready to sing my heart out, give joy and inspire the world. THANK YOU!

NOW

When I was accepted for a month intensive course I didn't think I may later be accepted to the full program, I saved enough money to pay for the month fee, so now when I got accepted to the full program, I was extremely happy and I thought I will do whatever GOOD it takes to make it happen. The course starts on January 23rd 2017, so I need to start my visa process as soon as possible. I mailed International Offices at NYFA asking what's the latest date, I would need to send them documents that I have the money, bank statements, sponsors' assurance that they will invest in me etc, so the school can start the VISA procedure which takes 4-6 weeks, as you can see the timing is tight, I do believe, if this is God's will and He helped me a lot since, I believe that I will make it and your help here whether financial or just sharing, spreading the word, or best would be both :) is inevitable. I put the date 12th of December as the 24th December is the deadline to pay for my first semester and the transfer from my bank (Polish) to American one takes up to 14 days. Now it is required by the embassy to not only provide the finance for the fee but also costs of living which is calculated 15 600 $ per year and cover all the visa costs. This is why I thought to focus on crowdfunding for my first year now.

in the 39 700 $ there is
- a year fee
- costs of living
- costs of visa + flights 

No donation is too small, please share and feel free to contact me, blessings xo

If you can't donate, you still can help by sharing the video wherever you can, maybe your friends know someone who sponsors artists and would love to support me, I will appreciate any help. Thank you very much for your time, for that you read my whole story and that you spent so much time getting to know me. I sincerely appreciate it. Every good word, every word of support counts, thank you from the bottom of my heart. I wish you all best wishes and many blessings from above :))

My wish was to always put a smile on their face, so I always did my best to get top grades at school, strove to be better and better at everything that I did, giving my all. I was able to stay among one of the top students in class. I attended all the extra classes and worked hard. This  probably might be the reason why I wasn't liked by other students. I learned to find joy in spending time on my own by singing, I could pour out all what hurt me.Just by being one of the top students through the school years, I was always being bullied. I never had the courage to speak to anyone about this, or to stand for myself, but life is the best teacher. Now that I am older, I can see the bigger picture. I just didn't fit in. I was the weird one, what interested my friends didn't interest me at all. I liked older schoolmates or adults more, as they helped me to grow. I love the growth.Nevertheless, ever since I was bullied I kept shutting down more and more, even though deep down, I knew that I had a lot to give to others and to the world, but I was not able to express my true self. Whenever I was offering help, I would be mocked, left alone until they needed me again. I was being taken for granted.I remember telling my mum one time about my vision, that I saw myself in front of a giant audience, empowering them to be who they want to be using my voice and bringing them joy! Not knowing how mum would react, she said, “if that's what you feel, go for it". I was so happy to hear that. Mum has always been my most loyal supporter. I truly believe that money isn't everything, but love is.More challenges arises when others’ voices kept telling me, “you should stop with all this music idea and focus on being a doctor or a lawyer with my brains, a serious profession, not being a dreamer”, but what about my heart? It was thanks to mum that I am able to be so strong today. She cared about my heart so much, if it wasn't for her I probably would have given up by now. My dreams would have died with me from all the bullying that I had went through. Even as I am writing this, my eyes are getting teary.  Adam Mickiewicz, a famous Polish poet and dramatist once wrote, "true love does not end, ever, the more you give, the more you receive".Since then, I took the exam to do my secondary music school in vocal performance and started to study opera. After graduation, I got accepted into Music Academy. I did this collaterally with my English College. This time, I had a rough 5-6 years with another singing teacher I chose as I've heard students saying that this teacher is tough but if you survive you sing. Regardless all of the "painful" moments I am grateful to her, yes I am, because by loudly doubting in my voice she challenged me and the more she mocked my ability of becoming, the more I grew in strength. She saw the real me and the gift that I had. As challenging as she was, she also helped me discover how much I love musical theater.  I remember then coming across an actress who was not only a musical theater but also a film actress, her name was Kristin Chenoweth. She became one of my career-inspirations for the future, musical theater and film. I’ve always wished for someone like her as a mentor.After being told constantly that I will never make it in this industry, I kind of lost hope. Just a part of me inside still wanted to keep going. I went on an inner-journey to rediscover my voice and my true self. Time alone was what I needed the most. I prayed for a mentor, like a father who could be there for me and guide me.Shortly after, as if God have heard my prayers, after hearing me pour my heart into the song “Papa can you hear me", a mentor has found me and ever since then continuously supports me and believes in me. I have a lot to thank him for.Ever since then, as if by magic, other people started to approach me, telling me how my singing have inspired them and have given them back something they once lost. The more I gave, the more I would receive back. All the new friendships I was given, this unexpected exposure and belief, they truly believe in me. Of course there are also those who don't believe, who still mock, but as I remember my friend Trent Shelton in his speech said once "Haters, are the confused supporters, give them time", I really love this sentence.During my travel exploring the world, I had conversations with actors and actresses as well as my international peers on the way of becoming...  Because London and New York are said to be the musical theatre cradle I knew I want to learn the craft in one or the other one. Big Apple though, was more cheerful, giggly, more like me :) I wished to study there, but had no idea how and where. I was in London at that time when I saw New York Film Academy holding auditions. I couldn't believe, in 2010 at the dance camp I heard my friend being so excited about this school. I had a little dream deep in my heart since then. Everything has its right timing, I believe. I went there, listened about the program, very intensive, very condense and conservatory that means more practice than theory. In two years time I would learn so much. I felt extremely excited, but I didn't have the money so I auditioned for the short intensive 4 -week program. I got accepted, I read the acceptance email like a hundred times, before I actually believed! I earned for this course myself. When I went there... every day felt like I'm in the right place doing what I am supposed to be doing. Every day, all the classes we had, the support and encouragement, every subject what it was about, the deeper meaning of life, the natural truths, pouring your feelings through songs, this felt like home to my heart.At the end of this course we could audition for a whole 2-years program. I took this chance, not having money, now or never. I was blown away when I found out that not only did I get accepted, but I was granted the highest talent-based scholarship available!Now I promised myself, with YOUR support, I will do whatever GOOD it takes to continue in the direction of my heart!I thank the Lord for all the challenging people that had taught me lessons and my supporters entering my life. Even with this campaign now, I couldn’t have made it happen alone without the help and support of my mum, my family, Mr Roger Del Pozo, Mr Joey Zangardi-Dixon, thanks for the amazing video & photos Abel Lawson, Denny Silva, Krzysztof Buratyński, Marek Walczyk, my amazing UK friends (Indiegogo team) Ich Loc, Jonathan Poon, Marium Zulfigar, Luke Scott, and all my offline and online friends-supporters. I truly love and appreciate every one of you. It means a world to me, just to hear words such as "keep up the good work", "keep moving forward", "well done" and more.I am who I am today because of you all. You brought the real Katarzyna back, filled with love and passion, ready to sing my heart out, give joy and inspire the world. THANK YOU!NOWWhen I was accepted for a month intensive course I didn't think I may later be accepted to the full program, I saved enough money to pay for the month fee, so now when I got accepted to the full program, I was extremely happy and I thought I will do whatever GOOD it takes to make it happen. The course starts on January 23rd 2017, so I need to start my visa process as soon as possible. I mailed International Offices at NYFA asking what's the latest date, I would need to send them documents that I have the money, bank statements, sponsors' assurance that they will invest in me etc, so the school can start the VISA procedure which takes 4-6 weeks, as you can see the timing is tight, I do believe, if this is God's will and He helped me a lot since, I believe that I will make it and your help here whether financial or just sharing, spreading the word, or best would be both :) is inevitable. I put the date 12th of December as the 24th December is the deadline to pay for my first semester and the transfer from my bank (Polish) to American one takes up to 14 days. Now it is required by the embassy to not only provide the finance for the fee but also costs of living which is calculated 15 600 $ per year and cover all the visa costs. This is why I thought to focus on crowdfunding for my first year now.in the 39 700 $ there is- a year fee- costs of living- costs of visa + flights No donation is too small, please share and feel free to contact me, blessings xoIf you can't donate, you still can help by sharing the video wherever you can, maybe your friends know someone who sponsors artists and would love to support me, I will appreciate any help. Thank you very much for your time, for that you read my whole story and that you spent so much time getting to know me. I sincerely appreciate it. Every good word, every word of support counts, thank you from the bottom of my heart. I wish you all best wishes and many blessings from above :))

story:
Marido Billequey est doctorante en création littéraire à l'Université de Sherbrooke, écrit un roman, publie des nouvelles.  Gabriel Lemieux-Maillé est musicien professionnel, impliqué dans plusieurs projets musicaux, très variés, allant du blues des années 20, à la musique électro.

Entre eux: une connivence. Rallier la littérature et la musique. Se baser sur la puissance du mot, du rythme, d'une mélodie. Faire résonner Sherbrooke, la nuit.

Chaque premier jeudi du mois, des auteurs.es établis, provenant de partout au Québec, sont invités.es à venir lire un texte inédit. Durant leur lecture, des musiciens fabriquent une trame sonore avec leurs claviers, leur trompette, leur batterie, leur guitare.

Plusieurs se sont prêtés au jeu ou viendront, sous peu, s'y compromettre : Stanley Péan, Michel Faubert, Maxime-Olivier Moutier, Frédric Gary Comeau, Michel Vézina, Fanie Demeule, Véronique Grenier, Patrick Nicol, Michel-Olivier Gasse, Virginie Beauregard, Marie-Christine Lemieux-Couture, etc.

Vraiment heureux que ces soirées suscitent autant l'intérêt et génèrent un aussi grand achalandage ! Les journaux, la radio, la télévision, les médias et réseaux sociaux en parlent beaucoup.

Or, faire venir ces artistes engendrent certains soucis financiers : le déplacement, l'hébergement, le repas, le cachet, entre autre. Car il faut le dire, la contribution volontaire est une valeur importante : la culture doit être accessible à tous et l'entrée est donc "libre". Mais le public est généreux et soucieux de fournir "le chapeau", ce qui démontre un réel désir d'encourager la tenue de ce type d'événement.

Des chandails sont en vente depuis quelques jours. À suivre...
