story:
For those who don't know, I'm a rap artist. I know, you'd never guess, but that's what makes it unique and special. My last giveaway project reached over a million people online and my current single (the first video below) has over a half a million streams online.

Here's some of my work, and there's really two sides to my artistry.

The A-side (Commercial / Entertainment):

 

 

======================================================== 

The B-side (Substance):

 

 

I have also started getting into film. Here's a documentary series I created about my first trip to my motherland. You can watch all the episodes on YouTube.

 

Often times people have tried to tell me I should stick to one style of rap, but my favorite artists were able to do different types of records and do them all well, so I've made it a point to trust my vision and put out both entertaining music and records with substance. You can see the rest of my work at NazoBravo.com/videos.

I've put in a lot of work and time to develop into the artist I am today. It's been a journey with several challenges and victories, but I have a long way to go and THIS IS WHERE I NEED YOUR HELP.

Up until this point, I've invested in my career with my own funds. This includes the independent label I've formed, Mighty Hye Records, because I stopped trying to be something a major record label might take interest in. 

I've also given a majority of my content away for free. This has been great in terms of getting more people aware of Nazo Bravo (which can be measured by my growth on Instagram / Twitter / Facebook), and lets me know that people are liking what we're doing. 

The problem is, making the content and promoting it hasn't been free for me, and that brings us to where we are today: 

I NEED YOUR HELP FOR THE NEXT PHASE OF MY CAREER. 

Specifically, the next phase means launching my next project. 

What Will Your Money Be Used For?

Your funding will help me get to the next level in my career.

My goal with this project is to compete with the big dogs in the industry in terms of quality of music, videos, and promotion. Each of these areas have associated costs, so here's a little more detail on each:

1. MUSIC - We have some of the music already recorded for the project and it already sounds incredible! If you've heard my single "Put It In Reverse" featuring E-40 (first video on this page), you can see that the quality is industry standard and can hold it's own against the top songs in the game. 

We need to get this new project to the same level of quality, which would include costs for studio time to record the remaining songs, musicians, producers, other artists, mixing, and mastering.

 

2. PROMOTION - This is such a crucial step. When it comes to marketing, I like to use the classic question: 

If a tree falls in the forest and no one hears it, does it make a sound?

The same goes for music (or any product really). I want to get the word out heavy about this project. I've put my blood, sweat, and tears into the project and believe it will speak to a lot of people, so I want to do it justice by making sure we get it in front of as many eyes and ears as humanly (and financially) possible.

The cost of promotion can take many forms, including social media, magazines / blogs, physical promotional products (ex: flyers), events (ex: release party, pop up shop), and radio promotion. 

Radio Promotion -  Radio is it's own beast. We did a radio run for my single "Put It In Reverse" featuring E-40, getting it in rotation on over 20 stations and it has gotten great feedback. There are inherent costs with radio promo that can get expensive, like traveling to multiple cities across the country to go into various stations, do interviews, and provide promotional materials like CDs, shirts, and flyers. 

What's crazy is I've competed with artists who have major record companies backing them (like Beyonce) for the same airtime, as there is only so much airtime available in a day.  What's even crazier is that we were able to get into rotation, which is rare for an independent artist, but it speaks to the music we're creating and let's me know that we just need to keep the machine going. With more funding, I believe we can make an even stronger impact at radio.

 

3. MUSIC VIDEOS - Music videos are also crucial, and can get expensive depending on what you're trying to do. The more money we raise, the better our videos will be.  I've always been a fan of incorporating a story into music videos and having it be more than just me rapping in front of the camera (see my HyePower video).

With your help the visuals for this project can come to life and be fire.

 

We've put together a wide range of rewards, so take a look on the right for the options!

One of them is the MIGHTY HYE Lion Black T-Shirt below. My last name "Aslanian" actually translates to "Lion" so that's how we came up with the logo, and it basically means believe in yourself and be proud of who you are.

 
 

This Kickstarter is the only place to pre-order my new project, and you'll get it TWO WEEKS before the general public does.

============================================================

The rewards get better as the tiers go up, and I wanted to have fun with this process because I appreciate you so much and I truly love what I do.

========================================================================================================================

Risks and challenges

Although there are risks in any business, there are also keys to success common in any business: having a good team, being driven & resourceful, planning & being organized, and knowing your audience & market. We have all of those elements in place.

On top of that, you need a great product. Fortunately, the feedback we've gotten on my current single "Put It In Reverse" has been so great, from DJs & radio to fans, that we know that we're onto something. Just check out my Twitter feed as an example of how many people are liking and sharing the song organically. These are real people, real fans, who genuinely like the music and have shared it on their own accord.

Also over time, by risking my own funds, I've been able to learn from the past, build my network, and also assemble a great team of people specializing in a wide range of areas crucial to success like marketing, publicity, music production, radio promotion, social media marketing, audio engineering, songwriting, video production, graphic design, web design, and more.

All of these factors gives us confidence in launching a successful project. The only concern at this point is the funding, so I want to close with this:

I APPRECIATE YOU. JOIN ME IN THIS JOURNEY AND LET'S TAKE IT TO THE MOON.

AYO!

story:
Introducing SPIRITS 

Hi, this is Zem Audu. I'm a saxophonist living in New York City and touring with the legendary Jamaican group The Skatalites. I've been playing saxophone for almost 20 years, and it's as important to me as eating food and drinking water.

This campaign is to create an epic album launch for my new album - SPIRITS. I created this music to bring together all the different influences that have inspired my sound, and it extends to the different cultural influences that have guided my life. I was born in Nigeria, raised in England, and launched into the international touring world with The Skatalites. Now I'm based in the heart of New York City. On this album you'll hear Caribbean grooves layered on top of Nigerian Afrobeat bass lines that support Contemporary Jazz sax melodies, and improvisation. This music invites you to feel the atmosphere of the city streets, the blazing sunshine of the Caribbean, and the soulfulness of the Nigerian culture.

There’s a new movement happening now; we don’t all fit into the same categories and stereotypes. People are free to embrace and express who they are. I love this! I didn't want to make a traditional jazz album, or even a traditional World or Afrobeat record. I wanted to make something that wasn't bound by those styles, but that was inspired and supported by them. I hope that by listening to this album you'll feel inspired to embrace all the influences in your life and express them with confidence. 

No expense was spared in the recording of this project. I had the privilege of working with guitar legend Mike Stern, and the bucket list experience of recording at Avatar Studios. Now it’s time to launch this to the world, and we want to launch it as far as it can possibly go! My goal is that this music reaches the ears of all those whose lives could be touched by it.

Your contribution will go towards publicity costs, distribution, CD pressing, and the album launch event.

 

Project Details

My financial Goal is to raise $12,500

Here's a breakdown of the project costs:

$4,500 first pressing of 1000 CDs and distribution of promotional copies to press.

$6,000 publicist costs to spread the word to all media and radio for maximum exposure.

$500 album launch concert production costs. This includes rehearsals, and pre-production costs.

$1,125 Indiegogo fees.

$375 merchandise production costs.

 

Contributor Perks

I’ve created unique perks ranging from pre-release albums, to saxophone lessons, and even to writing a customized song written specially for you. I value every contribution and these perks are a token of my appreciation.

100% of the contributions received will go towards the album release project. If I fall a little bit short, then I'll make it up with personal funds, and if I exceed expectations that money will go towards repressing the CDs, international publicity campaigns, and tour production expenses. 

I greatly value every contribution and the perks will be tokens of my appreciation. Your involvement will make this project worthwhile because music is made to be shared. I am so grateful for the global musical community, as well as for my family and friends all over the world, for their support and influence in my life and music. You are a big part of that influence. 

 

My FIRST Major Project

The word that has inspired every aspect of this project is quality. I'm so grateful to know and have worked with some of the world’s best musicians, who are professionals of the highest quality; and I'm happy that I could feature some of them on this album. We recorded at the legendary Avatar Studios and mastered the album with the veteran audio engineer Scott Hull who has mastered records for musicians like Sting, Madonna, and Herbie Hancock.

This is my first major production on this scale, and it’s such an exciting time. Landing the record deal with Origin Records is a huge milestone for this project, and for me personally. It’s a confirmation of the high quality of the music and recording. I can’t wait for you all to hear the album!

A project like this is a huge financial undertaking for an indie musician like me. The recording, mixing, and mastering process cost $16,000 that I paid out of pocket. Now your contributions will go towards the $12,500 required to get the music out there.

 

Why I need You

Finding a label can be so hard these days because of the diminishing returns in CD sales in this digital age. That is why I’m so grateful to be working with the indie label Origin Records. But even though I’m releasing with them, the majority of the funds still come from me, the artist. Many major labels will make an artist give up the rights to the music that they've worked so hard for. The indie label business model is different. It works like a partnership. I get access to their vast network of international distributors and I also keep full rights to the project, but the financial risk is on me. Besides the financial risks involved in a project of this scale, there are also the logistical challenges of pulling together resources and balancing schedules. Thankfully, I’ve had years of experience touring with The Skatalites where I learned the value of consistency, dedication, and preparation. For the past few years I’ve been the MC/front man for the band and I’ve also worked closely with the band's manager. Through this I gained great insights into planning tours and album releases. This has prepared me for the challenges of leading my own group and managing large scale projects like the SPIRITS album.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is focused on fundraising, but there are so many other ways that you can also contribute to the SPIRITS album release. Publicity is name of the game, so post, share, and comment on all SPIRITS campaign related posts #ZemAuduSpirits

We want this project to reach international heights, and you can contribute to that by liking the Facebook page Zem Audu Sax Music. International promoters look at the number of likes when determining which acts to book, so every like counts!

Another easy way to contribute is by using the Indiegogo share tool to post, tweet, or email this campaign to your friends. 

:)

I created this music to bring together all the different influences that have inspired my sound, and it extends to the different cultural influences that have guided my life. I was born in Nigeria, raised in England, and launched into the international touring world with The Skatalites. Now I'm based in the heart of New York City. On this album you'll hear Caribbean grooves layered on top of Nigerian Afrobeat bass lines that support Contemporary Jazz sax melodies, and improvisation. This music invites you to feel the atmosphere of the city streets, the blazing sunshine of the Caribbean, and the soulfulness of the Nigerian culture.There’s a new movement happening now; we don’t all fit into the same categories and stereotypes. People are free to embrace and express who they are. I love this! I didn't want to make a traditional jazz album, or even a traditional World or Afrobeat record. I wanted to make something that wasn't bound by those styles, but that was inspired and supported by them. I hope that by listening to this album you'll feel inspired to embrace all the influences in your life and express them with confidence. No expense was spared in the recording of this project. I had the privilege of working with guitar legend Mike Stern, and the bucket list experience of recording at Avatar Studios. Now it’s time to launch this to the world, and we want to launch it as far as it can possibly go! My goal is that this music reaches the ears of all those whose lives could be touched by it.Your contribution will go towards publicity costs, distribution, CD pressing, and the album launch event. Project DetailsMy financial Goal is to raise $12,500Here's a breakdown of the project costs:$4,500 first pressing of 1000 CDs and distribution of promotional copies to press.$6,000 publicist costs to spread the word to all media and radio for maximum exposure.$500 album launch concert production costs. This includes rehearsals, and pre-production costs.$1,125 Indiegogo fees.$375 merchandise production costs. Contributor PerksI’ve created unique perks ranging from pre-release albums, to saxophone lessons, and even to writing a customized song written specially for you. I value every contribution and these perks are a token of my appreciation.100% of the contributions received will go towards the album release project. If I fall a little bit short, then I'll make it up with personal funds, and if I exceed expectations that money will go towards repressing the CDs, international publicity campaigns, and tour production expenses. I greatly value every contribution and the perks will be tokens of my appreciation. Your involvement will make this project worthwhile because music is made to be shared. I am so grateful for the global musical community, as well as for my family and friends all over the world, for their support and influence in my life and music. You are a big part of that influence.  My FIRST Major ProjectThe word that has inspired every aspect of this project is quality. I'm so grateful to know and have worked with some of the world’s best musicians, who are professionals of the highest quality; and I'm happy that I could feature some of them on this album. We recorded at the legendary Avatar Studios and mastered the album with the veteran audio engineer Scott Hull who has mastered records for musicians like Sting, Madonna, and Herbie Hancock.This is my first major production on this scale, and it’s such an exciting time. Landing the record deal with Origin Records is a huge milestone for this project, and for me personally. It’s a confirmation of the high quality of the music and recording. I can’t wait for you all to hear the album!A project like this is a huge financial undertaking for an indie musician like me. The recording, mixing, and mastering process cost $16,000 that I paid out of pocket. Now your contributions will go towards the $12,500 required to get the music out there. Why I need YouFinding a label can be so hard these days because of the diminishing returns in CD sales in this digital age. That is why I’m so grateful to be working with the indie label Origin Records. But even though I’m releasing with them, the majority of the funds still come from me, the artist. Many major labels will make an artist give up the rights to the music that they've worked so hard for. The indie label business model is different. It works like a partnership. I get access to their vast network of international distributors and I also keep full rights to the project, but the financial risk is on me. Besides the financial risks involved in a project of this scale, there are also the logistical challenges of pulling together resources and balancing schedules. Thankfully, I’ve had years of experience touring with The Skatalites where I learned the value of consistency, dedication, and preparation. For the past few years I’ve been the MC/front man for the band and I’ve also worked closely with the band's manager. Through this I gained great insights into planning tours and album releases. This has prepared me for the challenges of leading my own group and managing large scale projects like the SPIRITS album. Other Ways You Can HelpThis campaign is focused on fundraising, but there are so many other ways that you can also contribute to the SPIRITS album release. Publicity is name of the game, so post, share, and comment on all SPIRITS campaign related posts #ZemAuduSpiritsWe want this project to reach international heights, and you can contribute to that by liking the Facebook page Zem Audu Sax Music. International promoters look at the number of likes when determining which acts to book, so every like counts!Another easy way to contribute is by using the Indiegogo share tool to post, tweet, or email this campaign to your friends. :)

story:
Big Debut

This is an exciting beginning for us!  Our first album together as a duo. Finding partnership on all levels as we share our deepest and most sacred gifts, with you, the world.

We have both individually lived a life of devotion and prayer, with kirtan and Bhakti Yoga being a strong pillar in our practice.  In our meeting we rejoiced at the perfection of this, and ever since we have been planning our big leap into that endeavor.

This album is the first of many. When we record music, we do so with the knowledge that magic created within a sacred container can be transmitted through the digital imprint to the listener.  We undertake this with great love and prayers for all who hear it to be opened to a deeper place within their hearts. This is the highest goal for us.
 

Nuts and Bolts

Our $8k goal will service all the different needs of the album.

  • Recording studio
  • Mixing and mastering
  • Printing and press
  • Album art design
  • Hiring musicians

If we go beyond our goal extra funds will support an album release tour!

Check out the perks available including getting in on the first copies of the album, and more!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share!  Besides making a donation for at least the price of your daily cup of coffee, put it out to as many people as possible.  Indiegogo has great sharing tools for this.  With your help there is no way we can't reach our goal!

Also, stay tuned for details on our fundraising concert, which will take place towards the end of the campaign.  See you there!

story:
Lil' Red & The Rooster

Jennifer Milligan & Pascal Fouquet

AMERICAN              FRENCH

Contagious charm .... serious blues.

"I met Pascal Fouquet in 2010 at Le Caveau de la Huchette, a swing dance & live music club in Paris, France. After a serendipitous French Comedy of Errors, we began our life and music together. We've toured festivals and venues from India to Buddy Guy's Legends in Chicago. We recorded our first CD in our apartment in Bernay, France, with Pascal sitting on the toilet with his guitar and me singing in the closet. Now, we're finally ready to step into a real Chicago Blues studio! We've put together a team of international award winning artists and can't wait to get the boogie flowing!" Deep breath and exhale ...  "BUT... stepping up to this level has big expenses: studio, producer, mix & mastering, talent, design, pressing, promotion, airfare, and accommodations. I'm far from rich and could use some grassroots help. I'm putting everything I've saved and will make this year into this gift for my Prime Rooster. If you'd like to be a partner on this journey here's how you can help ..." Lil' Red

How You Can Help

You can buy our CD in advance or one of our other perks. You can donate $. You can share our campaign with your friends who love to support music and arts. You can send positive vibes into the universe. You can book us in your venue or for your festival or private event. You can eat a slice of cake for Lil' Red because they just don't have good ol' American cake in France! Anyway you can support will be greatly appreciated.

Scroll down to learn more  ...

OUR MUSIC

blues ... boogie ... jump ... rag ... funk ... R&B ... Texas ... New Orleans ... Delta ... Chicago ...

"Touching and refreshing with a bit of humor, their originals bring back the old blues and rhythm and blues."

We love blues and rhythm & blues music of 1920's through the early 60's. The swing rhythms and layered lyrics feel good as they walk a balance between emotion and musical wit. Our originals are inspired from this rich era of music, that we're bringing forward with text relevant to contemporary life.

"They’re warm and inviting and their music is inspired and innovative. Blues with a spirit full of hope and joy may inspire you to get up and boogie!"

THE JOYRIDE STUDIO

The Grammy Award winning studio of Blaise Barton ... http://www.joyride-studio.com/

   

THE TEAM

DAVE SPECTER * PRODUCER

Blues guitarist, bandleader and producer Dave Specter has earned an international reputation as one of the premier talents on the Chicago blues scene. Specter has toured extensively throughout the U.S. and Europe behind such blues greats as Son Seals, The Legendary Blues Band, Hubert Sumlin, Sam Lay and Steve Freund. Specter has also performed and recorded with such blues and jazz artists as Buddy Guy, Junior Wells, Otis Rush, Jimmy Rogers, Robert Jr. Lockwood, Jimmy Johnson, Jack McDuff,  Johnny Adams, Snooky Pryor, Kim Wilson, Tad Robinson, John Primer, Johnny Littlejohn, B.B. Odom, Mighty Joe Young, Valerie Wellington, Magic Slim, Lonnie Brooks, Willie Kent, Ronnie Earl, Eric Alexander, Otis Clay, Floyd McDaniel, Pinetop Perkins and Sunnyland Slim.

BLAISE BARTON * ENGINEER * MIX & MASTERING

Well ... he's so busy doing what he does that he doesn't have time to write a bio. Lol! What I do know is he's a multi Grammy award winner for his extraordinary work in the Blues. His work preserves a natural sound needed in Blues while still being radio playable. If you know anything about recording, this ability comes from years of experience listening. Most importantly, he's a real nice guy and his studio feels homey.

 

THE COMBO

          

JENNIFER "LIL' RED" MILLIGAN * VOCALS * WASHBOARD

“ … diva voice that walks voluptuously from Bessie Smith to Janis Joplin crossing without a hitch tonalities and eras always sounding the most sincere and accurate possible.” Fred Delforge, Zic-a-Zic

A veteran of the stage, from Westerville, Ohio, this multi-talented singer/songwriter has touched the hearts of hundreds of thousands internationally on stage, screen and recording. Her magnetic presence, exuberant energy and genuine smile bring a warm authentic charm to the blues scene. With her bed as a stage and hairbrush for microphone, she started singing at the age of 6 accompanied by her motherʼs 45s on her Mickey Mouse turntable. By the age of 11 her bed was replaced by a stage and by 22 she was touring the country as the lead in the National tour of Hair. In her professional career she has performed in and or choreographed more productions than years she has lived. With every note she wishes to thank Ella, Etta, & Dinah with every word Shakespeare & Tom Waits and with every rhythm T-Bone & Luigi.

“… before Jennifer Milligan can finish her entrance onto the stage, the audience immediately falls under the spell of this extremely charismatic singer!”Alain Hoit, Zic-a-Zic Magazine

PASCAL "THE ROOSTER" FOUQUET * GUITAR * BARITONE GUITAR

“… the exceptionally graceful and virtuoso guitar of Pascal Fouquet takes you into a fourth
dimension… ” Fred Delforge, Zicazic

This blues man got his start playing classical guitar at the age of 11 on a farm in Normandy, France. Five years later when BB Kingʼs “Blues Is King” reached his ears, his focus changed to Blues, from there he became one of the most admired Blues guitarists in France. This extraordinary soloist integrates the Blues of the 40’s & 50’s with contemporary blues to create his own unique sound and style. In his 40+ year career, he has won several awards for best soloist. He’s shared the stage with many recognized Blues artists including Diunna Greenleaf, Sax Gordon, Sean Costello, Alex Schultz, Kid Ramos, Jimmy Morello, Andy J. Forest, Michael “Hawkeye” Herman, Rob Rio, Kenny “Blues Boss” Wayne, Candye Kane, Fernando Jones, Ricky Nye, Sean Carney, Steve Clayton, Drew Davies and Shaun Booker. He tours regularly with Lil’ Red & The Rooster, Mike Sanchez & Steve Clayton. He remains ever true to his favorite guitar masters, T-Bone Walker, Tiny Grimes, & Charlie Christian.

“… master guitarist.” Blues Magazine  “…. a composer of real talent.” Soul Bag Magazine

RICKY NYE * KEYS

Blues, boogie woogie and classic New Orleans jazz and R&B all come flying from the fingers of Cincinnati, OH pianist and vocalist RICKY NYE. The driving force behind the annual BLUES & BOOGIE PIANO SUMMIT held in Greater Cincinnati since 1999, Ricky has been inducted into the Boogie Woogie Hall Of Fame, voted “Blues Artist Of The Year 2013” in Cincinnati’s CEA Awards, and "Best Local Musician" by CityBeat Magazine's "Best Of Cincinnati 2013" reader's poll.

ABDELL B BOP * UPRIGHT BASS

Abdell Bouyousfi has been an icon of the French blues, roots, rock and punk scenes for more than 25 years, he's planted himself firmly as the on-call bass player for American rhythm and blues artists on tour throughout Western Europe: Lynwood Slim, Mitch Woods, Gerry Hundt, Ponty Bone, Big George Brock, Super Chikan, R.J Mischo, Ron Hacker, Dave Herrero, Tom Holland, Sean Carney, Gene Taylor (Fabulous Thunderbirds / The Blasters), Keith Dunn, Omar Coleman, Ray Schinnery, Doug Jay, Ricky Nye, Ernie Southern, Jimmy Adler, Cash Box Kings, Joel Paterson, Oscar Wilson, Dave Gross, CW Ayon, David Maxwell (Freddie King), Rod Piazza, Sean Costello, just to name a few.

DENIS AGENET * DRUMS * FROTTOIR

“Denis Agenet is a unique drummer in his sense of accompaniment. He supports, intervenes, demands and suggests … always in an opportune manner. His dynamism and talent have seduced many international artists … Denis is a regular at major Blues events … and we understand why! ”
Michel Rolland, Director & Programmer Cognac Blues Passion

Several tours in the USA accompanying local artists, enabled him to play with: Josh Miller, Karl W. Davis, Jim McKaba (Jimmy Rogers, Crown Prince Waterford…), Barrelhouse Chuck (Otis Rush, Buddy Guy…), Philippe Ménard, Dr Burt, Mr Bo Weavil, Mac Arnold (Muddy Waters, John Lee Hooker…), Jimmy Burns, CW Ayon, Dave Gross, Jonn Del Toro Richardson…

SHAUN BOOKER *VOCALS

"I think if you have it, it is not arrogant to be confident about it.  I want all women especially to feel like they are IT."  

International singer/songwriter based in Columbus, Ohio. True to her words, Shaun's primary mission is to lift up her sisters in the crowd by making them feel powerful within themselves as evidenced by her brilliant cover of the old song, 'Wild Women Don't Get the Blues.' It is easy to gauge the ladies' approval at that point as they react in a unified show of aerial fist pumps and cheers.

 

YEA I KNOW ...

I'm a white woman singing the blues. I wrestle with this fact every day. I question. I listen. I've dedicated myself to bringing awareness to this amazing music born from a rich and beautiful culture. It has the power to heal. It heals me every time I open my mouth to sing.  Music is exactly the place to get human and find common ground.

"I'm gonna love the hell right outta you!" Father Joseph

The Blues is healing!

story:
In the face of increasingly loud calls to divide us, music brings us closer together. It reveals the contours of human experience and remains the universal language. We communicate with and understand people from wildly different backgrounds, cultures, and circumstances by singing and dancing to the rhythm, allowing us to journey toward dialogue and common understanding. 

As a Louisiana transplant to the City of Memphis, I am proof that love and acceptance is the formula for opening hearts. This city has embraced me and my culture, making me feel free to express myself, to carve my own path within its rich history and dynamic present. This album is a testament to my experience of being warmly welcomed into a new home, drawing strength from and taking refuge in the songs and stories of Memphis. We hope these songs might serve as bridges to help people reach each other, to better hear one another, and to reach within themselves.

Each and every one of your generous contributions will help us with the following expenses:

  • Recording, mixing, and mastering
  • Cutting vinyl lacquer
  • Printing in CD and vinyl format plus advanced digital access 
  • Professional, high quality music videos    
  • New merch (t-shirts, posters, stickers, and other surprises!)                                                                  
  • Web development
  • Digital aggregator hosting                                                              
  • Art Direction for website, CD, vinyl packaging, T-shirts, and posters by Josh Breeden 
  • Studio compensation for the Lovers and special guests 
  • Shipping costs, so we can send your orders out ASAP

Even if you are unable to contribute, you can still help by spreading the word. Share this page on social media, and tell everybody you possibly can!

Love lives where you are and where we are, 

Marcella

story:
A set still by Zachary Lanoue

You will help bring MOVE ME, a new EP featuring 5 original tracks written, performed, and co-produced by Roth to the world. The EP also features performances by artists Lilah Larson, Ezra Miller, and Josh Aubin of the band Sons of an Illustrious Father; Nick Shopa, of Brooklyn-based Papertwin; and Mara Carlyle, London-based singer, songwriter, and instrumentalist. 

 

A set still by Liv Prior Colliander

Here is a bit about the album, my history and campaign below! 

A set still by Zachary Lanoue Font and Layout by Trevor Baum

MOVE ME is a mix of meditative mantras mixed with high energy drums and synth pop. Roth exhibits full command of her rich voice, moving gracefully between low, subtle melodies to belted high notes. Textured vocal harmonies and canons paired with musical saw, whistles, and playful guitar riffs make each catchy track on MOVE ME deeply absorbing and memorable. The sound is refreshingly clear. 

Set Still by Jackson McCoy

"Recording with other stylistically unique artists took each track to a whole other level. The collaboration added fresh dimensions to the EP. I'm so proud of it. I can't stop listening to it." says Roth. 

Set Still by Liv Prior Colliander

The synth-pop vibe of the EP is a departure from Roth's earlier blues/folk sound. "Before I started writing the tracks, I had these tunes in my head that were very melodic and hook-y," says Roth. "At the time, I also picked up drumming again, and those melodies started taking on a whole new energy and rhythm in my imagination. They were always pulsing through my mind, so by the time I put down the demos, they just burst out, almost spontaneously." 

“Lexie's songwriting skills have reached new heights,” says Alex Salzman, who co-produced the EP. “The tasty addition of electronic elements combined with hypnotic electric guitars, a powerful rhythm section and inspiring vocal performances have delivered her finest and most interesting work yet.”

Screen Still by Aaron Kovalchik / Font by Trevor Baum

The EP is Roth’s first release since her 2012 full length eponymous album, which received critical acclaim.  The song ‘Call You My Hon’ from that album was featured in the award-winning film “Maria My Love,” produced and directed by Jasmine McGlade.

Roth took the album on a 25-city US tour with the band Sons of an Illustrious father in 2013. 

In 2014 she recorded a cover of the song ‘Vaya Con Dios’ for the Les Paul tribute album “Thank You Les”, which also featured Keith Richards, Jose Feliciano, Steve Miller, Slash, Billy Gibbons (ZZ Top), Eddie Brigati Jr. (The Young Rascals) among other music legends. 

Raised between Westchester, New York and Martha’s Vineyard, Massachusetts, Roth grew up surrounded by music giants. Her father, virtuosic guitarist Arlen Roth, performed and recorded with the best artists of his generation, including Bob Dylan, Danny Gatton, John Entwistle, John Prine, James Taylor, Simon and Garfunkle, Ry Cooder, David Lindley, Sonny Landreth, Levon Helm, Bill Kirchen, The Bee-Gees. Duane Eddy, Steve Morse, Albert Lee and Phoebe Snow. As a teen, Lexie recorded three tracks on Arlen’s album, “Toolin' Around Woodstock”, including the song “Unchained Melody” with Levon and Amy Helm.

This campaign is of extreme importance to me and getting to reach my goal will assure my ability to finish each aspect of this 5 video, 5 song project. 

Each moving piece of the puzzle is very costly, which is why I am asking for your generosity.   I am seeking funding to print albums on cd and vinyl. 

For my music videos, artists need to be paid, directors, producers, production managers, grip, lighting, gaffers, catering, locations costs, camera equipment, this campaign will also fund my tour across the country.  Since I am not on a label, I have no booking or tour support, this is where you come in.  :)

You are making a huge difference in your contributions small and large.  You are so valuable to bring this content forward and into the world.  These stories are powerful ones to share.   This is a major risk I’ve chosen to take and I am instilling a lot of trust and love into my amazing community. 

 

If you do not have funds to help, there are more ways to share this!  Use Indiegogo’s sharing tools and help get the word out!

 

Thank you!!!!

 

<3 Lexie
story_txt: A set still by Zachary LanoueYou will help bring MOVE ME, a new EP featuring 5 original tracks written, performed, and co-produced by Roth to the world. The EP also features performances by artists Lilah Larson, Ezra Miller, and Josh Aubin of the band Sons of an Illustrious Father; Nick Shopa, of Brooklyn-based Papertwin; and Mara Carlyle, London-based singer, songwriter, and instrumentalist.  A set still by Liv Prior CollianderHere is a bit about the album, my history and campaign below! A set still by Zachary Lanoue Font and Layout by Trevor BaumMOVE ME is a mix of meditative mantras mixed with high energy drums and synth pop. Roth exhibits full command of her rich voice, moving gracefully between low, subtle melodies to belted high notes. Textured vocal harmonies and canons paired with musical saw, whistles, and playful guitar riffs make each catchy track on MOVE ME deeply absorbing and memorable. The sound is refreshingly clear. Set Still by Jackson McCoy"Recording with other stylistically unique artists took each track to a whole other level. The collaboration added fresh dimensions to the EP. I'm so proud of it. story:
Who is Kurt Riley?

Kurt Riley is an independent pop musician, songwriter, and performer. Influenced by legends including Bo Diddley, The Killers, Queen, T.Rex, and The Rolling Stones, Riley writes and performs his own material, in stark contrast to the manufactured pop music saturating our world today. He has been composing and performing for 15 years, always with one goal in mind - to make music as timeless and satisfying as the classic songs he grew up with.

His first studio album, Brighthead, was recorded with Beyoncé producer BOOTS. Subsequently, his sci-fi concept album Kismet was released to great acclaim by radio stations, blogs, and newspapers in New York, where he resides. The Cornell Daily Sun called Kismet  "an intergalactic fantasia...(gazing) both at the history of rock ‘n’ roll and at a dream of a more moral existence...optimistic about the potential of compassion and, most of all, about the future of music itself."

Following an epic live performance of Kismet at Cornell University, Kurt Riley was named one of the top regional live acts of 2016 by The Ithaca Journal. In January 2017, Riley was awarded a cash grant from the Community Arts Partnership of Tompkins County, New York, to help pay for the recording of Tabula Rasa.

Tabula Rasa is a collection of 10 incredible songs, in diverse styles. From pop balladry to blazing rock and roll and deeply personal numbers, it will show a breadth and a depth from Kurt Riley that has not been witnessed before. The album is slated to be released in Spring 2017.

What We Need to Record Tabula Rasa

  • $2,100.
    • $1,500 for mixing the 10 songs,
    • and $600 to master them for listening on your smartphone, Spotify, and iTunes.
  • The recording process itself has already been paid for, with a grant provided by The Community Arts Partnership of Tompkins County, New York! That takes care of a large part of the cost.
  • If the $2,100 goal is not met, alternative methods of paying for the remaining costs will be sought out.

Why is this important?

Pop music has never been in such a precarious place since the inception of the form. Pete Townshend once stated that "pop music is art, and it should remain art" - and this is an ethic Kurt Riley has held close to his heart. The recording industry, desperate to keep its head above water since the advent of filesharing, has produced a slew of lowest common denominator pop stars - choreographed lipsyncers who have their songs written by professional hitmakers. This has led to a discernible decline in the quality and the diversity of pop music. Kurt Riley has only one goal in mind - to play a part in returning music to the heights seen during the halcyon days of the 20th Century. Music was incredible once - why can't it be again?

What are the risks?

The $2,100 is the absolute minimum required to complete Tabula Rasa. If that amount isn't raised, it is entirely possible that the album may not be recorded.

Can't donate? Here's how you can help in another way!

Times are tight, and we understand if you cannot contribute monetarily. However, there are other ways you can help!

  • Share this page and the crowdfunding video on social media!
  • Tell your friends about Kurt Riley's music, and ask them to check it out on Spotify, Apple Music, Pandora, or YouTube!

story:
What's Up?

As an Outlaw Country/Americana duo we are dedicated to creating a true representation of traditional country music infused with harrowing rock. We recently relocated to Nashville, TN from Los Angeles, CA and we have never been more excited to take Crimson Calamity to the next level. This new EP will be the next chapter and we want you to be a part of it. We know that we can make this campaign a huge success with your collaboration and as a thank you for your generosity we have curated some awesome perks to say thank you! Check out the campaign details below:

What We Need & What YOU Get

Makin' music the ole fashioned way ain't cheap!

As independent musicians, the cost of making and releasing a quality record can seem insurmountable without the support of a record label. There are many aspects that go into the record making process such as: Studio time, rehearsals, musicians, an engineer, a producer, mixing, mastering and more. To create the EP it will cost us $10K which is what we set our goal at. However, to manufacture and ensure that this little baby gets a proper birthday we must raise an additional $10K for distribution, marketing, promotion and a music video. That's $20K total! We told ya it ain't cheap! We will be over the moon to meet and surpass our goal with your help.

That's why we carefully curated some really fun perks and rewards to show our gratitude for your support. Everyone who donates will receive a digital copy of our record one week before it's released to the world! We have VIP tickets, Skype sessions, original songs, drawings, house concerts and more!

Sharing Is Caring!

Unable to financially contribute at this time but want to know how you can help? Sharing with friends and family via social media can be just as valuable! For those who contribute by sharing we even have some drawings planned for a chance to win some Crimson Calamity merch!

1 - Share the campaign link on Facebook.

2 - Share the campaign video on Facebook.

3 - Retweet the campaign on Twitter. Retweet this tweet.

story:
Short Summary

I know you probably have a ton of other things to do, so first of all, thank you for being here! I am Sgt Remo, a Mexican-American roots reggae singer whose music is focused on messages about self-empowerment and the uplifting of people. I believe and trust in the unity of all people regardless of skin color or beliefs. In a time of rampant division, it is my goal to unite people through music and focus on our similarities instead of highlighting our differences.

This campaign is intended to raise funds for the album 'Oh Jah' which has been in the works for about 10 years. I can say it is a remarkable musical project created with passion and extreme attention to detail. Because of this, we are releasing this on Vinyl (45 rpm).

By contributing to this project you are making a change. You are empowering us to reach further through music and positively influencing the outcome of our futures.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this campaign is to raise $3500.

The funds are intended to pay for the manufacturing of the album (the album will only be printed on 12" vinyl).

By contributing you will receive special perks for your support ranging from music downloads, stickers, previous Sgt Remo albums, and even personal performances in your home (read details).

Even if we do not reach our goal of $3500 we are still releasing this album so rest assured your contribution will be used towards the album.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by contributing financially you can still help quite a bit by simply spreading the word! Share the campaign with your friends and help us reach a bigger audience. Thank you!

story:
The Concept

My name is Adan Robledo. I'm a 21 year old musician from Tucson, Arizona and my purpose is to bring people together with music. Currently, I'm working on an instrumental album that I started writing roughly a year ago in an attempt to cope with the many hardships life had presented to me. This album is called 'The Human Experience' and tells the story of my journey so far. Each song is being written to have it's own theme, musical style, and 'feel'. I aim to create a song for everyone on this album. Some songs will be a disgustingly heavy, and some will be happy while others pull influence from jazz and classical styles. The point is diversity. I want as many people as possible to be able to come together and speak the universal language of music.

What I Need & What You Get

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping pay for;

  • Studio Time - For professional quality and production.
  • Merchandise - Physical CD's, cost for releasing music on digital platforms
  • Guest Appearances - If I can raise enough, the goal is to have a couple guest vocalists and guitarists!
  • Marketing
  • And More

All money earned will be used for the production of the album regardless if the goal is met or not, so anything helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's okay. There are other ways to help!

  • Follow me on social media
  • Share this campaign 
  • Subscribe to my YouTube page
  • Keep an eye out!

story:
Why Cipher?

I'm Living Strong So I can get THIS MUSIC OUT! (Ignite this vision with me!)

The lyrical poetry of Rhythmic Alchemy that resurrects the sounds of Nina Simone, Maya Angelou, Fela!

And all of the GREATS before and beyond

Who Glorified their God Essence and Inspired me to Love my own!

When you Contribute to the Rhythmic Alchemy Arts Cipher, You help to create a Magnificent Vibration of Healing for your SELF…FOR Everyone! 

You See, Séba's Darkness Cipher Ignites the Gifted Spirit, Heart and Mind of 

Young People, Families and Communities All over the World!

An Ancient, Indigenous Science of Soul Crafted Artistry IS RHYTHMIC ALCHEMY (RA)!

RA’s Soul Stimulating Dynamism Inspires everyone, everywhere, in every environment...to See That:

Trauma is Not your Identity

You are an infinite being!

Trauma in family…trauma in society…

Must be called out to be cleaned!

Trauma is not a secret to be buried within…

Trauma must be revealed for healing to begin!

Rhythmic alchemy is a symbolic fire ritual of Sounds and movements

For I&I Self-Cultivation: Heart, Spirit and Mind Discipline

A Luminous Light immersing you in Music, Dance and Affirmation

Igniting your HIGHEST VIBRATION

That, when elevated, ACTUALIZES your gifts and vision!

  • 1. CONTRIBUTE TO THE CREATION OF “GANJÚ, THE OPENING OF SPIRIT: A MUSICAL COMPILATION OF SOUL ROCKIN’, SPINE UNDULATING, CHAKRA AWAKENING DIASPORIC RHYTHMS
  • 2. CONTRIBUTE TO RASÉ’s YOUTH TRAINING PROGRAM: 12 TEACHINGS ARTISTS TEACHING THE RHYTHMIC ALCHEMY BLUEPRINT TO 40 STUDENTS: FORMULATED MOVEMENTS, MEDITATION & MANTRA FOR TRANSCENDING SUFFERING & ACTUALIZING THEIR GREATNESS as Poets, Scientists, Engineers, Lyricists, Educators, Healers…
  • 3. CONTRIBUTE TO RASÉ’s “LEAP INTO YOUR WINGS” PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT: ILLUSTRIOUS GRAPHIC DESIGNING OF RASÉ’s SELF-ESTEEM IGNITING AND OPTIMISM VISUALIZING TEE-SHIRTS, BAGS AND PORTRAITS!

When you Contribute to the Production of Séba’s Cipher, you give Rasé Dynamo Arts the fuel to make the Cipher Really happen!  Our teaching artists will have the fuel to spend that vital time with the youth we’ve brought under our wings to teach them the intricate techniques and styles of Séba’s Rhythmic Alchemy Blueprint: the sequences of meditation, yoga, dance choreographies and musical compositions that bring awareness to suffering as well as the practices that empower OUR COLLECTIVE ABILITY to remediate suffering within OUR LIVES and the lives of our interconnected Village. 

What’s really STELLAR and perhaps very unique about Séba’s Cipher is that it is magnificently interactive!  Every participant who attends the Cipher will be immersed in the artistic infusion of Rhythmic Alchemy!  Every participant will have the opportunity to partake in the esteem lifting affirmations, the gift igniting musical storytelling, the imagination stimulating visual arts and dances that will be co-facilitated by the Stellar youth Rasé artists have trained! 

Séba's Darkness Cipher is the Creation of A Sacred Space, A Shrine, A Community for Ritual that gives voice to those who have been shut down and Silenced by the catastrophic reality of the cancer of Suffering that plagues many lives in the form of insomnia, depression, anxiety, violence, isolation, fear, dysfunctional relationships.

Within the healing walls and purifying sea  of Séba's Cipher, we emphasize, through our art the ways in which we Call out suffering so that we can burn it out!  Call out suffering so that the intuitive ways in which we art to live our lives: courageously, making decisions that reflect Self-love and peace, health, wellness, happiness!--radiates luminously throughout every aspect of our lives—unlocking the gifts of all our treasure!

It is RASÉ's mission to show our Youth and to share with all who are willing that which has transformed my life from being a prisoner to Suffering...to embrace revolutionary healing so that we may realize that it is absolutely vital that we not die before we each give life to our light!  Give light to those GIFTS that make your Souls Leap into the Unknown and return with  Stories that Create Legacies for Generations to Come!  For, our gifts are the essence of life, and like nutrients, our happiness and the Fruition of our gifts are Quintessential to this Existence and to all that live beyond...in the luminous Darkness, i.e. "the unknown." 

So, I invite you to contribute to the flourishing vision of Rasé Dynamo Arts!  And, I wholeheartedly thank you for your affirming contribution!  The very act of your effort catalyzes a Soul lifting and  Self-actualizing vibration that sparks genius and healing in so many Universal aspects of Life!  

Take one of my hats, Please!

I wonder how many persons know how many different types of hats an entrepreneur has to wear in order to make her dreams come true!  Fitting into so many different hats can become very exhausting and depleting.  Even though I am living my dreams...composing and producing music, creating different dance choreographies, drawing and designing Artwork for products (i.e. t-shirts, bags, etc), performing vital administrative functions (campaign development, promotion, sponsorship, grant writing)...these are a lot of hats because I also have to work in order to survive in NYC! (smile)
 
 I am so grateful that I have connected to my purpose...but, truth be told, doing so much by my lonesome can create sentiments of suffering because it sometimes feels like so many people do not care.  And, to simply say a word about Rasé's efforts that gives something so dynamite and so Vital to our collective experience, is asking too much.  So, the indifference towards something that is not superficial, to something that we healing artists pour our Souls into everyday, I am unafraid to say, can be quite harsh. 
 
So, I am asking you to please share one of my hats with me: contribute any amount you can to the Cipher, spread the world on your social media platforms, purchase a cipher keepsake at leapintoyourwings.com, invite Rasé to your next event.  Experience Us!  
 

A Funny Hat Story

I'd never considered myself to be someone who can draw.  But I had to delve into this craft because I could not afford to commission an artist/graphic designer to design the images for my T-shirt ideas.  But, Eureka!  I can draw?  I can draw!  And, after endless YouTube videos, articles, and days of barely sleeping, I am now proficient in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop!  But, my!  Has the process been time consuming!  Truthfully speaking, I am not superwoman (wink).  And I strive to honor the morals of the Cipher which is to live a balanced life wherein I do not bask in the “glory” of doing it all while I silently treat myself poorly-- accepting a life of sleep deprivation and other poor Self-loving behaviors simply because I aspire to do something great for the betterment of our Lives!  Thus, I openly embrace your support so that I can effectively usher the Darkness Cipher into its truest reflection of healing.

Your Contribution covers very essential aspects of the Cipher’s Development & Production:

  1. Cipher Products & T-shirt Production: ordering wholesale shirts, screen printing, packaging & shipping of t-shirts worldwide (and a professional graphic designer to design over 13 visual ideas for t-shirts, books, album cover and accessories).  Paying for official U.S. Copyrighting services of art designs & album and book manuscripts
  2. Where will the Cipher be held? : I’m a New Yorker.  That says it all.  Rehearsal and Production venues are snazzy and pricey.  And, to stay true to the aesthetic of the Cipher, it will be held in a space that reflects the love for my work and the love for the people in attendance (picture a museum…the main gallery of the Brooklyn Museum.  Picture A venue with a complete system: sound and lighting, stage, concessions, bar and vending options…) 
  3. What are the Contents of the Cipher?: As An artistic infusion of musical storytelling, live thematic drawing and dance, the Cipher’s blueprint requires: Professionally trained Musicians (a live band) for intensive rehearsals with NYC youth who will receive training from professionally trained Dancers, Lyricists, Poets and Visual Artists versed in the Cipher’s blueprint.  I don’t believe in the narrative of starving artists…collaborating with artists from the Nuyorican Poet’s Café, Brooklyn Arts Council, etc…who function as quintessential Cipher pillars—facilitators, co-teachers, website developers…requires respectable compensation for their services (Remember, Séba needs her entrepreneur’s hats to abate from 100 to 50 J )
  4. Cipher Album & Book: Studio Recording sessions, Mixing, Mastering & Production of CDs (ancient but necessary)…editing and printing of Cipher Book
  5. Documenting the Cipher: Photography and Videography Services for you to capture this epic experience
  6. The Cipher’s Artistic Presence: Custom made outfits and artist props for Cipher performers: dancers, musicians, singers, poets and fine artists
  7. Cipher Support System: in addition to weekend rentals of a rehearsal space, middle and high school youth of NYC Youth participants need healthy snacks and assistance with transportation expenses and performance scholarships
  8. Cipher Promotion & Continuity: compensation for Cipher manager, cipher booking agent, cipher facilitators and stagehands

CiPheR PERKs

For the Duration of the campaign, I will offer a series of 13 perks! 

Here are a few:

A Personalized—handwritten—Cipher Haiku mailed directly to You

 Visualize Greatness T-shirts for men and women

Leap into Your Wings T-shirts for men and women

2 Special Cipher Combo packs

And…much more!

Something the Earth Can Feel: Séba’s Darkness Cipher & YOU

Séba’s Darkness Cipher is much more than a musical therapy session that brings the Cancers of joylessness, violent traumas and the fear of living the rest of one’s life with the singe of un-fulfillment, buried and fearfully ignored by so many, to the forefront.  The Cipher’s anthropologically cultivated and socially relevant artistry relaxes you like Reiki; grounds you with balance and flexibility like yoga, laughs with you with the charismatic humor of an old friendship and encapsulates you in the arms of a most loving embrace. 

For people who have experienced aspects of Séba’s Cipher over the years, they have affirmed a profusely purifying wave of catharsis that flows through the at times, deeply depressed, anxious and stressed-out sentiments they experience in certain aspects of their lives and relationships.  They notice that they feel energized to really listen to the insomnia that cradles them with its defeating presence of helplessness.  The Energy of the Spirited Cipher inspires them to really stop procrastinating and to be more proactive about the insecurity they’ve been battling from the weight problems they’ve had since childhood.  And, last but certainly not least, they’ve asserted that Séba’s Immersing Cipher Sparks their imagination to really trust in themselves and ignite the aspirations they’ve been putting off because they are afraid of their own remarkable excellence and have succumbed to the condescending ideals/theories of other people. 

Séba’s Cipher—a high dose of Rhythmic Alchemy is Something the Earth Can Feel!  The simple art/act of people getting together to heal one another (even if an individual is not personally suffering) sends a vibration deep into the Core of the Earth—the core of our collective Soul—our Ancestors, our lives and life to come.  This collective Vibration resonates as joy, love and light in every atom and realm of our collective and interconnected existence.  Séba’s Darkness Cipher exists to reflect the wisdom that we are all truly phenomenal…and every day, we ought to remember and breathe life into the reality of our esteem…our greatness despite the myriad atrocities of life. 

WHAT IFS?

I’ve been cultivating this Cipher for a long time.  Nothing—fear, challenges—not even suffering stops me.  The first Cipher production at MOCADA (Museum of Contemporary African Diasporan Arts) in 2015…though it did not generate a profit, it launched “The Spark that Ignites Being, Test of the Heart”, a literary masterpiece for Self-Development, Gift Ignition and Actualization!  This book is as alive today as the day it was published.  “Drawbacks” teach, they don’t distract me.  So, there are no what ifs with this campaign…because I will continue strategy, development, training and production after these stellar Cipher supporting 42 days.  Moreover, as an education and optimal wellness life coach, I have worked with people from a number of diverse backgrounds and disciplines.  My challenges and personal “setbacks” drive me.  They fuel me with even greater determination to give a voice to suffering—to the students who confided in me about being molested, bullied, abandoned…to the elders who have worked diligently their entire lives who are now crippled with dementia, arthritis, high blood pressure…to the children born with birth defects and learning “disabilities” who are stigmatized…to the imprisoned.  I do what I do because, like I said earlier…It is my calling.  As my calling, I will always seek the intuitive map of my “personal legend.”  Paoulo Coelho is on Point!

Anything Else…

Kindred Souls, we cannot shut our eyes and close our mouths to suffering—a historical and present day reality.  There is much that we can do…together.  Great mentors have said “think unlimited!”  So, think unlimited with me…help me to get the word out in every sector.  Give Séba’s Darkness Cipher a Shout Out on your fb page, twitter feeds, whatsapp groups, blogs, newsletters, etc.  (Indiegogo has a number of tools to help you make it happen!)  Truly, it is my love for humanity…to see us realize and actualize who we really are that makes life so amazing!  Can you feel it—the power and beauty of the greatness that you bring to life!?)  Oh, the light of our gifts, actualized, makes me feel so lifted!    Thank you, Tuau, Gracias…for your love and light Contribution!  I can’t wait to experience your greatness at Séba’s Darkness Cipher!

Personalized Cipher Bookings

Email "Cipher Management" at igniteyourspark01@gmail.com to book Séba's Darkness Cipher for Retreats and a variety of causes and events.  

Staying Connected!

Tweet @DarknessCipher, Instagram @LeapIntoYourWings, Subscribe to Séba’s YouTube Channel: Seba Warrior of Love and check out diverse cipher articles on Séba’s blog www.iyealives.com/blog
story_txt:
Why Cipher?I'm Living Strong So I can get THIS MUSIC OUT! (Ignite this vision with me!)The lyrical poetry of Rhythmic Alchemy that resurrects the sounds of Nina Simone, Maya Angelou, Fela!And all of the GREATS before and beyondWho Glorified their God Essence and Inspired me to Love my own!When you Contribute to the Rhythmic Alchemy Arts Cipher, You help to create a Magnificent Vibration of Healing for your SELF…FOR Everyone! You See, Séba's Darkness Cipher Ignites the Gifted Spirit, Heart and Mind of Young People, Families and Communities All over the World!An Ancient, Indigenous Science of Soul Crafted Artistry IS RHYTHMIC ALCHEMY (RA)!RA’s Soul Stimulating Dynamism Inspires everyone, everywhere, in every environment...to See That:Trauma is Not your IdentityYou are an infinite being!Trauma in family…trauma in society…Must be called out to be cleaned!Trauma is not a secret to be buried within…Trauma must be revealed for healing to begin!Rhythmic alchemy is a symbolic fire ritual of Sounds and movementsFor I&I Self-Cultivation: Heart, Spirit and Mind DisciplineA Luminous Light immersing you in Music, Dance and AffirmationIgniting your HIGHEST VIBRATIONThat, when elevated, ACTUALIZES your gifts and vision!
1. CONTRIBUTE TO THE CREATION OF “GANJÚ, THE OPENING OF SPIRIT: A MUSICAL COMPILATION OF SOUL ROCKIN’, SPINE UNDULATING, CHAKRA AWAKENING DIASPORIC RHYTHMS 

2. CONTRIBUTE TO RASÉ’s YOUTH TRAINING PROGRAM: 12 TEACHINGS ARTISTS TEACHING THE RHYTHMIC ALCHEMY BLUEPRINT TO 40 STUDENTS: FORMULATED MOVEMENTS, MEDITATION & MANTRA FOR TRANSCENDING SUFFERING & ACTUALIZING THEIR GREATNESS as Poets, Scientists, Engineers, Lyricists, Educators, Healers… 


3. CONTRIBUTE TO RASÉ’s “LEAP INTO YOUR WINGS” PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT: ILLUSTRIOUS GRAPHIC DESIGNING OF RASÉ’s SELF-ESTEEM IGNITING AND OPTIMISM VISUALIZING TEE-SHIRTS, BAGS AND PORTRAITS!

When you Contribute to the Production of Séba’s Cipher, you give Rasé Dynamo Arts the fuel to make the Cipher Really happen!  Our teaching artists will have the fuel to spend that vital time with the youth we’ve brought under our wings to teach them the intricate techniques and styles of Séba’s Rhythmic Alchemy Blueprint: the sequences of meditation, yoga, dance choreographies and musical compositions that bring awareness to suffering as well as the practices that empower OUR COLLECTIVE ABILITY to remediate suffering within OUR LIVES and the lives of our interconnected Village. What’s really STELLAR and perhaps very unique about Séba’s Cipher is that it is magnificently interactive!  Every participant who attends the Cipher will be immersed in the artistic infusion of Rhythmic Alchemy!  Every participant will have the opportunity to partake in the esteem lifting affirmations, the gift igniting musical storytelling, the imagination stimulating visual arts and dances that will be co-facilitated by the Stellar youth Rasé artists have trained! Séba's Darkness Cipher is the Creation of A Sacred Space, A Shrine, A Community for Ritual that gives voice to those who have been shut down and Silenced by the catastrophic reality of the cancer of Suffering that plagues many lives in the form of insomnia, depression, anxiety, violence, isolation, fear, dysfunctional relationships.Within the healing walls and purifying sea  of Séba's Cipher, we emphasize, through our art the ways in which we Call out suffering so that we can burn it out!  Call out suffering so that the intuitive ways in which we art to live our lives: courageously, making decisions that reflect Self-love and peace, health, wellness, happiness!--radiates luminously throughout every aspect of our lives—unlocking the gifts of all our treasure!It is RASÉ's mission to show our Youth and to share with all who are willing that which has transformed my life from being a prisoner to Suffering...to embrace revolutionary healing so that we may realize that it is absolutely vital that we not die before we each give life to our light!  Give light to those GIFTS that make your Souls Leap into the Unknown and return with  Stories that Create Legacies for Generations to Come!  For, our gifts are the essence of life, and like nutrients, our happiness and the Fruition of our gifts are Quintessential to this Existence and to all that live beyond...in the luminous Darkness, i.e. "the unknown." So, I invite you to contribute to the flourishing vision of Rasé Dynamo Arts!  And, I wholeheartedly thank you for your affirming contribution!  The very act of your effort catalyzes a Soul lifting and  Self-actualizing vibration that sparks genius and healing in so many Universal aspects of Life!  Take one of my hats, Please!I wonder how many persons know how many different types of hats an entrepreneur has to wear in order to make her dreams come true!  Fitting into so many different hats can become very exhausting and depleting.  Even though I am living my dreams...composing and producing music, creating different dance choreographies, drawing and designing Artwork for products (i.e. t-shirts, bags, etc), performing vital administrative functions (campaign development, promotion, sponsorship, grant writing)...these are a lot of hats because I also have to work in order to survive in NYC! (smile)  I am so grateful that I have connected to my purpose...but, truth be told, doing so much by my lonesome can create sentiments of suffering because it sometimes feels like so many people do not care.  And, to simply say a word about Rasé's efforts that gives something so dynamite and so Vital to our collective experience, is asking too much.  So, the indifference towards something that is not superficial, to something that we healing artists pour our Souls into everyday, I am unafraid to say, can be quite harsh.  So, I am asking you to please share one of my hats with me: contribute any amount you can to the Cipher, spread the world on your social media platforms, purchase a cipher keepsake at leapintoyourwings.com, invite Rasé to your next event.  Experience Us!   A Funny Hat StoryI'd never considered myself to be someone who can draw.  But I had to delve into this craft because I could not afford to commission an artist/graphic designer to design the images for my T-shirt ideas.  But, Eureka!  I can draw?  I can draw!  And, after endless YouTube videos, articles, and days of barely sleeping, I am now proficient in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop!  But, my!  Has the process been time consuming!  Truthfully speaking, I am not superwoman (wink).  And I strive to honor the morals of the Cipher which is to live a balanced life wherein I do not bask in the “glory” of doing it all while I silently treat myself poorly-- accepting a life of sleep deprivation and other poor Self-loving behaviors simply because I aspire to do something great for the betterment of our Lives!  Thus, I openly embrace your support so that I can effectively usher the Darkness Cipher into its truest reflection of healing.Your Contribution covers very essential aspects of the Cipher’s Development & Production:

Cipher Products & T-shirt Production: ordering wholesale shirts, screen printing, packaging & shipping of t-shirts worldwide (and a professional graphic designer to design over 13 visual ideas for t-shirts, books, album cover and accessories).  Paying for official U.S. Copyrighting services of art designs & album and book manuscripts

Where will the Cipher be held? : I’m a New Yorker.  That says it all.  Rehearsal and Production venues are snazzy and pricey.  And, to stay true to the aesthetic of the Cipher, it will be held in a space that reflects the love for my work and the love for the people in attendance (picture a museum…the main gallery of the Brooklyn Museum.  Picture A venue with a complete system: sound and lighting, stage, concessions, bar and vending options…) 

What are the Contents of the Cipher?: As An artistic infusion of musical storytelling, live thematic drawing and dance, the Cipher’s blueprint requires: Professionally trained Musicians (a live band) for intensive rehearsals with NYC youth who will receive training from professionally trained Dancers, Lyricists, Poets and Visual Artists versed in the Cipher’s blueprint.  I don’t believe in the narrative of starving artists…collaborating with artists from the Nuyorican Poet’s Café, Brooklyn Arts Council, etc…who function as quintessential Cipher pillars—facilitators, co-teachers, website developers…requires respectable compensation for their services (Remember, Séba needs her entrepreneur’s hats to abate from 100 to 50 J )

Cipher Album & Book: Studio Recording sessions, Mixing, Mastering & Production of CDs (ancient but necessary)…editing and printing of Cipher Book

Documenting the Cipher: Photography and Videography Services for you to capture this epic experience

The Cipher’s Artistic Presence: Custom made outfits and artist props for Cipher performers: dancers, musicians, singers, poets and fine artists

Cipher Support System: in addition to weekend rentals of a rehearsal space, middle and high school youth of NYC Youth participants need healthy snacks and assistance with transportation expenses and performance scholarships

Cipher Promotion & Continuity: compensation for Cipher manager, cipher booking agent, cipher facilitators and stagehands

story:
First things first,

THANK YOU! I couldn't share my art without you. I'm so thrilled to record this album for many reasons. One of those reasons is that I feel like I've finally found a sound which fits me -- vocally and stylistically. I've been digging in to so much R&B and Soul over the last few years and finally found a way to integrate it into my folk/country singer-songwriter style. Fusion is SO wonderful. Another reason I'm suuuper excited about this album is that it will be recorded live at an old theater with a group of friends who feel like family. 

Your contributions will help pay for these incredible musicians, the recording time, promotions, and music videos. Even spreading the word by sharing the link to this campaign will help tremendously. Thank you, #TEAMGOODNESS! 

••••••••••• LASTLY: 

This album is, in very simple terms, about love. We can always choose love because it is always available to us, even (and especially) in the dark times. My goal with this album is to provide a collection of songs which offer hope, uplift, and encourage you to be your baddest self and pursue magic. 

We got this. 

 

 

With Gratitude and Much Love,

CJ

story:
Summary

Introduction:
Hello, my name is Adam Taitano. Thank you so much for taking the time to consider this indie-go-go project. I am a professional musician aiming to record a full-length LP. In the past, I have recorded at Materials To Outlet, Audio-Cinema, and Jackpot! in Portland, OR. I want to produce a high-quality album in 3-parts, at 3 different studios (Black Diamond, Flatline, and Jackpot!) 
If you haven't heard any of my music before, you can listen to my latest release here.

Description/Importance of the Campaign:
It's always been my dream to make a full-length album that I could be proud of. I want to approach the process as professionally and artistically as possible. This project is extremely important to me because I want to produce songs that people can appreciate, and that showcase my abilities as a musician/artist.

Your Contribution Makes A Difference:
By contributing to this project, you will help me fund the recording and engineering fees for nine days in the studio. This will be just enough time to record and mix twelve songs. It's ambitious, but totally possible. You will literally be expediting the process by which I  can record this album. With your help, I will be able to record and release this album much sooner than without your help. When this LP gets released will be in your hands. And now is the perfect time in my life to make this a reality!

What I Need & What You Get

Break-down of Funding:
As outlined in the previous section, 100% of the funding will go to recording and engineering fees. I want to book 3 three-day sessions at three different studios in Portland, OR: Black Diamond ($1,200 ), Flatline ($1,500), and Jackpot! ($1,650). The total cost will be ($1,200+$1,500+$1,600 =) $3,275.

What You Get In Return:
By donating to this project, you will receive the following: 
1. Access to my entire discography 
2. Demo recordings for the new album
3. A signed CD copy of my current release Dreams of Progression EP,
4. A personalized thank you written by yours truly.
 5. A signed copy of the full-length album (CD) once it has been mastered and produced.
In addition, there are different "perks" if you decide to contribute more than one dollar.

What Happens If The Goal Is Not Met?:
If the goal is not met, I will still put 100% of the funds to the engineering and recording fees. I'll simply find a way to earn enough to cover the rest.

The Impact

This Project's Value (To The World?):
This project is valuable to me because it keeps me centered, focused, and sane. It is (possibly) beneficial to the world because it will provide entertainment and artistic value to people who decide to listen to my work.

On Crowdfunding:
I have never tried to do a crowdfunding project before. To be honest, I realize what an imposition it is, and I feel uncomfortable about it. But, I won't let my fear of burdening you, or my own unease,  prevent me from trying to reach my goal.

Accountability:
I will be as transparent and vocal as possible about the process. You can follow the campaign as I document it, day-by-day on my creative writing blog, "Starting Small."

Risks & Challenges

Potential Issues:
The most daunting hurdle of this project will be forcing "art" in 9 days. I also fear that the pressure of delivering to my friends and family what I promise will weigh on my soul.

How To Solve Them:
I am best when I work under pressure. All my life, I have finished and completed projects and assignments because there were deadlines. This project has no "deadline" but it will be ever-present on my mind that YOU personally helped me achieve my dream of recording a full-length LP. 

The crowdfunding process will force me to work my butt off. I think I am capable and prepared - plus I have the support system in place that allows me to deal with any obstacle or challenge I face.

It will be motivating as hell to deliver on my promises, because I will have a personal connection from your contribution as a driving factor in recording this album.

Other Ways You Can Help

THANK YOU!!!:
The fact that you even took the time to consider this, read my words, and learn a little about my passion means the world to me. If you happen to know anyone who might feel compelled to donate, please spread the word.

SHARE!:
It is easy to share this information with people across all social media platforms using Indiegogo's share tools!!! Just sayin' !

story:
Hi I'm Candice Artist and " You've got mail".. I mean this is "One Fine Day ", no but really this must be "Serendipity" that we are here together! I've always been a hopeless romantic and it shows in everything thing that I've penned. I was so thrilled to share my last single "The loving kind" with you, but oh my goodness that was 3 years ago. Now I can use your help to tell the rest of my silly, humorous, emotional story, that you just might relate to, too.

  Over the years It's been hard trusting a record label. I'm stepping out on my own! Together we can do it. I have the support of a great producer, Jeff Silverman (He produced the Loving Kind!) waiting for me in Nashville. We just need to cover studio, and musician cost, and some economy tickets for me and Alison Chyko (my bff and partner in crime in the video).  

Studio Cost - 1,500

Musicians - 1,000

Travel and Board - 1,000

So why haven't I done this before? I don't think it was the right time. I've lived enough life now to find the right words and to sing it right. There's a certain confidence you gain with time, but I'm still counting on you. Will you be my Loving Kind?SHARE or FOLLOW for more videos. xoxo
